column2: Your mind resonates with the inscrutable thought processes that inhuman aberrations use to communicate.
You're an incredible acrobat, evoking wonder and enrapturing audiences with your prowess.
You’ve studied the routes by which qi flows through the body.
When you are raging, your visual senses improve, granting you darkvision.
Through study of multiple magical traditions, you’ve altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style.
After years of using black powder weaponry in dimly lit spaces, you've become accustomed to dazzling flashes of light and sudden shifts in illumination.
Become trained in another Lore subcategory
You descend from the rare psychic vampires known as vetalaranas.
Gain access to ancestry feats from another ancestry
In the heat of battle, you are capable of amazing feats of strength.
You’ve fiddled with knots, locks, and blacksmith’s puzzles since you were a child to give your hands something to do.
Your eidolon's attack evolves.
You are a friend of shadows and know how to avoid the troubles they bring.
A blade of shearing wind races away from you in a 60-foot line.
You remember more about your previous incarnations than most leshys.
You change your grip on the shield, allowing you to combine rapid attacks with your shield boss or shield spikes and your main weapon's Strikes in a series of swift motions.
Air currents flow upward to slow the target's fall to 60 feet per round.
In place of the normal vishkanyan golden eyes, you were born with especially perceptive snow-white eyes.
You can identify alchemical items quickly.
Craft alchemical items
You have used alchemy to create life, a simple creature formed from alchemical materials, reagents, and a bit of your own blood.
You gain the Alchemical Crafting feat.
Although you may not even be aware, the alghollthus your ancestors once served maintain a stranglehold on the deepest, tethered parts of your mind.
You know how to make the best and most efficient use of a hunted animal's carcass.
Even in the face of overwhelming tribulation, you find solace in the notion that this feeling is fleeting; all things are merely part of a never-ending cycle.
Your elemental heritage is reflected in the oils and fragrances of plants, in tree resin that fossilizes into amber, or in the gentle smell of a flower.
You're so used to handling your implement, weapon, and esoterica in the heat of combat that adding a few bullets or arrows to the mix is no extra burden.
You've learned how to provide for your community, be it through hard-earned sustenance or useful crafts.
The magic of your bloodline mixes with that of your ancestry.
You have extensive knowledge of your ancestors' ancient origins.
Over your extensive lifespan, you've studied many languages.
You have accumulated a vast array of lived knowledge over the years.
By unraveling memories and connections passed down from your progenitors and buried within your unconscious mind, you learn to convert your inherent magic into psychic power.
In the long years since Ghorus's day, you've done pretty much everything at one time or another.
You have a keen interest in the origins of your people.
You descend from an angel, a winged messenger from Nirvana or one of the other celestial realms.
You build a rapport with an animal, which becomes magically bonded to you.
You gain the service of a young animal companion (page 206) that travels with you on your adventures and obeys any simple commands you give it to the best of its abilities.
You hear animal sounds as conversations instead of unintelligent noise, and you can respond in turn.
You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows you to communicate with them on a rudimentary level.
You gain one of the following senses available to your inherent animal: darkvision, low-light vision, or scent (imprecise) 30 feet.
As your connection to water grows, you can see more easily in places with less light, such as the depths of the ocean.
You can deliver silent messages.
You descend from a dragon that wields mastery of their magical abilities, such as a fortune dragon or mirage dragon.
Your eye has been magically enhanced to pierce darkness.
Your physical training encompasses unarmed combat forms.
Cast detect magic at will as an arcane innate spell
You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.
You are practiced in helping yourself and others don heavy gear.
Stone encases you like armor.
Become trained in a type of armor
Like many minotaurs, you take pride in creating items made from stone or metal.

column1: As in Life, So in Death
column2: Specific memories of your old life are hard to hold onto, but you know things without remembering why.
Neither cinders nor winds shall prevent you from seeing those who need help.
You keep the bone of an ancestor or a friend to call upon for advice.
Receive a fixed result on a skill check
You've immersed yourself in community learning, particularly around navigating the waters and tending to animals.
You wield weapons designed to work underwater with ease.
You've been provided a body part designed for combat.
You have come to better understand the process that made your body and the magic that powers it.
You honor your ally’s life, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute.
You become trained in the Lore skill corresponding to one creature type mentioned by your vow (for example, Fey Lore if your heritage is deny the firstborn pursuit).
You have taken the time to learn about the process of awakening and the experiences of your fellow awakened animals.
You once held the head gem of a deceased ancestor or loved one, and it awakened a mysterious power in your own.
When you awakened, primal magic was released within you.
You possess a strong understanding of process among mortals and lawful outsiders alike.
You have learned the history and origins of your people and how to connect to both your land and sea heritage.
You are familiar with weapons that excel underwater.
At home among mire and copse, you flit from river to tree with a dragonfly’s shimmering grace.
Your studies make you informed on every subject.
Earn Income by searching for deals
Heal yourself or an ally in battle
You have an impressive innate ability to tame and command ferocious beasts.
One of your ancestors was a rakshasa, the corrupt and aristocratic reincarnated souls that call Golarion home.
Part of your body has an animalistic influence from a planar creature.
Sometimes taking the shortest distance between two points involves removing an obstacle or two.
Your deity’s blessings manifest in your blood-borne power
The magic in your blood surges in response to your foe's spell.
You can capably deliver toxins with a blowgun.
You launch an insightful quip at a foe, distracting them.
Your connection to your iruxi ancestors manifests as a simple primal spell that you cast using a fragment of an ancestor's bones.
You have a particular elasticity that makes it easy for you to bounce and squish.
Hold your breath longer and gain benefits against inhaled threats
Tapping into the physiology of your draconic ancestor, you can exhale a torrent of energy in a 15-foot cone or a 30-foot line, dealing 1d4 damage.
The fire inside you asserts itself as beaming, radiant light.
Your light cleanses souls of fear.
Your mother was a sea hag, granting you one sea-green or blue eye.
Your elemental ancestor's legacy asserts itself as brackish water, like the seawater of the ocean.
You've built tools into your innovation so you can access and use them easily.
Fire fascinates you.
A condensed burst of flame shoots behind you, propelling you forward with its sheer force.
Your patron’s power fills you with confidence, letting you sustain a magical working even as a quick burst of laughter leaves your lips.
You are among the most common of changelings—those born to sweet hags—and a vibrant green eye signifies that parentage.
Become an expert in a saving throw or Perception
You can see equally well even in dense jungles where only a small amount of light shines through.
The life energy that helped create the first hobgoblins is particularly potent in you, protecting you from ongoing maladies.
Treat falls as shorter than they are
You can regain your energy quickly with a brief nap.
You instinctively twist away from danger.
You are quick at recognizing broad details about people and things around you.
You have a habit of always being in the way when other creatures attempt to move.
Growing up among catfolk has taught you the traditional values of freedom, stewardship, and quick reactions to trouble.
You gain access to all uncommon weapons with the catfolk trait.
You can understand the lowing of cattle and similar animals as its own language.
You can brew magic in your cauldron, creating useful magical concoctions.
You are a cel rau, child of a strigoi, one of the first vampires to walk Golarion.
You can see through darkness.
You were raised with an aasimar or celestial relative, or you've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the celestial realms.
You've learned how to nurture your environment and to care for your people.
You've trained in the weapons favored by your people, becoming a skilled archer and jouster.
You manipulate your exoskeleton to overlap itself.
You have cultivated your exoskeleton's form for close combat, using knots, whorls, and reinforced branches.
Your previous life ended due to sheer poor luck, struck by lightning or choking on a fish bone.
All too aware of your true nature, you’ve studied hags and their powers.
You’ve learned to mimic the abilities of spellcasters by studying their flourishes and words
When you sleep, you turn into an inanimate object a little smaller than a human’s thumb—easily overlooked and carried.
Improve a target’s attitude with your lies
Your cheeks are stretchy, and you can store up to four items of light Bulk or less in these cheek pouches.
You’re adept at hiding your plantlike features to pass as a human.
The fire of your elemental ancestor manifests like dying embers of a blaze, and your inner charcoal helps staunch bleeding, purify simple poisons, and absorb acid.
You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse.
Citizens bolster vacant leadership roles
Your identity as a member of your clan is as central to your sense of self as your dwarven ancestry.
Raised in the ancient halls of Dongun Hold or the surrounding region, you display your lineage with a clan pistol, rather than a clan dagger.
By moving your clan dagger with rapid precision, you can protect yourself more effectively.
Your nanites help purge your body of harmful chemicals and toxins.
Your tail makes it much easier for you to climb.
You were formed from a clone ritual or alchemical experiment.
The subtle strands of beguiling magic leave little impression on your mind.

You collapse into a pile of bones, mitigating the worst of the damage you would have taken, and the triggering attack deals only the amount it would deal on a hit (typically full damage instead of double damage).
You make a telegraphed attack to learn about your foe.
Fight more effectively as you Climb
You commune with the psychic echoes of your ancestors and community, channeling their experiences into yourself.
You are familiar with all the members of your community and their typical movements, and you have learned how to apply these patterns outside those circles.
Rather than hide an object somewhere the inspectors won't search, you're skilled at keeping the object on the move so it's never where they look.
You have learned about your history and your people from shapers.
You have taken it upon yourself to learn the ways of combat to aid with your tasks, perhaps in a role as a corrector.
You find wisdom in the movements of the heavens.
Your experience with bargaining and deciding terms as part of Highhelm's guilds helps you make deals in other situations.
Leaders gain increased bonuses to aid each other
The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness.
You've tended to your coral jewelry so well that you have formed a symbiotic relationship with it.
The smallest of fey have ridden corgis as mounts since time immemorial, leading to a pattern on corgis' backs called a “faerie saddle.
When a foe Casts a Spell that has the mental trait and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own mental magic to disrupt it.
When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your magic to disrupt it.
You grew up in the proud Padishah Empire, where even insults have a certain poetic wit.
Get along in noble society
You lay down suppressive fire to protect allies by forcing foes to take cover from your wild attacks.
Your knowledge of items' construction allows you to discern their magical effects as well.
Your arms flutter like a crane's wings.
You can transform into a small animal or celestial creature to scurry and spy.
You have a powerful creative drive, useful for prevarication and performance.
With pitiful posturing, you cause your foe to pull back a deadly attack.
Once per hour, you can use Change Shape to enter a critter shape.
You can communicate with the simplest of frogs and other similar creatures using longwinded croaks.
Your egg contained your twin, a crocodile.
Your deep understanding of the crossbow allows you to reload efficiently while moving yourself out of the line of return fire.
You have a deep understanding of the crossbow.
When you came of age, you were blessed by the Mother Earth with a thickened skull, which was celebrated as an auspicious sign among your community.
Your jaws can crush bone and bite through armor.
Quell Dissent more efficiently
You know how to stimulate a body's natural healing abilities through the application of resonant crystals.
Your horn glows with bioluminescent color, casting bright light in a 20-foot emanation (and dim light for the next 20 feet).
You've been approached with suspicion and distrust throughout your life and return these sentiments back to the strangers you encounter.
You move your body in a pattern that evokes the small and clever Sister Mousedeer, misdirecting enemies and filling their vision with shadows to hide behind.
When you are wielding your deity’s favored weapon, increase the damage die size of that weapon by one step.
Members of your cult frequently pass themselves off as worshippers of other religions.
Your vision is suited for night or the underground.
With the protection of your shield, you dive into battle! You Raise your Shield and Stride.
A cascade of water blunts or disperses the incoming attack.
You embody an aspect of your deity.
Once, you died because someone—murderer, monster, or soldier— chose to strike you down.
You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against demons.
You call out to your deity in a plea for their aid.
You know more about the habits of devils than is entirely safe.
Die at dying 5, rather than dying 4
Create a second identity for yourself with a different name, history, and background.
Your hands work as effectively as shovels when you need to dig a quick hole.
You hook a foe's bootlaces together, pull their hat over their eyes, loosen their belt, or otherwise confound their mobility through an underhanded tactic.
You knock weapons from the hands of your foes with style.
You have learned to remain hidden by using larger folk as a distraction to avoid drawing attention to yourself.
Your wandering studies mean you've heard rumors or theories about almost every topic...
Your deity’s grace doesn’t extend to your sworn enemies.

From your collection of religious trinkets, you pull out opposing divine objects—such as the religious symbols of two deities that are hated enemies—and combine them in a display that causes discordant clashes of divine energy that are especially distracting to the faithful.
You can trace your lineage to a dragon with almost deific powers, such as a diabolic dragon or empyreal dragon.
You can create illusory wisps of ghostly blue flame.
Your deity bestows a special spell related to their powers.
You're knowledgeable in trades that are important to your people's survival and commercial interests.
You lash out at your foe with both weapons.
Few can sway you from your goals while the fury of combat fills you.
You have an obvious draconic feature, such as sharp claws, a snout full of sharp teeth, or strong reptilian tail, that you can use offensively.
Draconic magic safeguards you against harm.
You have a fraction of the senses of your draconic forebear.
You have an affect that dragonkind find unusually pleasing—and when that fails, you know when to duck.
You've set your mind on learning more about your ancestor and their kin, and perhaps you were even raised by a dragon parent.
Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true—you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.
You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon's tail.
As kin to dragonkind, you project unflappable confidence (that collapses catastrophically against the deadliest foes).
You are the child of a cuckoo hag, making one of your eyes violet or even black.
You and your eidolon have some skills you practice on your own.
You carry your ammunition in a way that allows you to reload while holding two weapons.
Your suli heritage can be traced back to two geniekin ancestors of opposing elements, or to an elemental ancestor that embodied two combined elements.
Learn true and erroneous knowledge on failed check
You either found another duskwalker who taught you the secrets of your kind, or you managed to research your unusual heritage.
You have familiarity with the bo staff, longbow, composite longbow, scythe, and staff
Your earth elemental ancestor's influence manifests in you as dust and dirt, like the soil of a field or the hot desert sands.
You are naturally calm and collected in the face of imminent danger.
You eagerly absorbed the old stories and traditions of your ancestors, your gods, and your people.
Your kin have instilled in you an affinity for hard-hitting weapons, and you prefer these to more elegant arms.
Elves often struggle with underestimating aiuvarins, and you are experienced at telling stories of your accomplishments to gain their respect.
You have an amazing memory for sound.
You've learned a flexible way to position your buckler to provide more protection.
You shroud your arms and held weapons in elemental magic.
You can summon a harmless but impressive elemental display.
You can see in the darkness as easily as an elemental.
A small creature made of elemental matter springs forth from your kinetic gate.
You've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the Inner Sphere.
You have a strong connection with stone and metal.
You are so attuned to the land that you can call forth a bolt of energy from your surroundings.
Your elven blood runs particularly strong, granting you features far more elven than those of a typical aiuvarin.
You have a keen sense for avoiding spurious lines of inquiry.
Your eyes have seen many things in your past lives, and your sight seems to have grown more powerful over your lifetimes.
As much as you might care for them, you've come to terms with the ephemeral nature of non-elves, and it makes their threats feel less troublesome.
You've studied traditional elven arts, learning about arcane magic and the world around you.
While all elves are immune to the paralyzing touch of ghouls, you can shake off flesh-numbing magic of all kinds.
You favor bows and other elegant weapons.
Athamarus have bonded with eels more closely than any other fish.
Your eyes blaze with inner flame.
A peri's roaring spirit burns in your soul.
Nex's Fleshforges shaped you not to achieve individual greatness at arms, but rather to become a part of a legion, a modular piece integral to the combined arms stratagems of Nexian battlemages.
While athamarus' natural pheromones are typically used for communication, you have developed yours into a defense mechanism to ward off foes.
You have created strong mental partitions in your mind to filter out negative emotional influences.
Your malfunctioning emotional processors make it difficult for you to feel strong emotions.
The way you cringe or use those puppydog eyes you've been practicing elicits an empathetic response in the attacker.
You can channel your core's power through the magical gem that serves as your eye.
Your eidolon's heart beats with energy.
Your polite manners and natural ability to comfort others make it easy for you to break down cultural barriers and earn strangers’ trust.
You open a connection to your kinetic gate, large enough for a torch flame to flow.
You've manifested wings that can flutter for brief spurts.
You brace your shield with both hands, enhancing its potential for both offense and defense.
There’s nothing better than being a tanuki, but sometimes you need a less conspicuous form when going into the big city or other crowded places.
You make a controlled follow-up attack, fully accounting for your momentum.
Your eidolon evolves more acute senses.
Prevent critical failures when Earning Income
Conceal items from observers more effectively
Track at your full Speed at a –5 penalty
You aim an explosion from your innovation downward to launch yourself into the air.
A lifetime wielding firearms and explosive ordinance amid the chaos of battle has granted you great skill with volatile weapons.
You can encourage your mount to cover ground quickly.
You can increase the duration of your eidolon's boosts.
You've refined the control you can exert over your elements.
Your rubbery physique makes it easier for you to wedge yourself into tight spaces and more difficult for your enemies to dislodge you.
You use one-handed weapons to parry with style.
Your familiarity with architecture allows you to easily spot subtle stonework.
You've learned to quickly estimate the number of items in a group with relative accuracy at only a glance.
You know good artisanship when you see it and can wax poetic about crafting techniques and forms.
You can see in the darkness as easily as a true vampire.
You gain the service of a young animal companion as a mount.
Droskar knows you may need to disguise yourself in societies that oppose your faith.
You make a pact with a creature that serves you and assists your spellcasting.
You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.
Your incisors have grown into true fangs: long, sharp, and well-suited to drawing blood.
You've learned how to throw a longer distance.
Just as some humanoids find themselves driven to study nature, you are obsessed with the artificial constructs of society and can't get enough.
Perform to fascinate observers
Regain more HP from rest, recover faster from disease
You bear a grudge, inherited from a blasphemous asura forebear in your bloodline, against a particular deity and their works.
Step into difficult terrain
The elemental metal in your soul resonates strongly with iron, bronze, and other sturdy, practical metals suitable for weaponry.
You've learned obscure lessons about your fellow fetchlings.
You've learned the cantrips sprites have used since time immemorial.

Your enhanced fey connection (either through your blood or via prolonged contact with their kind) affords you a warmer reception from creatures of the First World as well as tools to foil their tricks or withstand their magic.
You can see in the darkness as easily as a fiend.
You were raised by a tiefling or a fiendish relative, or you've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the fiendish realms.
A lifetime of proximity to flames has inured your lungs and eyes to smoke.
You've grown up around a forge and are well-suited to dealing with smoke and flame.
Your connection to the First World grants you a primal innate spell, much like those of the fey.
You can gain the magic of the seas by eating your favorite seafood.
An artificial metal object forms in the hands of you or a willing ally within 30 feet.
You deftly dodge out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
You can fly through the air in short bursts at half your land Speed.
Increase your Speed by 5 feet
Your body is as supple as a sapling, capable of bending without breaking.
You've collected a cross-section of information on various disciplines you can refer to when preparing for various tasks.
You apply your flashy techniques to thrown weapons as easily as melee attacks.
A Tiny shape of flame appears, taking a form of your choice— such as a bird, an arrow, or a simple sphere.
When you use Fascinating Performance in a combat encounter, you need only a success, rather than a critical success, to fascinate your target.
Your community recognizes you as a shaman or other animist, a status you obtained through lineage, apprenticeship, or a supernatural event.
You are adept at disguising coded messages as folksy idioms.
Forage for supplies to provide for multiple creatures
You understand principles of forensic medicine, making you better at examining a body to determine the cause of death or injury.
Your magic echoes ominously as you glimpse injury in the target's future.
Your unusual rest cycle allows you to recover faster.
Watching your friends age and die fills you with moroseness that protects you against harmful emotions.
Gain bonuses to Fortify, and Construct or Rebuild certain buildings easier
Mimicking the anemoi—monarchs of the four winds—you propel four creatures.
A crack of your tail sparks wisps of blue energy.
You grow a nourishing nut, vegetable, seed, or fruit.
You don't always have time to wait for your allies to make room, so it's best to politely move them yourself.
The air inside you asserts itself as a toxic miasma, inuring you to most poisons.
You have unusual sensory abilities passed down from your chaotic forebears.
The earth inside you asserts itself as crystallized gemstones or metals, like a cluster of quartz or veins of iron and gold.
Your adaptability manifests in your mastery of a range of useful abilities.
You've trained with weapons used by your genie ancestors.
You tune to the earth and stone around you, extending your senses through it in rippling waves.
The very first memories ghorans have are those of their creation, and even after thousands of years, those memories have never faded for you.
Over the course of your long, long existence, you've had a chance to practice with traditional ghoran weapons.
Your connection to the Boneyard ensures that your blows strike true against spectral beings.
Your elemental lineage manifests in the polished gleam of precious metals.
You are adept at quickly scanning loose papers and carefully discerning the contents of sealed letters without damaging the seal.
You tap into the collected lore of the divine, accessing a variety of potentially useful information.
Your eidolon evolves wings, a buoyant body, or some other means to control descent.
Gloom holds few terrors for you, and the pall of darkness over Nidal has made you comfortable in dim light.
You might have a flighty nature, but when a topic captures your attention, you dive into it headfirst.
Your extensive travels, curiosity, and love of learning help you to learn languages quickly.
You favor unusual weapons tied to your people, such as blades with curved and peculiar shapes.
Your tricks make foes overextend their attacks.
You've picked up skills and tales from your goblin community.
You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position.
You sing annoying goblin songs, distracting your foes with silly and repetitive lyrics.
Others might look upon them with disdain, but you know that the weapons of your people are as effective as they are sharp.
The most important thing you've learned living with fear is how to overcome it.
You lived an insulated life focused on avoiding danger.
You lower yourself to the ground and take an imposing, knuckle-walking stance.
You can extend a tangle of vines or tendrils to support your arms and extend your reach.
You can see in the darkness as easily as a psychopomp.
Others’ attempts to scare you often grant you insights about your would-be bullies that you can then exploit.
Your lineage traces back to a daemon, one of the manifestations of horrific forms of death that devour souls within their foul home of Abaddon.
You are well versed in grippli culture and tactics.
Coerce multiple targets simultaneously
Make an Impression on multiple targets more easily
You are accustomed to exploring thick woodlands and defending yourself against the attacks of magical plants.
When you came of age, your fingernails grew long and sharp.
You’ve nurtured the supernatural abilities gifted by your hag mother, particularly your sight.
A fusillade of jagged splinters flies from you.
You've dutifully learned how to keep your balance and how to stick to the shadows where it's safe, important skills passed down through generations of halfling tradition.
Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you, and to an extent, that might even be true.
You favor traditional halfling weapons, so you've learned how to use them more effectively.
You have a halo of light and goodness that sheds light with the effects of a divine _light_ cantrip.
You can easily craft objects.
You quickly fix your innovation, at the cost of its stability.
Your tail is much stronger than most, and you can lash out with it with the strength of a whip.
You're accustomed to seeing through shifting darkness and bewildering magic.
Wood and bark grow over your body like armor.
The mordant power of your void energy grows.
You look like nothing more than an ordinary toy, doll, or statuette, and you can fool others with your innocuous appearance.
Your size and demeanor make it easy for you to convince others that you mean no harm.
Your powerful ego makes it harder for others to order you around.
Your cunning knowledge grants you the ability to notice the emotional echo of a soul that passed on, leaving a haunt in its wake.
Your vitality is even more vibrant and restorative.
Increase your Bulk limits by 2
Your lineage descends from devils, conniving schemers of Hell.
You're particularly skilled at helping others with a task.
Some flowers can hide their thorns, and yours happen to be hidden along your arms.
You fling yourself out of harm's way.
You've studied traditional hobgoblin exercises and fieldcraft, all of which have a militaristic bent.
You gain access to all uncommon weapons with the hobgoblin trait.
Gather Information rapidly
You bear scars or tattoos enhanced by the mark of your community’s prowess.
Pulling your hair loose into flames and gnashing your teeth into ragged fangs, you howl a vow of ire, and your form surges to meet the demands of your deadly promise.
Your eyes can see through darkness with an oni’s visual acuity.
You take two quick shots against the one you hunt.
Your canny understanding of natural and primal creatures helps you predict and dodge their attacks.
Drawing moisture from the atmosphere, you create a disc of hovering water that deflects attacks.
Hyenas serve kholo as pets and trackers.
You learn the hymn of healing composition spell, which imbues your music with rich melodies that help your allies recover from harm.
Your wild, unique features betray your agathion birthright.
Your ancestors spent their days cloaked and cradled in illusions, and as a result, sensing illusion magic is second nature to you.
Make an Impression with Performance
You are always prepared for fights that frequently disrupt seemingly peaceful times.
You can jury-rig solutions when you don't have the proper tools on hand.
+2 to initiative rolls
Whether you always carried it or perhaps only recently inherited, you have a pusaka— an heirloom containing a spirit who you communicate with in your dreams.
You’ve trained with one of the ranger sects known as wardens, who practice a specialized type of primal magic.
Vague connections to the knowledge and prowess of your past help guide you in tasks that this life might not understand.
You can call the fire inside you into the palm of your hand.
Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence.
You have practice combating plague, and your patients are less likely to succumb to the same disease again for a time.
+1 to Work Camp, Establish Trade Agreement, and Trade Commodities activities
Axis's order suffuses your body and helps it maintain coherency.
You can hide a small object of up to light Bulk inside a hollow cavity on one of your forearms.
Demoralize a creature without speaking
You are accustomed to working alongside others, relying on each other to get by.
Your affinity with process and order makes you a natural artisan.
You can jury-rig your weapons to perform in unexpected ways.
A good laugh comes from the belly, and by laughing every day, yours has grown quite strong.
Your fists have been forged by battle, your naturally tough skin and dense bone further hardened by conflict.
Disobeying your Iron Command has lasting consequences.
Your contrary nature means you bounce back with prejudice.
Your weapons are those you were born with.
Your community bond creates better dynamics when working together.
You are adept at dodging roots, foliage, and other jungle obstacles.
You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps.
Accustomed to the foul air of underground tunnels, your sense of smell is sharpened, and noxious scents are less offensive.
Taldan pride means you never show weakness.
You paid close attention to the senior hunters in your clan to learn their tricks.
You gain access to all uncommon weapons with the kholo trait.
Receive a fixed result on a skill check
You excel at navigating social situations and keeping secrets.
You've picked up a few magical tricks.
You center yourself and call to mind the Vudrani monastic ideals of mindfulness and self-knowledge.
You've spent countless hours studying the history of elves on your world and beyond and are a studied expert in your people's ways.
Whenever you Devise a Stratagem, you can also attempt a check to Recall Knowledge as part of that action before rolling the d20.
You attentively learned key kobold survival strategies from your elders.
You gain access to all uncommon weapons with the kobold trait.
Due to their beautiful colors, ornamental koi are often found in parks and gardens where townsfolk roam.
