You spin out a thread of psychic energy that connects you to an ally, using it as a conduit for your abilities.
The magic of your spell floods into you, overriding your connection to the land around you.
You stand strong in the face of danger and inspire your allies to do the same.
Your presence as an avatar of evil makes your foes more susceptible to terror and makes it almost impossible for them to shake off fear when you are near.
Your power spontaneously evolves or reconfigures itself.
You can climb wooden surfaces using axes.
You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each barbarian archetype class feat you have.
You rush forward, moving enemies aside to reach your foe.
When you cast _shield_, you can modify the spell to create a solid barrier you can use for cover, but not for blocking.
You gain the Base Kinesis impulse.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level wizard feat of your choice.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level sorcerer feat.
You gain your bloodline’s initial bloodline spell.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level inventor feat of your choice.
Your innate ability to fascinate others develops into full-fledged spellcasting.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level alchemist feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level investigator feat of your choice.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level champion feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level cleric feat.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level swashbuckler feat of your choice.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level barbarian feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level ranger feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level monk feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level fighter feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level magus feat of your choice.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level bard feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level oracle feat of your choice.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You have learned limited divine magic from your Red Mantis training.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level gunslinger feat of your choice.
The stars move, granting you a sliver of their magic.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You increase your ability to cast spells.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level summoner feat of your choice.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level thaumaturge feat of your choice.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level psychic feat of your choice.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level rogue feat.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level druid feat.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level witch feat of your choice.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
Though not powerful enough for flight, your wings can deliver a thrashing to anyone who gets close.
With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy’s strengths and weaknesses.
You can speak with animals.
You've regained beastkin protections after becoming a full werecreature.
You siphon spell energy into one weapon you’re wielding, or into one of your unarmed attacks, such as a fist.
You can set snares specifically for big prey, leaving smaller creatures unscathed.
You fire your weapon as you jump, using the kickback to go farther.
Flames flow out of you in a cascade, engulfing everyone in a 30-foot cone.
Your uttered prayers become an aegis, drawing the blessing of your deity across the surface of your shield.

Your experience battling undead has uniquely prepared you to fight the diseases they inflict on the survivors, and you know that leaving these maladies untreated for long will eventually lead to more undead.
You gain the protector’s sacrifice domain spell
The Old Sun Gods share their power with you.
Your eidolon inflicts bleeding wounds on a telling blow.
You can find the one weak point in a creature's scales, wards, or armor to get past its resistances.
Your skill at crafting is unparalleled.
Shimali Manux trains every Salt Breaker to fight in the cramped quarters below deck, and you've learned how to use these techniques with your crew.
You've learned how to cloud your foes' minds with the brutal impact of your repeated attacks.

The fiery blaze of your weapons combined with your unorthodox technique leaves your opponents with little opportunity to capitalize on any gaps in your defenses, or properly defend themselves against your onslaught.
You can Shove and Trip larger creatures.
You've trained in one of Goka's oldest traditions of espionage, intimidation, and combat mastery.
Your flesh gives way as you're struck, becoming coarse sand that can magically turn your enemy to stone.
You have calculated all the angles to maximize a bomb’s splash.
You’re mystically connected to your wizardly tools, ensuring you can always find them when you’ve misplaced them.
Your ability to captivate others borders on the preternatural.
You gain a sixth sense for traps, noticing them even when you're not trying to.
You learn the focus spell listed under your emotion's entry.
You fly the banner of your pledge from your mount, raising your allies’ spirits.
You Command an Animal to order your mount to Stride twice.
You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each champion archetype class feat you have.
You know that for the best disguise to work, one requires not only the right skills but also the right look—luckily you can copy both using special magical techniques.
You siphon the energies of life and death through a melee attack and into your foe.
You developed a method to chemically purify and consecrate your bombs on the fly.
You hook into the target, pulling yourself forward and rending flesh.
Your fingernails grow into razor-sharp claws, and scales speckle your fingers, hands, and wrists.
You climb like a spider.
You enter a tightly coiled stance, with your hands poised as venomous fangs.
You use a performer’s cold reading techniques, aura reading, and other tricks to discover your foe’s strengths and weaknesses.
You gain the Command Undead feat, but you can use it only to transform the effects of _harm_ spells you cast on mindless undead.
You grasp the animating force within an elemental creature and bend it to your will.
You grasp the animating force within an undead creature and bend it to your will.
You can urge your companion to do its utmost.
You volunteered for a controversial experimental procedure to install clockwork prosthetic eyes.
You can squeeze out of tight situations by twisting and bending your body into unnatural positions, gaining an advantage against foes that try to pin you down.
You easily tend to the wounds of the dead.
This display emits a cascade of loud bangs or glittering trails.
With a rousing call, you exhort an ally to advance.
You've found comfort in the forms of other creatures, insulating yourself from feelings of fear.
The harm you deal with your corrupting touch saps the strength from your enemy's body.
You hide your magic in the croak of a frog, in the sway of the trees, in the howl of the wind, and the flicker of the will-o'-wisp.
You can use Arcana, Occultism, Religion, or Society to Decipher Writing by meditating before a crystal, regardless of the type of writing.
Your study of crystals and the energies held within a gem’s facets grants you special arcane crystal ward spells.
Your devotion to the cycle of souls grants you an additional divine spell.
With a burst of speed, you leap into the air, slashing with your hands.
You dash past an opponent, confounding them with underhanded tactics.
You've trained yourself to maintain a strong sense of direction at all times, even when you can't use a compass or see the sky above.
When you attempt to Demoralize, you can make it harder for the target to flee, in place of the action’s normal effects.
Your eidolon blocks attacks against you.
You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
You gain a bonus to your own checks when Aiding an ally.
When you're on a case, you stay watchful and resolute to avoid tricks your suspect might pull.
Your Spellstrike sweeps are so wide and devastating, they splash onto nearby foes.
Your experience in the finer points of bargaining with a devil has awakened a sinister power that now inhabits your left eye.
You gain a devotion spell of your choice listed in the devotion spells class feature
You've learned Devrin Arlos's guileful ways, and his sly teachings help you remind your allies to keep their wits about them.
Devrin Arlos has a habit of using whatever is at hand to temporarily blind others in combat.
Your Hellknight training drilled details of Hell’s denizens deep into your mind.
You can shape the energy you channel in a single direction.
With deft and practiced movement, you block at an angle to potentially dislodge the weapon.
Your ability to twist your opponents’ bodies into painful locks and holds makes you particularly adept at escaping such predicaments.
Make a melee Strike against your prey.
You flow around your foe, using the magic of your attack to carry you away.
You know how to maintain a good impression and manage your image, even while keeping uncouth company.
You weave distracting magic with one hand to enhance your Spellstrike.
Your internal organs and blood vessels have shifted and changed, and even you don't know precisely where in your body they are.
The divine might provided by your bloodline flows through you.
You pour energy into the subject of your healing to empower its attacks.
You've modified your armor with fins, rotors, and other devices to make it easy for you to move through the water, plus mechanical gills that can help you extract breathable air from water.
You move to provide immediate care to those who need it.
You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession.
You enhance your spell with elemental water, soaking the target.
You enhance your spell with elemental water, soaking the target.
Your sense of smell is uncanny, much like a dragon's.
You've discovered how to add the magic of dragons to your tradition.
Putting on a grim face for the battle ahead, you encourage your allies to strike fear into their foes with vicious attacks.
You capitalize on your enemies’ fear to slip past their defenses.
A second energy dwells in your eidolon.
You know how to throw two weapons as easily as strike with them.
You've built your innovation with replaceable interlocking pieces that you can use to transform it into another type of weapon entirely.
You snap your free hand over to grip your weapon just long enough to add momentum and deliver a more powerful blow to your opponent.
You carry your ammunition in a way that allows you to reload while holding two weapons.
Select one enemy you can see and proclaim a challenge against it.
Increase your initiative with the dueling sword.
You’ve practiced an impressive spin technique with your construct, automatically attacking in tandem as you launch each other through the air.
With the utmost gratitude for your help in releasing them from their unearthly coil, a tiny sliver of a ghostly entity has remained attached to you.
You shroud yourself in ashes that hide the vital essence sought by life-sensing undead.
Thanks to the time you've spent studying and experimenting, you know how to scale your formulas into larger batches that don't require any additional attention.
You are more efficient at exploring uncharted territories.
You embellish your spellcasting with entrancing flourishes and grand pronouncements, making it harder to identify or counter.
You bend your opponent’s body or limbs into agonizing positions that make it difficult for them to maintain their grip.
Your body becomes infused with elemental earth.
Your familiar becomes an elemental spirit capable of taking on aspects of the elements.
You can call the elements to you.
You immediately Raise a Shield or cast _shield_.

You believe that treating others with respect is the fastest way into their hearts, and in turn others are more likely to believe in your good intentions and write off bad first impressions as flukes.
You've learned how to make your personal energy last just a little bit longer when quickly brewing ad hoc concoctions.
You are practiced at working in vast garages of vehicles and can work on many machines at a time.
The more you try to force your body to stay yours, the more it warps to channel the energy flowing through you.
You've traversed enough untamed wilderness to gain an intuitive understanding of the dangers that exist in such places.
You shine brightest in desperate moments.
Your follow-up blow leaves you an opening to set your shield.
Your Gray Gardener training has made you deeply skilled with the weapons that execute with a swift chop to the neck.
You've learned to attract, quell, and purify spirits, housing them in a special receptacle called a _spirit dwelling_ until they're ready to move on.
You have long venerated one of your deity’s lesser-known aspects
When you perform the _harrowing_ ritual, the DC for the Primary Check is never more than the standard DC by level, and the cost for the ritual is halved.
You excel at quickly dispatching your foes.
Learn how to better spot danger at a distance.

column1: Fake It Till You Make it
column2: When you take on a role, you become more capable with all sorts of tasks involving that role.
Under your tutelage, your familiar has grown attuned to the hidden currents of the world and can serve as a conduit for your magic.
You regularly face off against undead and can identify many with a glance.
When selecting master abilities, you can choose an ally to benefit from any specific master ability.
You’ve forged an empowered mystical bond with your familiar.
You show off your fighting style to discourage your foes.
A good getaway requires a good distraction.
Your experience in the field has taught you how to focus your aim at a distance, increasing your accuracy.
Surprisingly agile even in a breastplate and carrying a full rucksack, Marcos Farabellus developed this evasive maneuver during one of his many adventures.
Your rage is a frenzy of rapid movements.
You have studied a specific type of wild creature and can hunt it more easily.
You feast upon an adjacent restrained or unconscious creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour.
The eyes and noses of animals are naturally sharper than most humanoids.
You always have a special batch of preserved liquor ready for each day.
You have trained yourself to continue fighting even when your body is screaming for you to stop.
You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have.
As stubborn in death as you are in life, you vow you'll never aid your hated enemies.
You’ve learned how to land daring blows when you have panache.
Your connection to heat and flame means that fire is reluctant to bring its full force to bear against you.
Your Firebrand training has taught you that achieving something is more satisfying if you boast about it first.
You gain your mystery’s initial revelation spell.
Your panache allows you to perform incredible feats: climbing, swimming, and leaping far beyond your normal capacity.
To rush after a criminal or reach someone in need, you ring a sprightly tone.
Your flurry is a combination of maneuvers.
You've learned the secret of swatting away annoying pests and occasionally getting an easy meal out of it.
You launch yourself at a foe.
You continue Juggling until the end of your next turn.
You can pull bits of wisdom from any tale.
When you cast _mage hand_, you can modify it to shove a creature.
You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you.
With additional care and effort, you can take on an alternate shape for a longer period of time.
You lament your fate, realeasing a ghastly moan that frightens the living.
Rather than just using your gadgets for various boosts and tweaks, you also craft a few specific temporary consumable gadgets each day.
Snares you create have complicated inner workings that are quite difficult to disable.
You alter your weapon's phase so it can more easily strike incorporeal creatures.
Spirits around you coalesce upon your fists, enabling you to seize and harm other ghosts and spirits.
Your ghostly form becomes innately weaker but also gains resistance to many forms of damage.
You have studied giants and hunt them with efficiency.
Your time gossiping in fashionable salons keeps you informed on every topic.
You can influence spirits and haunts
Your time with the Knights of Lastwall has taught you the secrets of creating and improving upon Lastwall soup.
You've received the basic training developed for all Greenwatch recruits.
Your guard is up, even while moving.
You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.
Your flair keeps foes' attention, as your motions with your gun draw your foes into a deadly game.
You manipulate the currents of your spell's energy, allowing you to gracefully glide with your wings.
You've expanded your focus spellcasting to techniques used by clerics and wizards.
You can restore your health by tapping into your qi.
You draw a card from your harrow deck just before you cast a spell to infuse your magic with its destined potential.
You loudly declare the creature's life forfeit by your judgment
Make an unarmed melee Strike against a prone target.
You can heal your animal companion's wounds.
You can add a foamy catalyst to an elixir of life to turn it into a topical projectile.
Your magic extends to your garments.
You've learned to hide the magical auras of your gear.
Your throat has multiple separate chambers that can give your voice an eerie echo.
Your clockwork devices can commandeer the bodies of undead, bending them to your will.
As your spell strikes a target, you plant a beacon in the target's mind that announces its presence to those nearby.
You establish a safe house where you can prepare for your hunt.
You make a ranged Strike with your thrown weapon, Stride, and then Interact to draw another weapon.
Gain the conflux spell from a hybrid study of your choice.
The ancient ice-crafting techniques of the saumen kar awaken within you.
You can create a permanent stone object, either sculpting stone pulled directly from your kinetic gate or manipulating earth and stone around you.
You breathe, allowing your golden core to release qi into the meridians governing your lower body, and break into a burst of speed that could shame arrows in flight.
You stab two foes with a single thrust or bash them together with one punch.
You’ve trained your mount to become a powerful force on the battlefield.
You find it easy to attract a powerful and unusual familiar to your side.

When you make a Strike with an improvised weapon you're wielding, you gain a +1 item bonus to the attack roll, and you can have the Strike deal two weapon damage dice instead of the improvised weapon's normal number.
People often only see what they want to see, a weakness you know how to take full advantage of.
You attune your great skill in performing to another, granting them a small measure of your skill as though anyone could do it.
Your link to your eidolon becomes stronger, granting it a new ability.
You become a brilliant example of dedication and poise in battle, encouraging your allies to follow suit.
You show defiance in times of hardship and inspire your companions to persevere.
Even as your firearm misfires, you quickly draw a backup weapon.
You attack your foe and analyze how it reacts.
You've developed control over how your body processes alchemical poisons and drugs.
You are skilled at noticing the telltale signs of ghosts and hauntings.
You play out battles in your head, allowing you to strike when the time is right.
You can mix an aromatic salve into an elixir with the healing trait to soothe physical maladies.

Your face bears an intricate magical tattoo known as the _irezoko_, a badge of your understanding of your chosen field of magic and a recognition of your advancement within Absalom's College of Mysteries.
Your skill and dedication have set you on a path to master the techniques of Jalmeray's greatest martial artists.
You temporarily change your weapon's shape to assist you in the field.
You enchant your _ka stone_ and can use it to wield magic.
You’ve sworn an oath to defend the helpless from dangerous titanic beasts, including kaiju that roam the surface of Golarion.
You attack carefully to knock some sense into a creature whose actions aren't their own.
Inspiration lets you surpass your preconceptions of your spells' limits.
Kreighton teaches his students that an agile mind can glean clues leading to the truth, even from the most unlikely of sources.
You quickly wrap your lash around an opponent and pull them toward you.
You wreath yourself in molten stone and hurtle toward your enemy.
You sweep your foe into your dance.
The leaf order’s secrets allow your familiar to take advantage of its leshy form.
You're adept at noticing the tells of a liar—sweat, flushing, a quavering voice, a quickening pulse.
You learn the _lifelink surge_ link spell.
You’ve learned to call upon light to reveal what is hidden.
For an instant, you transform yourself into a being of pure lightning and fly forward, shocking anyone in your way.
The chill of ice entered your veins and never left, adjusting the internal temperature of your body.
You have linked your bonded item to the well of energy that powers your school spells.
You've trained with the weapons of the Bright Lions.
Roots and branches of living wood writhe in elemental fire at your command, forming a bonfire fearsome enough to scare off predators in the night.
You shuffle your feet to dislodge the surface beneath you or otherwise cause your opponent to become unsteady.
Your unpredictable gunfire often catches enemies off guard or hits unprotected areas.
You’ve learned how to move as one with crowds and hide among them.
Force your foe to reroll the triggering attack
You can alter your form to gain an aspect of the animal your mask represents.
You can transform fully into the animal your mask represents.
You've learned those tidbits of magic that are most conducive to furthering your acquisition and transmission of knowledge.
While study is key to your success, a bit of magic can be a helpful aid in discovering the secrets of the past.
You can sneak spells past your foes’ defenses as easily as any blade.
A magnetic field surrounds you.
You've undertaken the ultimate challenge of the Mammoth Lords and tamed a megafauna.

Against humanoids, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to Lie, and to Diplomacy checks to Gather Information and Make an Impression.

 Once per day, you can cast _charm_ as a divine innate spell using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.
Your mask takes on a personality of its own, allowing it to serve as your familiar.
You have mastered the opening steps to the Masquerade of Seasons, a dance that channels the power of spring, summer, winter, and autumn.
Your animal companion has grown up over the course of your adventures, becoming a mature animal companion and gaining additional capabilities (page 211).

All of your animal companions grow up, becoming mature animal companions and gaining additional capabilities.

Your animal companion has greater independence.
You activate gears, explosives, and other hidden mechanisms in your innovation to make a powerful attack.
You subtly weave your spellcasting into a performance.
Your experiences in combat shape your mind's capability to strengthen and shape your weapon to match the way you move in combat.
Your touch soothes the body or mind.
When you are in your social identity, you can also grant a social identity to an animal companion, familiar, pet, or other minion you gained from a class feature or feat.
Your dynamo has modular configurations, allowing you to swap between various different possibilities with ease in order to adapt to various situations in combat.
You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each monk archetype class feat you have.
You know a proper breakfast should have a variety of sides.
Your reckonings have prepared your body for physical punishment.
You become trained in medium and heavy armor.
You make a quick attack and rob your foe in the process.
You use multiple languages to create and break codes.
It is a tradition among artillerists to name the siege weapon most important to them and closest to their heart—much as a sailor on a ship, the weapon is their livelihood.
You can use an animal as a conduit for your magic.
Water flows around you, letting you cut through the waves as if born to it.
Gain resistance to necromancy effects and damage.
As part of your training, you've inured yourself against necromancy through grueling, repeated exposure.
As long as you have an audience, you can continue to perform even when you are on the brink of collapse.
You have an innate connection with other creatures of the night and understand some of them.
You prefer to use nonlethal means against living opponents, but the weapons you carry are lethal enough to destroy undead.
You can mix alchemically preserved peppers into an alchemical food consumable to spice it up with alchemical fire.
You've gained an intuitive sense about creatures.
You draw power from the obscure secrets of the universe.
Your connection to your bound terrain strengthens, making you unhindered by local weather.
You're always investigating what's around you, even as you perform other activities.
You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.
You gain the initial order spell from your order.
You understand the principles that underlie all written words, allowing you to read nearly any text.
Every good Firebrand knows that style can be as important as substance—so long as you don't screw up the delivery.
With a great heave, you seize a piece of your surroundings, such as a boulder, log, table, wagon, or chunk of earth, and hurl it at your foes.
You've sworn a pact with fey powers, granting you the otherworldly appearance of your dreams in exchange for oaths of hospitality.
You break a trinket such as a lodestone or jade pendant in two, creating a sympathetic link between the halves that bridges distance.
Your shots hit simultaneously.
You jump back and make a quick shot that catches your opponent by surprise.
You can patch up damage to an object with a quick fix.
You enter a tall and proud stance while remaining mobile, with all the grace and composure of a peafowl.
You call upon insight from your training to recover accuracy.
You gain the Monastic Weaponry monk class feat.
You have a mastery over your own movement and can distribute your weight to dance lightly over the ground like petals drifting on the water.

You can pronounce and repeat words with near-perfect accuracy even if you don’t understand their meaning, and you can write them down in a phonetic script that allows you or another creature with Phonetic Training to read it later.
You're particularly skilled at wielding the weapons used traditionally by pirates.
Precious metal flows from your fingers to plate an object.
You show off for the crowd.
You apply a contact poison or injury poison to the required weapon; if you have a free hand, you can Interact to draw a poison as part of this action.
Poisons attack specific parts of the body—one venom might target the lungs, another the circulatory system, while another deteriorates the nerves.
Although the divinations of a haruspex traditionally require organs and lengthy interpretation, you've learned how to glimpse the future in a more simple fashion by reading creatures' wounds.
By spending 1 minute giving guidance to help hunt down your prey, you instruct up to five willing creatures to assist you.
When you create an elixir as an herbal item, you can prepare it as a poultice instead.
You throw the vehicle into a barely controlled skid, turning sharply to evade pursuit or bring your weapons to bear.
You can push larger foes around with your attack.
You coat a weapon you're wielding in prayers and the divine power given to you by your deity.
By observing an opponent, you can get a sense of their next move and prepare to counter or resist it.
You can call upon the creatures of the wild for aid.
You siphon residual psychic energies from your spell into one weapon you're wielding or one of your unarmed attacks and when you unleash your mind, the energies flare to match.
Through experience and in-depth visualizations of mental battles, you've grown adept at psychic duels.
Your familiar becomes a masked psychopomp—an extraplanar guardian of the cycle of souls.
You call to your ally and strengthen their resolve and abilities to defend against the horrific tricks undead bring to bear.
Your swarm's stings burn with agonizing pain, much like that caused by the bright red pyre ants that make their tunnels within the parched sands of deserts like Qadira.
You can attach a  <%CONSUMABLES%19%> talisman <%END> using only a bit of glue and some string.
When you start to Juggle or add another item to those you are Juggling, you add two items instead of one.
You and your mount can spring into action at a moment’s notice.
You turn your foes’ flanking against them with a quick reverse.
You draw your bow and attack with the same action.
During your daily preparations, you can study a particular subject to gain the trained proficiency rank in one Lore skill of your choice.
Physical obstacles can't hold back your fury.
You conjure a red raincloud in a 10-foot burst within 60 feet, which pours rust-colored rain directly below it.
You present your religious symbol emphatically.
You learn the rallying anthem composition cantrip, which protects you and allies.
You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have.
Thorny vines grow in geometric patterns on surfaces in your kinetic aura.
Hungry for the flesh of the living, you hurl yourself into the fray, teeth gnashing.
You've learned to move your spiritual energy past yourself to attack spirits where others can't.
You abruptly dismiss your eidolon to reduce the damage it takes, though this makes summoning it again more difficult.
You keep pace with a retreating foe.
You gain the Reactive Strike reaction.
Rebellions require an intricate knowledge of one's surroundings—because you might need to escape at any moment.
Grab an item thrown at you.
You redirect a mutagen within your body to spit a stream of stomach acid at a foe.
You were schooled on a wide variety of creatures you might encounter.
Taking advantage of the brutal efficiency of hacking away at a target with two slashing attacks, you've mastered the art of punishing a foe caught between your slices.
You become trained in the repeating hand crossbow and gain access to repeating hand crossbows and shootist bandoliers.

When you devour corpses and satiate your hunger, you also recover from some of your wounds, your necrotized blue flesh knitting back together almost immediately as soon as you begin shoveling the chunks of dead flesh down your throat.
Any shield you wield gains the shove trait.
You balance both sides of the scales, restoring yourself while striking a foe.
You spend 10 minutes meditating with your harrow deck, then draw a card.
You adapt a creature to living and moving in water.
Your nigh-constant tinkering and fiddling with objects means you are able to reverse engineer items into formulas more effectively than most.
You've learned to debilitate your enemies in the same way a hunter tears at their prey.
Your patron grants you the power to summon other creatures to aid you.
Careful research into the art of rituals has made you better at performing them.
You have begun to master the difficult art of casting rituals.
You run and climb across ropes and rigging almost as easily as on the ground.
You can reload your weapon on the move.
You subtly damage others’ equipment.
By right of ritual or sheer stubbornness, you have claimed rulership of the land.
You pray continuously for 1 minute to call a subtle shadow of your deity’s realm over a 30-foot burst centered on you.
The power of your faith suffuses your ki
Add _chill touch_, _death ward_, _disrupt undead_, _disrupting weapons_, _holy cascade_, _magic stone_, and _sunburst_ to your spell list.
You’ve sworn an oath to protect the holy places within nature and the spirits that dwell within, from ancient trees to primordial wild guardians.
Elements are wild and dangerous, but you've found ways to reduce their risk.
You establish a safe house—a secure space in which to hide your secrets from the outside world.
You're often careful to be sure you're not hoisted on your own petard, or anyone else's, for that matter.
Scales grow across your body, protecting you against physical and magical threats.
Your stratagems benefit from your precise knowledge of anatomy.
When you are struck with the mightiest of blows, you can flex your muscles to turn aside some of the damage.
You gain a spirit guide ally.
You drop your disguise at the right moment and surprise your target.
You meander around unpredictably, and then ambush your opponents without warning.
You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger, granting them each a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls.
Those you shield can benefit from your lasting protection.
Your devotion to discovering and hoarding abstruse truths borders on the fanatical, and you can bring this devotion to bear.
You draw the moisture you've drained from others into your own flesh, temporarily taking on the appearance of life.
You read the body language of an intelligent creature within 30 feet and pick up on subtle cues to detect its general propensity for good or evil and law or chaos.
While in ursine form, you gain low-light vision and scent (imprecise) 30 feet.
Your studies open up new horizons.
Hidden darkness whispers to you, teaching you secrets of shadow beyond other spellcasters of your tradition.
When you would gain a benefit from your terrain attunement, you can grant it to one ally within 30 feet instead of yourself.
You spend 10 minutes communing with spirits of earth and stone, requesting shelter.
When your shield is up, your enemies’ blows can’t touch you.
When you cast _light_, you can modify its target to be 1 melee weapon.
You can operate a siege weapon with fewer than the minimum number of crew, at an increasing penalty.
Your eidolon can shrink to fit into small spaces.
Your eidolon gains a 1st-level skill feat and a 2nd-level or lower skill feat.
You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them.
You've dedicated yourself to studying ancient techniques and memorized minor prayers against undead to swiftly dispatch them.
You've learned to manipulate states of consciousness, beginning with your own.
You give a quick shout, hoping to shake the fog clouding your ally’s thoughts.
You specialize in creating quick traps to obstruct your enemies on the battlefield.
You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals 1d4 damage, increasing to 1d6 at 6th level.
Your magical power grows as the shard's icy influence spreads ever deeper into your being.
The howling wind and precipitation of your magic turn to thick snow.
You can leverage your vow in more social interactions.
You have built a reputation for yourself in your social identity.
You often dance alone with a grace exceeding that of most other performers, carrying yourself with a poise and confidence that draws the attention of those around you.

Your ostilli can use its stored magic to help staunch your wounds, granting you the Administer Ambient Magic action.

 **Administer Ambient Magic** <actions string="Two Actions" /> (healing) **Frequency** once per hour; **Effect** Your ostilli pulses a calm lavender color as it converts stored magic into a curative balm.
You strive to change the outcome with sheer zeal.
You can channel the power of your constellation into a unique technique.
You inscribe a circle of arcane runes that dampen enemies’ magic.
The magical runes on your body grant you several magical abilities.
You gain the magus's Spellstrike activity.
You imbue your companion with the aspect of another animal.
Your ability to confront incorporeal menaces develops into full-fledged spellcasting.
You're familiar with the danger that lingering spirits can pose to an unwary adventurer.
Though no one sees them and only you can hear them, the spirits around you constantly chatter, save when you are raging.
You fragment a ranged spell.
You bridge a language gap, repeating the message in a different language that you know.
Your enhanced visual gear includes a regulating scope and reflectors, combined in an ingenuous setup that allows you to see around corners within the area of your overwatch field.
You pull punches to give a better show.
You strike out when your foe tries to flee.
Long hours in darkened observatories have sharpened your senses.
Starlight shines in your sight, enhancing your perception and range.
Confident in your technique, you don't easily lose your concentration when you Cast a Spell.
You wear your armor like a second skin, taking comfort in the protection it offers.
You encourage an ally to toughen up, giving them a fighting chance.
You learn to call a powerful guardian of earth and stone to your side.
Your skin takes on the hardness of stone.
You have such familiarity with obscure texts that you can compel them to reveal their secrets.
You learn your foes' strengths and weaknesses by watching them move.
You've trained extensively in fighting the undead.
You find the most strategic options for you and your allies.
You can attach a scroll to your weapon or _handwraps of mighty blows_ to blend its spell into an attack, carefully folding it around a part of the weapon or sealing it to the weapon's surface.
You've studied the staff extensively to learn the hidden capabilities of your chosen weapon.
When you cast _summon instrument_, you can modify it to summon multiple instruments.
You can unleash burning sunlight from your sword or spear.
Your scent is preternaturally sharp, and you can always rely on your sense of smell to help guide you when your vision is compromised.
Flexing your entire body, you heave your opponent over your head and slam them into the ground.
You know the secrets of moving in your favored terrain.
You act before foes can react.
You install one prepared snare for deployment in a space that's occupied by an enemy.
You swagger readily into any fight.
Your undead physiology allows you to leap quickly toward or away from your opponent.
You make a wide, arcing swing.
You collect your patron’s magic into one of your witch armaments, causing them to shine with runes, light, or another signifier of your patron.
You can expertly control your living hair and use it to perform various tasks.
Your ostilli can sense nearby spellcasters.
Diving into a moving vehicle and seizing the controls is nothing new for you.
Your long clawed legs let you catch enemies to either side.
You and your eidolon move together.
Your victims tend to expire long before your poisons, since the latter have been specifically formulated to last longer.
You have mastered movement in many different environments.
Your mastery at surviving in the wild has given you a sort of sixth-sense when it comes to noticing creatures that aren't part of the natural order.
Your studies into the supernatural have resulted in an especially strong knowledge of rituals.
You make your foes fall painfully when you trip them.
You direct waves of warmth into or out of your kinetic gate to drastically shift the temperature around you.
Recalling Knowledge adds creatures to your list, granting you bonuses to Recall in future encounters.
You can create a prototypical creature from the depths of your imagination instead of calling one from elsewhere.
You open your senses to numerous visions of the immediate future.
You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level kineticist feat of your choice.
You’re well-versed in weapons that allow you to bring bounties back in one piece, or at least alive.
When you cast _sigil_, you can modify the spell to allow you to track the target.
You use glimmering gears and gnashing mechanisms to manufacture snares using specialized parts.
You treat an adjacent creature in an attempt to reduce the clumsy, enfeebled, or sickened condition.
Your spotter's quick signals help you make even difficult shots seem simple.
You’ve sworn an oath to ferret out and destroy malevolent shapechangers who pose as mortals with evil intent.
You learn the triple time composition cantrip, which speeds up you and your allies for a round.
A slew of logs eject from the Plane of Wood and slam into your enemies.
Using your shield, you guard against the movement of foes as surely as if you were a wall of stone.
After failing a test of skill, you hop back in your personal timeline so you can try again.
The Sapphire Butterfly is not one for violence when simply intimidating a foe will do.
Your movements with two weapons are so swift and disorienting that they befuddle your opponent.
You use your two weapons to parry attacks.
You sweep across the battlefield in a fluttering of movement honed from years of coordinating perfectly spaced movements alongside fellow dancers.
Your thrown weapons seem to defy physics as they soar through the air and spin back to you after a strike.
Your presence has a bolstering effect on your undead minions.
You gather your curse around you and impel it to pour outward, expanding your maelstrom.
Your ostilli's darts can deal different types of damage.

You’re always tweaking your
available repertoire.
Your eidolon gains tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.
From childhood, you have been exposed to traditional viking combat techniques, and you soon learned to handle axe, sword, and shield in battle.
The force of your mind unleashing itself wracks your enemies with a violent shockwave.
You easily command the attention of others, and when the time comes to turn threats into action, your authoritative voice causes foes to falter.
You gain a tattoo that serves as a special ward to defend you against Walkena's forces.
Pathfinder agents serve as members of diverse teams with complementary skill sets.
Access a new cantrip by using your Wayfinder.
Your swarm can spin dense webs much like those left by stone-gray weaver spiders under eaves and in derelict city buildings, especially along the coasts of Varisia.
When you generate a wellspring surge, roll twice on the Wellspring Surges Table and take the result of your choice.
A whirling grindstone made of flint appears in an unoccupied square within 30 feet.
When you cast _dancing lights_, you can modify it to create a single floating light in the shape of a Tiny creature.
You rush forward, flapping your wings for a bit of lift, and can use that momentum to knock down a foe.
Bone-chilling, swirling sleet surrounds you, cruel as deepest winter.
With a bit of hide, some antlers, and some cast-off fur, you can create a disguise that will fool even an experienced hunter.
You emulate the senses of the cave worm.
Your flesh grows thick and bloated, protecting you against harm.
You roar in pain, awakening the rage within you.
Some Firebrands can't stand it when their allies are ruining their moment, and you're no different.
When the inspiration strikes, you can weave messages for animals into your compositions.
You consume a piece of your enemy, absorbing their strength.
You've trained to serve as a mount, if only for your most trusted allies.
You’ve continued adapting your magic to blend your class’s tradition with your adapted tradition.
Your ocular processors are augmented with advanced targeting systems, which allow you to more easily pinpoint your enemy and read their movements.
Your diet has strengthened you against diseases and poisons.
You work at a pace born from longevity that enhances your thoroughness.
When you terrorize your enemies, you also cause them painful mental distress.
Your ability to move unseen is startling for one your size, causing panic among your enemies.
You instantly recall a memory from one of your countless past lives that heightens your awareness of your surroundings and quickens your response.
You follow your allies' example.
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks attempted as initiative rolls.
Your talents in shapechanging allow you to pass unseen.
Your body is supremely flexible.
Long-lived elves have seen civilizations rise and fall, often at the hands of outside forces. As a result, they have developed a wariness of others who might seek to influence or control them.
Small roots sprout from your feet, steadying you as you move.

column1: And Will Do So Once More
column2: You’ve learned how to let go of most worries and move past them.
Your eyes have been opened to the spiritual essence suffusing the world.
You can speak to all animals, not just a particular subset.
Your animalistic connections help you resist natural afflictions.
Whenever someone grabs onto you, you instinctively bite down hard.
You're familiar with the basic spells that most educated merfolk know.
You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals with the amphibious or aquatic traits.
The magic powering you makes it difficult for outside magic to affect you.
Surviving in hostile terrain has given you a great talent for mobility.
You’ve delved into the power of your legacy.
You become familiar with using your weapons both in and out of water.
Your broad frame can allow you to carry weights that immobilize smaller creatures.
You're used to the clamor of steel, the crack of a firearm, and the thunderous blast of explosions.
Your spilled blood is sanctified, with effects similar to those of holy water.
The watery fluid in your veins doesn’t flow in the same way as traditional blood.
Injuries don’t bother you anymore—in fact, the pain invigorates you.
Your lethal unarmed attacks leave bloody gouges or cause severe internal bleeding.
You harden your form as you dance between shapes.
Your dwarven build allows you to push foes around, just like a mighty boulder tumbles through a subterranean cavern.
You can survive off the sea as well as gain insight from its waters.
You curl into a posture that splays out your bone spines.
You’ve heard the Call, and by resisting it, you’ve developed a bulwark against effects that target your mind.
You create a tune so catchy, your foes can't help but dance along.
Your growing connection to your celestial forebears has granted you one of their resistances as well.
You tap into aeon knowledge.
You have learned how to master the power contained within sunlight, just like the trees that form your body.
You can leave a faint chemical trail as you move and can use the chemical trails of other surkis to navigate.
You bear the favor and blessings of Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters.
Your clan dagger can protect your allies as easily as yourself.
You’ve learned how to handle situations when you’re out of your depth.
You can perform simple Interact actions with your shadow, such as opening an unlocked door.
Like evergreen trees, which stay healthy and vibrant from winter through summer, you too can adapt to a variety of extreme climates.
You can extend your claws to aid you in climbing.
Your connection to air allows you to see through obscuring mists.
Forbidding valleys and sheer cliffs can’t curb your vows to reunite the lost.
You conduct electrical damage through your body.
You have come to know conrasu weapons as you know yourself.
The difference between yourself and your coral symbiotes is nearly impossible to tell apart as your bodies are so intertwined.
If a foe of a larger size than you critically hits and damages you, that foe is off-guard to you for 1 round.
You've learned to disperse the crystalline motes coating your body as a haze.
During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
Your hair moves under your control.
Time spent tending to your own form has unlocked your ability to fix other things.
Repeated entries in Firebrand bragging and flyting contests have taught you how to twist pretty words into concealed insults.
Zon-Kuthon smiles upon you—even if you curse his name—granting you pitch-black eyes that allow you to see in shadows and darkness.
You have a heightened awareness in combat, and your darting strikes prevent your foes from distracting you or breaking your focus.
You have honed the unarmed attack your draconic heritage has granted you to a lethal degree.
Your venom is particularly potent, affecting targets in different ways.
Your body is covered in sharp needles or spines which you can use to defend yourself.
You loathe the alghollthus and their mind magic, and you’ve been trained to be willing to die rather than give into mental manipulation.
You walk the line between two sides of something, such as belonging to two clans, having a mixed allegiance or faith, or being caught between two possible fates.
You’re exceptionally difficult to kill.
Using ancient dwarven methods developed to fight enemies wielding magical darkness, you've honed your darkvision and sworn not to use such magic yourself.
Just the taste of fiendish blood is enough to send blood rushing through your veins in a supernatural fury.
You've learned to draw your fiendish nature into a small ball of corruption and hide it in your soul.
Traditionally, fiends are exceptionally good at persuading people to do things, even when their targets know it's a bad idea.
The Dissolution teaches that darkness can bring clarity and focus, serenity and strength—and so you draw on nearby shadows to replenish your magic.
You've trained to harry your foes from great distances, using your swiftness to maintain distance and keen eyesight to stay on target.
It takes a very brave person to enter the laughter-haunted forest where you dwell.
You can swing your beak to slash your foes when piercing attacks won't do.
Your sense of smell has heightened to be as keen as that of a dragon.
While swimming in water at least 10 feet deep, you grab an adjacent creature (on nearby land or in the water) and pull it below the surface.
You have grown a small pair of draconic wings or have honed your use of the wings you've had since birth.
Your long experience with your erratic patrons and their peers has given you a lot of practice in hitting the deck when you hear the rumbling of a powerful entity.
You can use your knowledge of engineering and metalwork to temporarily strengthen thick objects and structures.
You are practiced at blending into the background of the streets and halls of larger folk to ensure that you are overlooked.
As someone tries to twist fate, you consume the interference.
Your desire for stimulation has led you from one pursuit to another and granted you a smattering of expertise with myriad crafts and professions.
You call upon the corresponding elements of your suli heritage to resist the effect.
You’ve learned to alter the magic of your sprite’s spark, imparting them with elemental energies.
Your senses let you react rapidly.
Your colossal might marks you as a behemoth, the pride of Nex's Fleshforges, and the heaviest ordnance is a child's toy in your monumental grasp.
Once per day, you can cast either _calm emotions_ or _sanctuary_ as an innate occult spell, heightened to half your level rounded up.
Reincarnation has given you a compassionate perspective and enabled you to relate to almost everyone you speak with.
You can call forth a benediction upon your allies, whether you pray to a deity of the celestial realms or just find the power within yourself.
You stoke your magic to energize your wings, temporarily transforming them into glowing, majestic forms.
You can focus your mind more quickly thanks to the magic that flows within you.
The powers of domination employed by your progenitors have manifested in you as well.
You envenom your fangs.
You are luckier even than most catfolk.

While exploring, when you are leading and allies are Following the Expert, instead of granting a +2 circumstance bonus in the applicable skill, you grant a +3 circumstance bonus if you're an expert and a +4 circumstance bonus if you're a master.
You wrap shadow around a single unattended light source within 120 feet that's no larger than a torch.
You call upon divine power to place a benediction upon your allies or a malediction upon your foes.

Nobody respects tanuki, but most everyone respects an esteemed priest, so what better form to take if you want to get by a little easier? When you Change Shape, you can assume the shape of a priest or other religious official from a religion of your choosing.
Your leaps seem to defy gravity as you soar through the air in a single bound.
You wrap a shell of favorable wind around a weapon you wield.
To blend in with the grounded and wingless, you fold your wings just so on your back, creating the illusion of a feathered cloak.
The psychic feedback of another creature's pain fills you with false life.
You can disguise yourself with magical illusions.
Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
Your connection to your fiendish forebears has granted you one of their resistances as well.
Once you get your hands on someone, it's hard for them to get away.
You can modify the size and shape of your horn over time using your mental powers.
The ridges and flaps of your skin steer you through the water.
You can see through the haze of flame.
There's nothing beneath the waves that can slow you down.
You can perform simple Interact actions with your tail, such as opening an unlocked door.
You can ignore difficult terrain caused by moving through tight spaces that aren't tight enough to force you to Squeeze.
When you Cat Nap, you can also Refocus as you dream of a relevant activity.
You are skilled at quickly hiding behind bits of underbrush or foliage.
You know how to fight in formation with your brethren.
You reinforce your shield with a rocky outgrowth of metal and stone.
You come from a long line of imperial kobolds—if you meet a stranger who has some political standing in Tian Xia, they might know someone from your family line.
The shared bond between you and your allies allows you to act on their behalf.
Your wound yawns open, appalling your attacker.
Garudas' marksmanship and magic are second nature to you.
You cling to walls with a preternatural grip.
Whenever you critically hit using a falchion, ranseur, scimitar, trident, or a geniekin weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.
With plenty of practice, the memories of previous fights from previous lives come flooding back.
You can access the mystical power that dokkaebi refer to as a hat.
With enough time and determination, you can chew through nearly anything.
You can demonstrate how to quickly twist out of the way of dangerous effects.
Your senses advance to match those of your animal aspect.
You can use your webbed feet to guide your fall.
You convince your foe you're less of a threat.
Your eel pet grows larger and stronger.
The stars grant you insights that guide your actions.
While your willingness to dig into a task you know little about might get you into trouble, your incredible luck often saves you from danger.
After even the briefest success, you get caught up in the moment and begin to party, cheering your allies on.
Your halo can enhance positive energy.
Some legends claim that the flesh of a merfolk, if consumed, can grant health, longevity, and even immortality.
You harness the oncoming flames and twist them into a screen of heat and smoke, granting you concealment until the beginning of your next turn.
You respond with a startled look, dramatic pratfall, or theatrical arm-flailing that stymies your attacker.
You've internalized the hopping gait of your vampiric forebear.
Your fangs are exceptionally painful.

When you Change Shape, you retain elements of your kitsune form, allowing you to speak in a fox form, use kitsune unarmed attacks in a tailless form, or gain a tail in your tailless form to use abilities that require one.
Mastery of your shapeshifting lets you combine the best features of your humanoid and spider forms.
Your unblinking gaze is so intense it can befuddle the mind of others, drawing your victims toward you even against their better judgment.
Finding and excelling at odd jobs is child's play to one who has worked many occupations during many lives.
You take on the shape you had before you awoke to hide in plain sight.
Your nanites reject diseases with ease.
Your actions inspire your allies to great achievements.
You’ve used insulating wraps or special glazes to reduce your weakness to current and temperature.
Your mechanical body houses a weapon or shield that you can quickly draw and stow, leaving you prepared for combat at all times.
Your ordered physiology rejects unwelcome elements.
Illusion magic comes to you so naturally that you can effortlessly sustain your magical ruses.
Your have a love for extreme heat.
You glide slowly toward the ground, 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air.
You make the most of your iruxi unarmed attacks.
You run through the jungle as easily as you would through an open field.
You unfold your wings for travel and can keep them unfolded for 10 minutes.
You’re adept at combating other supernatural creatures.
You know more kitsune magic.
You deliver a punishing blow to an enemy's knee, shin, or other vulnerable anatomy within your reach.
You've spent more than your share of time in an alchemy lab.
You can make your voice reverberate off any surface.

Whether due to a more gradual process or your animal and sapient sides being especially in conflict, your awakening was a little slower than most, but your eyes are now fully open and your abilities have returned.

You know how to run an enterprise that others would never be able to get off the ground—some say it’s your savvy acumen or jovial manner, but you know it’s because you can cut costs by transforming leaves into money.
It's said that the flesh of the right side of a hyena can heal diseases, but that the flesh of the left side is deadly and poisonous.
Using your own leaves, you can control your descent.
You have a limited ability to sense life force, like your psychopomp forebears.
You can balance on your toes to step carefully over obstructions.
Your body is almost as flexible as your shadow.
You've learned to stretch your exceptionally long tongue beyond its original limits.
You transform into a specific, curious-looking human form.
Staying on pitch, proper breath control, and remembering the words are all less important than the real measure of a good singer: volume!
You have incredible empathy for your friends and family, and you have an innate timing for helping others in distress.
You are luckier even than most catfolk.
Your animating magic provides some defense.
You move quickly, snatching a shiny item that catches your eye.
Whether your heart is pure or corrupt, you can call forth a malediction upon your foes.
You've befriended a sea creature, which becomes magically bonded to you.
You've crossed blades with a wide variety of foes wielding a wide variety of weapons, and you've learned the basics of fighting with nearly any of them.
Your _warmask_ sharpens your connection to the source of your mask's power.
Your _warmask_ projects a white-hot fury that attempts to vaporize the offending magic.
You're able to better control your body's metabolism to preserve energy.
You blend in with unnatural subtlety.
You feel a strong connection with your progenitor and can convince yourself an effect targeting your mind was meant for theirs instead, allowing you to shrug off harmful effects.
Your thorns are many, vicious, and sharp.
deal more damage with your Living Weapon.
With a bit of self-discovery, you find a new form.
You've learned more naga magic.
Your nanites fly out of your body, swarming around you in a cloud.
You remember what it was like to speak easily with other animals, using old, familiar ways of communication to learn what they want and ask for favors in return.
By drawing upon the First World’s magic, you can siphon a portion of that malleable world to create a convincing illusion.
There are few twisting paths that can disorient you.
Your unusual physiology has developed in a way that makes it difficult for parasites and other infestations to prey upon you.
You resist energy like your extraplanar predecessors.
After a lifetime of using temporary, ghostly limbs to manipulate objects, you hardly need real hands.
Certain plants and flowers hold a reputation throughout Tian Xia for being strong and upstanding, able to weather adversity.
Once, genies ruled vast kingdoms, and a remnant of that confidence and power is reflected in your strong will.
Your fluffy interior lacks specific organs and struts, with few weak spots to injure.
As you recuperate from your wounds, life energy flows from you to the land and back to you again.
You have developed your skill with your defensive pheromones and have concentrated them into a noxious form.
You can enhance your senses and mental state to consider every aspect of an attack.
You aren’t as malleable as your oni ancestors but still can disguise yourself.
You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.
Ambushes are an honored kholo tradition.
Flashes of your life become clearer and more frequent, allowing you to apply skills you developed while alive.
Your can now draw from experience to wear any face you remember.
You can sniff out the pungent tang of disease.
No true tanuki would ever be caught without a musical instrument to play under the full moon.
Your stomach is particularly durable.
You’re skilled at navigating bogs and marshes, even for a paddler shoony.
Your unarmed attacks gain the properties of special materials.
You avoid the attention of creatures focused on your allies.
Your natural climbing ability and technique has made you a potent climber.
Where others etch their armor to serve as a conduit for their imaginations, your vivid mind and bold personality allow you to project a more fitting persona over your lackluster armor.
The chitin on your claws is so hard you can defend against attacks with them.
When you lash out with your clan dagger, you keep its sheath close at hand.
Your nanites can augment your defenses.
You enjoy mentoring others and take pride in your students' accomplishments.
You have a natural affinity for problem-solving and the unknown.
You Interact to store one item you're holding in your cheek pouches (provided it fits).
You run on all fours as fast as you can.
You dart away from your foe's attack with a casual laugh, using the opening to cause mischief.
There always seems to be a little rat around to carry messages for you.
You roll up into a ball and move up to four times your Speed in a straight line down an incline.
The root systems of trees are a far-reaching network of information, and you know how to access them and extract their secrets.
Your combat training has honed you to be ready for an attack at all times.
You've formed a connection with a small hand mirror, allowing you to use it as an extradimensional storage space.
You've practiced the art of taunting an enemy, ensuring they know death will only make you stronger.
You temporarily drain your star orb familiar’s energy to save an ally.
Your spines grow back much faster than other shisks.
You've learned to reshape your malleable form.
Your body can process an alternative to your venom that heals wounds.
While hidden, you manifest a version of your animalistic nature.
It's said that the flesh of the right side of a hyena can heal diseases, but that the flesh of the left side is deadly and poisonous.
After working with aquatic beasts of burden for years, you have learned how to easily mount and dismount them.
You can temporarily revert to a less conspicuous form without diminishing your senses.
Unlike most of your kind, who dismiss goblins as embarrassments or expendable annoyances, you have studied the methodology behind their irresponsible and incomprehensible actions.
Glorious, storied scars cover and protect much of your body, girding you in fleshly armor that resists any wound weaker than those you have already survived.
The long and complicated history of your bloodline manifests in your ability to draw power from more planar sources than most other nephilim.
Your instincts to move to safety are strong.
You've reinforced your interior parts with sealant or other flame-retardant materials, protecting you from fire.
You've continued to adapt to the rigors of your environment by continuing your metamorphosis, even as an adult.
Like many humans raised in a close-knit community, you have always been strongly attuned to the presence of others.
As your blow lands, you detach from your shadow to get the drop on your enemy.
You wrap yourself in shadow to change your appearance.
You are evidence that it’s lucky to travel with a halfling.
You can shed a portion of your tail to escape.
The stone around you is your ally, and you have learned to use it to shore up your weaknesses.
You wear many faces, even those that don't belong to you.
You feel a connection to shokis, the rambling collectors of wayward souls, and might have found old texts written by one.
Your energy saturates one of your weapons; it might be one inherited or one tied to your history.
You can navigate vertical surfaces with ease.
You move through the water with ease, mastering your movements with years of practice.
You can scamper up or down surfaces as nimbly as a monkey.
You’ve always had a tail, but with practice, you’ve learned to use it for more than signaling your mood.
You have a tail or similar body part that is always willing to lend a hand (so to speak).
You claw open the top layer of your scales and peel off the premature shed in order to remove harmful substances from your skin.
Philosophers compare the cycle of life, death, and rebirth to sleeping, dreaming, and waking.
You create gusts of wind when you jump, allowing you to carry yourself across greater distances.
You’ve spent significant time slipping silently between bamboo thickets, and your light-footedness allows you to navigate even the thickest forests and brush with ease.
If the snare normally takes 1 minute to Craft, you can Craft it with 3 Interact actions instead.
You Fly.
You dust explosive black powder on your fist or glove before attacking, which combusts as you hit an opponent.
You touch a creature with the minion trait and share the heightened sense of autonomy you've discovered.
At your very heartwood, you're a flower animated by elder magic, and with a little effort, you can speak to your kindred.
You have a connection with creatures that share your physiology.
You can speak to all inanimate objects and the slumbering spirits within them.
You've begun your training as a Speaker.
You are attuned to the minute sounds and sensations of restless spirits.
Your powerful legs allow you to make sudden and dramatic leaps.
An inconspicuous statue in front of a shop is the perfect form to wait for things to blow over.
You transform your fire spells into steam, making them more effective underwater.
You can cast _protector tree_ as a 1st-rank primal innate spell once per day.
You are an expert at avoiding the lumbering footsteps of larger creatures.
You can open or energize a notable third eye on your forehead to strike with storming power.
You can leverage your size and muscle to extend your reach and attack more distant foes.
You dedicate yourself to destroying those who harm your kin.
You can fly with a greater distance.
From sheer necessity, you've gotten surprisingly good at moving around on land.
The elven magic in your blood manifests as a force you can use to become more appealing or alluring.
You gain a swim Speed of 15 feet.
Your fins, flippers, or other accessories assist with steering you through water.
You can whip your tail around to lash items from the unwary's grip.
You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.
You retain not only your vampiric parent's taste for blood but their ability to gain vitality from it.
Escaping your nets is no simple task.
You've learned to bind some of your feathers together into a fan to focus your ancestral magic.
You’ve learned to create minor illusions by collecting strands of moonlight and weaving them together to create small images or cloaking veils.
You can call upon your former lives and project all of your accumulated frustration, failure, and despair through your eyes at a target, overwhelming their senses.
You've learned how to throw your voice through the winds, tricking others as to your location.
You trained your footwork by dancing to music between snapping bamboo poles, and your increased mobility helps you succeed when hunting dangerous beasts or fighting multiple opponents.
When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy’s heart.
You lash out with your tongue to disarm your foe.
You’ve spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.
You’ve taken your share of licks while scurrying around the battlefield and know how to defend yourself against opportunistic attackers.
You fill an area with your force of will, towering beyond where your true form should be.
Due to your blood, you have some resistance to certain types of magic.
Whenever possible, you follow the serene path and encourage others to do the same.

Your protean vitality is fecund and many-succoring: your veins run with life-giving ichor that adapts to the blood and physiology of any body, and your skin molts on command, creating wound-stanching sheaths of tissue for yourself and others.
You have the power to shatter the earth into a shape of your devising.
Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet.
You've lived among trees for so long they recognize your presence and seek to protect you from harm.
Your connection to elemental wood allows you to communicate with trees in the Universe in Muan, the language of wood elementals.
You can use your webbed feet to guide your fall.
You can more easily navigate underground tunnels by rolling up into a ball.

You have a talent for making friends through simple kindness, often among stray animals or other creatures that people tend to overlook, and your inherent magic can make these acts take on additional power.
You have a keen sense of movement around you.
Your companion is also touched by undeath, a mix of a traditional companion and a skeleton, zombie, or stranger form of unlife.
Your knowledge of your own not-quite-living anatomy, combined with your experience in combat, helps you take down undead foes with ease.
You delve deeper into your psychic potential.
Cities are just a new form of wilderness.
You've learned how to trick your foes using vanara weapons.
You have a knack for breaking and dismantling things.
You can store prepared venom in your throat and spit it at your foes in addition to your own toxic spray.
You've learned the art of lobbing toxic spittle at vulnerable spots on your foes, especially the eyes.
Your victories in battle fill you with pride and imbue you with the energy to fight a bit longer despite your wounds.
You are graceful and efficient in the use of vishkanyan weapons.
In dire circumstances you can vomit out your stomach to expel toxins.
You’re especially nimble while in your full fox shape.
Your soul is warded against the power of undeath and plague, as well as that of the evil former psychopomps known as sahkils.
A life of hunting and battle has caused your head gem to attune to the waxing moon, which has manifested in the power to protect you from harm.
You channel some of your own nature through your blow, temporarily warping your target's form to resemble your own.
You carry the ocean with you wherever you go.
You have been blessed by the sea, granting you the ability to swim like a fish.
Your mind is a deep well of psychic potential.
Your detachable limbs offer flexibility.
You are fastidious about keeping clean.
You can move quickly when using your preferred modes of travel.
The whispers of the jungle grant you more diverse access to simple primal magic.
Through the lingering influence of your warren's patron, you've sprouted a small set of wings.
Your skin hardens like bark and gains the sheen of glazed clay, lessening the wild’s ruinous sting against your body.
You twist your claw, breaking off a piece in your target.
Your mask familiar adapts quickly to material form, allowing it to gain more familiar and master abilities.
You scan the battlefield quickly, remembering critical details about multiple opponents you face.
Your number of versatile vials per day increases to 5.
You gain one wizard feat.
You gain one sorcerer feat.
You draw more power from your bloodline.
Through constant practice and the crucible of experience, you increase your skill with advanced bows.
You gain one inventor feat.

You gain one investigator feat.

Your connection to one of the great elemental aspects of nature deepens, allowing you further control over its powers.
You gain one swashbuckler feat.
You gain one barbarian feat.
Your herbalist talents continue to grow with use and you have become potent at making even more remedies from less.
You gain one ranger feat.
You gain one monk feat.
You gain a fighter feat.
You gain one magus feat.
Your rigorous training regimen allows you to wield complex weaponry with ease.
Your rigorous training regimen allows you to wield complex weaponry with ease.
You gain one bard feat.
You gain one oracle feat.

Your talent at controlling your qi has reached new heights.
Divine power reveals greater mysteries to you.
You've dedicated your training to the most complex and weird weapons of your favorite group.
You gain one gunslinger feat.
You gain one summoner feat.
