You gain one psychic feat.
You gain one rogue feat.
You’ve studied the art of wielding an advanced weapon.
You gain one druid feat.
You gain one witch feat.
After compromising your enemy’s movement, you deliver a more deadly blow.
Your easily maneuver against your foes.
Learn to strike back at your opponent when they fail to attack you.
The power of your qi soothes your wounds and energizes you for battle.
You break down a specific individual’s idiolect, memorizing their speech mannerisms and habits.
Your knowledge of a creature’s physiology helps you attack with pinpoint accuracy.
Your proficiency in unarmored defense increases to expert.
You tap into the primal strength of your _animal feature_.
When you cast _animate rope_, you can modify it to animate a net.
You keep watch for any hidden creatures or dangerous sites, moving at half your travel Speed.
Stride twice.
You can sense the presence of the supernatural, even if you don't have any magical ability yourself.
You visually or audibly warn your companions of danger, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls.
You have trained hard to optimize your armor's unique protective qualities to maximize the materials used in its creation.
Artokus developed a mixture of volatile materials that burns hotter and longer than typical alchemist's fire.
You discorporate into a cloud of whirling ash and Stride.
You can procure information with confidence.
You have mastered the weight and balance of a variety of axes and can lob them with ease.
You gain the basic bounded spellcasting benefits.
You have a vast and overflowing collection of scroll  scraps, riddled with errors and misspellings and leaking energy like a sieve.
You gain the basic bounded spellcasting benefits.
You snatch at your opponent with your claws, pulling them close in a ferocious bear hug.
You hug your opponent.
You've bonded to your beast gun and unlocked the first hints of its hidden potential.
You can enter a trance that allows you to briefly inhabit the body of one of your animal companions and share its senses.
You dedicate yourself to freeing slaves and escorting them to freedom.
You manifest a ghostly deck of harrow cards that seek to protect you or an ally.
Your companion's mere presence is enough to rattle creatures that fall under its shadow.
While your usual diplomacy is well intentioned, you know that sometimes those same skills will need to be turned to deception.
You rush forward and latch onto your enemy with talons of hungering fire.
Your eidolon flies into a frenzy.
You call out a foe, causing them to become flustered and easier to defeat.
You can force a creature to tell the truth
You consume the brains of your foe, causing synapses long rotten to fire and enabling you to shake off your mental torpor.
You push your foes around and leave bruises.
You enhance your spell with elemental fire, causing it to set the target on fire.
You enhance your spell with elemental fire, causing it to set the target on fire.
You can make nonlethal Strikes with a butterfly sword without taking a penalty.
You gain the sneak attack class feature.
You call out a quick cadence, guiding your allies into a more efficient rhythm.
By loading special ammunition in a particular way, you can make your siege weapons do all manner of tricks that other siege engineers can barely even imagine.
Your ability to captivate others has grown, and you can use your captivator abilities more often.
You call upon your Cascade Bearer training to help you adjust a spell for the current situation.
When in Arcane Cascade, you can make yourself resistant to magic.
The sheer force of your faith can bring a foe crashing down.
You attempt to cast a malevolent entity out of the creature or object it's possessing.
You use the smoking barrel of your firearm to sear shut a bleeding wound.
You have prepared a special knife to direct energies when spellcasting.
You can gain and use the champion’s reaction associated with your cause
Compact layers of air diffract and bend light around your body, making you appear as clear as the sky on a perfect day.
You put your body behind your massive weapon and swing, shoving enemies to clear a wide path.
You swing clear through one foe and into another.
Your opponents can’t slip your grasp without punishment.

Your ostilli can emit illusion magic to mask your position, granting you the Drape Ambient Magic action.

 **Drape Ambient Magic** <actions string="Single Action" /> (illusion) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** Your ostilli turns clear as it converts its stored magic into a bubble of refracting light around you.
You can use unstable clockwork devices in your innovation to push your invention to act more quickly.
You combine a series of attacks with a powerful finishing blow.
You can add the full ingredients of a second elixir to an elixir you make to create a hybrid concoction.
When you cast _mirror image_, you can modify it to create a duplicate of yourself.
Ephemeral connections between people, places, and concepts are invisible to most, but seeing them is your stock and trade.
You've adjusted your construct innovation so that when you ride it, special plates, hollows, or similar form partial barriers around you to add additional protection.
You absorb energy and hold it in your kinetic gate.
You use your deceptive skills to make your illusions seem even more real.
Your shield ally is more than just a spirit of protection— it's a conduit for deadly divine magic.
Your absolute dedication to a single element lets you attempt to gain control over it, even when the element is in service to another entity.
You gain the counter performance composition spell.
You're renowned for your ability to recover important items and sometimes that requires creating a stand-in.
You interpose your arm between yourself and your opponent.
You mimic the motions of a beast of your devising, and it becomes real, with a flaming pelt and searing claws.
You swathe yourself in a veil of red mist for 1 minute.
Your skill with a crossbow strikes terror into your opponents when you threaten them with the next bolt.
You use the crowd to your advantage, diverting your foes’ attention to potential hidden dangers in the crowd.
Your body begins to evolve and adapt, taking the first steps towards blending your very self with the ancient curse of the saumen kar.
The weight of your armored feet casts aside natural impediments.
As you use your magic to manipulate air or water, you divert some of its currents to form a barrier around you.
As you use your magic to manipulate air or water, you spin off some of its currents to form a barrier around you.
Your skill in combining fist and blade has grown into a seamless art where each attack makes an opponent more vulnerable to the next.
You attempt a death-defying maneuver to distract your enemies.
A small cloud of medicinal herbs heal a creature.
Through a profane pledge or a bloodline quirk, you can tolerate the sun's light.
You pummel a held foe, hoping to stagger them.
Your tricks discombobulate your opponent, leaving spots in their vision from the bright flash of your gunshot reflected straight into their eyes.
You corkscrew your body, twisting your victim.
With your intimate familiarity with the duality of positive and negative energy, you're able to stand as a bulwark against death and undeath alike.
No means of creating or ruling the undead is beyond your grasp, even those of magical traditions not your own.
You can add a crystalline additive to an alchemical bomb to have it undermine your enemy.
You interpose yourself between an attacker and your mount, defending your mount from harm.
Like the storied heroes who persist in the face of overwhelming odds, you and your allies will hold the line.

Your ostilli can use its stored magic to protect you from other magic, granting you the Turn Aside Ambient Magic action.

 **Turn Aside Ambient Magic** <actions string="Single Action" /> (concentrate) Your ostilli glows a faint yellow as it establishes a barrier.
You are keen to the wiles of the fey and can usually shake off their magic.
A vortex of sand and dust surrounds you.
Your spell becomes volatile and explosive.
You gain the blessing of the devoted class feature

You can lob bombs with great force and a precise trajectory to angle the splash in a cone that sprays in a single direction, potentially allowing you to avoid allies and splash deeper into enemy lines.
You learn the dirge of doom composition cantrip (page 370), which frightens your enemies and keeps them from fully recovering from their fear.
With a wide, sincere smile, you give your attacker pause.
You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon.
You have a sense for when people are lying.
Identifying a creature is the first step in finding its weaknesses.
You've delved deeper into the mysteries of shadow and become blessed with magical power that increases your skills in the arts of deception and persuasion.
When you cast _floating disk_, you can modify it to ride atop.
You call forth positive energy from within to help you destroy undead.
You know how to take advantage of those your swarm has attacked.
You use vestiges of magic to create a protective vortex.
Your familiar is a divine emissary, sent to you by your deity or patron and infused with celestial powers.
You strive against magical threats physically and spiritually.
You siphon residual spell energy into a weapon you’re wielding.
You use your acrobatic prowess to evade an attack, using momentum to keep yourself moving if you choose.
You bellow, instilling fear in your enemies.
You breathe deeply and exhale powerful energy in a 30-foot cone, dealing 1d6 damage per level to each creature in the area with a basic Reflex save against your class DC.
When you cast _obscuring mist_, you can modify it to extinguish flames.
You move in and out of range to complement your attacks.
Heavy drops of rain batter down, hitting like sling stones and impeding vision.
When you start a psychic duel, you gain a third natural psychic spell.
When you take the Seek action, you can use hearing as a precise sense with a range of 40 feet until the start of your next turn.
You tweak the properties of your composition spell to convey a bit of your defensive knowledge.
Your eidolon makes a melee Strike against the triggering creature.
Your eidolon gains the _eidolon's wrath_ focus spell, which it casts, instead of you.

You channel powerful magic with your archery, allowing you to deliver potent spells through the tip of an arrow rather than the more mundane flick of the wrist or whatever other gestures are usually used.
Some animals and beasts have electric organs in their body that they can use to jolt their prey.
Spinning wood and metal together, you create a rugged wooden ballista.
You unleash the energy roiling within you.

You've been ensnared by an azata's infectious enthusiasm for life, love, and freedom that manifests as a pearlescent afterimage in your graceful movements, a spring in your soft steps, an ever-present melody in your euphonic voice, and eddies of passionate colors in your mesmerizing eyes.
You are comfortable and socially capable in almost any cultural context.
The herbal items you create use medicinal plants endemic to your location.
Your blood resonates with magical energy, mitigating the effects of harmful spells.
You convert energy from the last spell you cast into a protective ward.
You release a terrible wail that tears at the spirits of all nearby.
You focus your divine power to extend your influence and protection.
You reach new understandings of the elements, taking an expansive view.
You advance and retreat quickly.
You're particularly adept at crafting fireworks, allowing you to create much more powerful fireworks than you otherwise could.
You take advantage of your spotter's devastating attack to unleash your own follow-up attack.
Your innovation can explode on command.
Your summoned creature appears in a detonation of arcane runes.
When you weave magic, your familiar traces symbols that throw off fear and doubt.
When you Strike with a thrown weapon, you take only a –1 penalty for each additional range increment between you and the target, rather than a –2 penalty.
You attack with a feline grace as captivatingly beautiful as it is deadly.
Your elemental familiar trades places with an elemental from its elemental plane.
Your serrated teeth rip and tear at your prey.
You are incredible, impeccable, an icon of style and grace—and everyone knows it.
Your claws and fangs exude an infectious enzyme, related to the necrotic effects of ghoul fever, that causes a creature's wounds to heal slowly.
You are exceptionally skilled at noticing the subtle techniques fey use to avoid notice.
While castles are generally obliging enough to stay in one place, out in the field positioning is of paramount importance—a gun in the wrong place is worse than useless.
You flow like the elemental cycle, adapting your stance and techniques constantly in response to whatever circumstances you face.
You're able to quickly disappear and then move about without drawing the attention of your enemies.
You can perform two aspects of a ritual yourself.
A speeding wind heeds your call, picking someone up and depositing them nearby.
The simple and precise movements of your hands allow you to deflect blows with the same efficacy as a raised shield.
You’ve trained in drawing the eyes of your audience to specific aspects of your performance through the careful manipulation of your fans and body.
You have trained rigorously to use all parts of your body as a weapon, and when you miss with an attack, you can usually continue the attack with a different body part and still deal damage.
Your techniques extend the storage life for certain ingredients and food through pickling, alcohol, or fermentation.
You are trained to preserve the archaeological value of your location when entering.
Your treatments for diseases and poisons can be very efficacious, though they tend not to last as long.
Your very presence chills creatures of the night down to their core and you can use the spiritual power and faithful life force of religious verses to frighten even mindless undead.
Your willingness to follow through on your pitiless judgment is frightful to the person you have condemned.
You channel potent magic into your next shot, empowering it with a blast of crackling energy.
You can imprint your familiar’s spiritual essence into a fulu, a small paper charm that can be affixed to objects, creatures, or structures.
You’ve learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously.
You and your allies harry an opponent in concert.
Whether it's wooden stakes, holy water, or more unusual tools, you always have just the right thing to handle an undead's unusual weaknesses and vulnerabilities.
You can infuse a weapon you are carrying with magical energies that allow it to strike true against incorporeal undead.
Your control over your ghostly form grows.
You grow to incredible size.
Your mystery grants you additional magic.
You pound your chest before slamming into your foes.
Exposure to the elements, magic, alchemy, and other phenomena intensified the changes from your mummification.
Learn how to sense undead in the area.

The flesh you've consumed over the course of your existence as a ghoul has made you stronger, gifting you with strange insights from the minds of the sapient creatures you've devoured and bringing you closer to a state of undead perfection.
Stone never becomes queasy, so why should you? You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against the sickened condition.
Your patron grants you greater knowledge.
You can make your skin take on the woody endurance of an ancient tree and have your familiar follow suit.
You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack.
You know the result you want and subtly nudge the timeline to your intended destination.
You ask your spirit guide for aid.
You devote much of your study to halcyon magic.
You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously,
You immediately learn two of the following rituals: _astral projection_, _call spirit_, _commune_, _commune with nature_, _legend lore_, or _planar binding_.
With a loud shout, you unleash your ki in a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs your body.
You have forged your body to comply with the commands of your mind—orders steeped in the Measure and the Chain.
You have bolstered your force of will with the power of the Measure and the Chain.
Your wounds knit together with barely a thought.
You hold your prey's defensive limbs in place with your claws while delivering a swift kick to their unprotected sides.
You provide emotional and spiritual care.
You gain your implement's initiate benefit.
You find it easy to attract a powerful and unusual familiar to your side.
Your spell leaves behind barriers that reduce shock and motion.
You imbue yourself with the resilience of the cave worm.
Entering a dream is as natural to you as stepping through a doorway.
While you're in Stoked Flame Stance, you have cold and fire resistance, and any creature touches you takes fire damage.
Your strength is part of your rage.
Your understanding of life expands, allowing you to mimic a wider range of creatures.
Your rage stokes the spark of your barbarian instinct into a roaring flame.
When you support your animal companion, your companion supports you in turn.
You expend the elemental medicine in your body to empower your attacks, though you can’t consume any more elemental medicine until the next day.
Your divine touch rejuvenates the weak and tired.
You’ve studied ways of overcoming the innate defenses against magic that dragons, otherworldly beings, and certain other powerful creatures have.
You've mastered the use of electrical energy to power your clockwork creations.
You conjure up to six cube-shaped mounds of packed earth.
Some of the ooze that surrounded you made its way permanently into parts of your body, turning you soft to the touch and semitransparent enough to show bones.
You can recall all sorts of information.
When your hunted prey tries to bolt, you follow.
Once you are upon your prey, they can’t escape.
Everything is connnected—all is part of the whole. Find where to add your ki and you can break the whole.
You have sworn the Crimson Oath and become a full member of the Crimson Reclaimers.
You are dedicated to the cause of the Shining Sentinels.
The light flows from your sigil of Pharasma to shatter the bonds imprisoning a soul.
You aren’t bothered by tricky footing.
You smash a metal rod into your foe and call lightning to it.
You excoriate a foe for its wrath against goodly creatures.
You’ve bridged a connection between the runes on your body and the magic of runestones, allowing you to place an armor rune on your living flesh.
Your qi, dancing ever diligently toward cultivation, eludes the grasp of the world’s muck and mire.
The loyalty you and your mount share is unbreakable.
Any necromancer can create zombie and skeleton, but you know the secrets behind the creation of far more advanced undead monstrosities.
You use your hatred of magic to lash out at a known spellcaster.
The blessing of your deity heightens your healing ability, integrating magical healing with the mundane.
You can craft a temporary wondrous item using the magic scrounged from all around.
You Command an Animal to order your megafauna companion to Stride twice.
During daily preparations, you can designate one of your spell slots to become two summoning slots of the same spell level, from which you can cast only summoning or incarnate spells.
Your mastery of warden magic increases.
When you identify a creature with Recall Knowledge, that creature is flat-footed to you.
Your animal companion becomes a mature animal companion and gains additional capabilities (page 211).
You've raised your megafauna companion to be a more powerful force on the battlefield than most of its kind.
Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion.
By heeding the wise advice of elders in your following— and aided by your own experience—you've learned how to provide medical care to the megafauna of the Mammoth Lord followings.
You bleed off some electric power from your innovation in the shape of a damaging bolt.
When you meet someone’s gaze, they’re unable to look away from you.
With a swing and a thought, you detonate your mind weapon into a burst of psychic shards that shred the mind.
Wild mists cover your form.
The clicking of fast-moving legs accompanies your swarm in all kinds of environments.
Spinning molten iron through a vortex of fire, you trap your foe in searing wires.
You rush into your enemies with great and reckless force.
You focus on your connection to the earth and call upon the mountain to block attacks against you.
You’ve trained with your shield to defend both yourself and your mount.
You force your mental anguish outward, projecting it upon those around you.
You're particularly adept at crafting ammunition and bombs.
Your mask protects you further from divination.
You act as a conduit for your companions just as your stories are a conduit between teller and listener.
When you begin your turn hidden or unnoticed by your hunted prey, that creature is off-guard to you until the end of your turn.
Your companions pick at an enemy's weak points.
The stars and moon lend you their light.
Training with the crew of the Nightwave has taught you their technique for reloading while leaping to board another ship.
You are so used to wielding a shield that you can do so even while using the hand that’s holding it for other tasks that require the dexterity of a hand.

Despite the devastation your weapons tend to inflict upon their targets or the destruction you might unleash upon an area, your foes still manage to walk away at the end of a fight—at least sometimes.
Your senses gain even greater clarity.
As your body continues to rot and putrefy, your senses deaden and your undead powers grow.
When you cast _obscuring mist_, you can modify the spell to blanket the area, making it difficult to see the ground.
You've forged a deeper bond to your invested items, allowing you to activate them more than usual.
You put all your force into a single mighty, carefully controlled blow.
If the next action you take is to Manifest your Eidolon as a three-action activity, or to Cast a three-action summoning Spell, the creature appears in an explosion.
You have mastered techniques for hunting alongside your pack.
You've sworn a pact with a dragon, giving you the ability to tap into the dragon's immeasurable power in exchange for adding to their hoard.
You gain resistance to mental damage equal to half your level and a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against effects that would make you clumsy, drained, or enfeebled.
You expand your mind beyond your area of psychic specialty.
You gain the appropriate ki spell for your School of Perfection.
You're skilled with flashy weapons and can use them to great effect.
You spot anything out of place in the areas you know best.
You know that to take out an enemy formation, you must punch a hole through its center.
Your eidolon phases out of reality slightly, gaining resistance to all damage (except force and negative) equal to half your level.
You twirl gracefully, spinning on one foot to evade your opponent's attack.
With a stern call, carefully chosen barb, or some other challenging declaration, you demand your foe's attention in a duel.
You lash out with a powerful punch, extending your dynamo to a greater length in order to attack two creatures in a row.
Your bites carry a cursed infection.
In nature, certain animals are covered in venomous spines, and just brushing against them can prove deadly.
Your connection to rune magic has revealed tricks to make polearms deadlier in your hands.
You've learned to swing your lash ever faster and in wider arcs.
You've battled more undead than you care to remember, often with little time to prepare between foes, forcing you to rely on experience and muscle memory to guide your blade.
Even when your foe avoids your Confident Finisher, you can still hit a vital spot.
Your nails grow into sharp claws, perfect for seizing and tearing your prey.
You have just the thing for the situation.
You can mimic the sheer mass of the largest beasts.
Your ostilli can fire its dart farther.
You've found a new mental form.
You can rig a snare in only moments.
You use the power of your Rain-Scribe magic to draw on a stream of primal power for sustenance.
Your fearless charge into battle reinvigorates your allies to carry on the fight.
Your unwavering soul brings up your defenses as soon as you're in danger.
You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening.
You watch the creature or hazard as it collapses, careful for any sign it may return.
You gain the Red Mantis magic school’s initial school spell.
You can use your shield to fend off explosions and the like.
You have been trained to disarm foes.
You can fire off a single shot even when unprepared. You Interact to reload your hand crossbow and Strike with it.
You've learned how to trigger snares from afar, creating ranged hazards to assail your opponents and allowing you to disarm enemies' snares harmlessly.
You use your foe's failure as an opening to push them away.
You can cast difficult rituals  that might otherwise be just beyond your skill.
Snatching an arrow out of the air, you instantly put it to your bow and return fire.
You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies.
You adopt a stance to rebound your thrown weapons toward you.
A hurricane lifts your enemies into the air before bringing them crashing down in a bloody rain.
You form water and earth into a mudslide that smashes your opponents and coats them in mud.
You enter a stance that makes it difficult to move around you.
You embrace the pain of the triggering attack, allowing it to drive you into a violent rush.
Through the power of your faith or the blessing of a priest, your weapons are fully effective against incorporeal creatures.
You are inured to the effects of your own spells.
A figure of sand with grasping arms arises in an unoccupied square within 30 feet.

The world is full of obnoxious weasels who think they can pull one over on you—put them in their place! When an adjacent creature attempts to Lie to you or to Demoralize you and gets a critical failure on the roll, you can use your reaction to make a Shove attempt against that opponent.
You pack your weapon with additional shot and powder, creating a risky but devastating wave of destruction.
Your knowledge of strange creatures and their bizarre anatomy allows you to anticipate their physical attacks and reduce the damage you take from them.
You emit a powerful surge of instinctual energy when you unleash your anger.
You move faster, especially when traveling, allowing you to scout out ahead and report back without slowing your allies.
Ragged pieces of metal weld together into a ramshackle structure.
Your esoterica includes scraps of scriptures, magic tomes, druidic markings, and the like, which you can use to create temporary scrolls.
Your experience chronicling adventures and discoveries grants you heightened discernment and memory.
You're used to your shield breaking in the middle of battle, and you're prepared to use a backup or any convenient nearby object to defend yourself.
As you call down divine power, you can prevent some enemies from benefiting or some allies from being hurt.
You draw the misfortune or curse into yourself, potentially enabling you to enter your curse maelstrom state.
Your offense exploits your enemy’s fear.
You use your shield in tandem with an ally's, forming a barricade.
When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you.
During your daily preparations, you can magically fuse a shield into your favorite book, where it appears as an elaborate bookmark.
You leverage your weight to topple foes that you move.
Taking inspiration from Desna’s image as a giant silk moth in Tian Xia, you’ve attached a bracelet to your innovation that generates ultra-strong silk strands mixed with venom.
You are capable of seeing magic as flowing runes and can scribe a personal rune that represents you.
Your psychic abilities also allow you to detect the lingering thoughts of spirits and similar entities.
Your feet and weapon move in tandem.
You enter a stance allowing you to make jagged strikes like flashes of lightning through the sky.
Steal from your target when you successfully strike them.
You've learned a gunslinger's tricks for staking out your territory in a fight.
You can Disarm a creature through sleight of hand rather than brute force.
You single out one enemy to destroy in your deity's name.
Your lash whips around to intercept projectiles.
You can react with ranged weapons when a creature is in close quarters.
You take an extra moment to carefully sync your aim and breathing, then fire a shot with great accuracy.
Snow and ice are no hindrance to you.
You learn the song of marching composition cantrip, which enables you and your allies to cross vast distances without strain.
Choose an additional soulforged armament of a different type than the type you already chose, and choose one essence power for it.
You twist not just the visual, but the auditory as well, allowing you to pass without a sound and create minor noises as distractions—perfect for misdirection and infiltration.
You open the power in your blood to your ally's spellcasting, using your magic to boost their range.
As a Spellmaster, you are adept at identifying magic.
You flare your legs around, using the momentum to both lash out and return to a standing position.
You trace a spiral in the air while intoning prayers to Pharasma, gaining her blessing for a time.
You charge your blade with spiritual energy, allowing it to cut through spirits and fiends with fearsome efficiency.
You purify a spirit by absolving it of its sins and regrets.
You call forth protective spirits to ward off ranged attacks.
You have a vague connection to the Ethereal Plane that enables you to notice spirits.
Your spirit guide enhances your attacks with occult power.
You can prepare two spells in one slot, giving you the freedom to choose the spell when you cast it.
You sweep your foes away with your staff.
You've learned how to fire at enemies to slow them down, allowing innocents and fellow knights alike time to escape.
You can startle foes who are unaware of your presence.
You don’t lose spells easily. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC 15 flat check. If you succeed, your action isn’t disrupted.
You shape your kinetic aura into swirling armor of steam that scalds your enemies and propels you on super-heated jet streams.
You dart towards your opponent, seeking to stab them and slice their purse-strings with a single movement.
A combination of additional viscosity and careful application keeps your weapons poisoned even when suffering significant wear and tear.
Your blood clots quickly.
Your blood becomes thick and sluggish, but no less effective at oxygenating your cells.
You've learned to manifest your connection to stone by conjuring it to your side.
You gather the resiliency of stone to block attacks against you.
You lash out, directing a burst of storming fury toward a creature that has harmed you.
You spit out a freezing breath or sonic scream.
You strain your body beyond its limits to use an amp even when your mental power is depleted.
You lash out confusingly, with what seems to be a weak move, but instead allows you to unleash a dangerous flurry of blows upon your unsuspecting foe.
The Old Sun Gods have granted you a gift in your fight against Walkena.
By keeping your feathers clean and sleek, you can catch the light across your wings to create a startling glare in the eyes of a creature within 20 feet.

By experimenting with the effects of momentum gained from your signature vehicle's movement, you have learned to get more from propulsion than just speed when the pilot pushes the vehicle to its limit.
#VALUE!
You’ve learned to riposte against ill-conceived attacks.
You leap up on one leg, snapping your fans open alongside your head before sweeping them across your body.
When danger appears, you quickly send away your active companion and call in a different animal ally.
You're burdened with noticing potential threats at all times.
Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you’re moving.
You channel spiritual energy through your weapon, unleashing it as a torrent of devastating power.
Your Swords training taught you to never lose hold of your weapon.
When you apply your will to invoke a vulnerability, the result is more powerful, and the vulnerability ripples out in a web from your main target to affect a broader range of creatures.
Your hair deals increased damage and can grapple.
You and your eidolon each attack, seamlessly targeting the same foe without interfering with each other's movements.
You tap into the entity's life force to heal your wounds, though at the cost of the entity's personality bleeding into your own.
You aim a shot at your spotter, intending for your spotter to redirect that shot off their own weapon or shield to hit your foe from a better angle, and avoid your foe's cover.
You and your familiar coordinate to channel elemental air.

If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that damages other creatures, you can bend some of that spell’s offensive energy, protecting allies in the area and boosting your own defenses against certain foes.
You encourage your companion to refuse to yield, against even the mightiest of foes.
You have comprehensive knowledge in your fields of interest.
Through your disciplined condensations and circulations of qi, you’ve caught a fleeting glimpse of cultivation’s promise, and your health has handsomely profited along the way.
You slam your hands together to unleash a deafening blast.
You make a fierce swipe with both hands.
You might be a novice in the temporal arts now, but in the future, you'll hold time in the palm of your hand.
You use your body's expansion as leverage to displace a nearby creature.
A healing wave splashes across creatures in a 30-foot cone, its cleansing water driving afflictions from the body.
An ephemeral tree bursts forth, floating on air in an unoccupied square of your choice within 60 feet.
You slice, stab, or batter your opponent with the melee portion of your combination weapon before pulling the trigger at point-blank range.
You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control.
After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open.
Slamming one element into another, you combine their strengths.
When you cast _sleep_, you can modify the spell to make subjects of your spell experience troubled dreams.
Make a free Demoralize check when you critically succeed with your dueling sword.
You lean into your foe's attack, using the weight of your body and armor to send them reeling.
Defeat lets you to tap into your wellspring.
You tell a quick story or begin telling a longer tale.
You cause your eyes to liquefy and run out of your eye sockets, leaving them empty.
You manifest a ghostly deck of harrow cards.
You tumble around your foes, expertly avoiding their reactions.
You use your daydreams to predict the success of actions, rapidly envisioning the possibilities.
You've found a way to use a hodgepodge combination of devices to enhance your visual abilities in every situation.
When you cast _grease_, you can modify it to cover a creature in flammable grease.
Lava reflexively explodes underneath you and the creature that hurt you.
Your number of versatile vials per day increases to 5.
Your runes provide a warding effect that protects you against a specific school of magic.

A common saying among Firebrands is, “There's always a fool who thinks they can do it better—and they're often right.” You verbally commit to using an action on your next turn to make a melee Strike against the same enemy your ally has missed.
You menace the target, stoking their fears and drawing their attention.
You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don’t support your weight.
You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don't support your weight.
A packed cloud of thundering boulders descends from the sky, beating down everyone in its path.
You can use your _wayfinder_ to store a little extra magic for when you need it most.
You cartwheel on your claws, dancing over your foes.
You propel your enemy away.
Your connection to the denizens of the wilds grows ever stronger, and you find yourself able to speak with animals like you would in your native tongue.
Your patron's power continues to enhance your natural offensive capabilities.
Your roots of qi stand firm, shaking off pains and aches like the returning flowers and leaves shed during winter’s snow.
You forge a magical link with another creature, granting you awareness of that creature’s condition and creating a conduit for spellcasting.
You rip your enemy off their feet.
Planks of wood, embellished with carvings, spring forth to form a wall.
You call forth a brood of infantile cave worms to feast on your enemy's flesh.
You’ve rigged your armor innovation with a gizmo that can safely synthesize two sea mines a day, holding them in a protected compartment.
Use First Aid to reduce frightened and sickened condition values
You move with grace in flight and can perform amazing aerial stunts.
By smearing ash or tainted earth over your skin and armor, you shroud yourself from the dead.
Demoralizes foes when you roll for initiative
Calling out to your deity, you recite scripture to harm a foe
In even a brief conversation or social interaction, you pick up on subtle social and visual cues to learn a great deal about a person's origin and history.
Your magic becomes more difficult to identify
You channel positive energy into restoratives that ward against harm
You pour negative energy into toxins you create to further debilitate your targets
Use your knowledge to break curses
The flows and ebbs of time are obvious to you, as are the tangles that form when it's distorted.
You have learned rites or meditations that enable you to perceive minor, invisible spirits within a place.
You utter a litany of dreadful names, prophecies, and descriptions of realms beyond mortal comprehension, drawn from your study of forbidden tomes and scrolls.
You're skilled at saying one thing and meaning something different.
By reducing redundant systems and streamlining essential functions, you have made it easier for the vehicle to operate with fewer crew.
You have a small group of admirers who tend to follow you around while you’re in civilized settlements.
Having experienced the harshest environs that nature has to offer, your body is able to adapt to intense heat and cold.
You rapidly adapt to environments through a combination of skill, meditation, and divine grace
You can rapidly adapt to climates and help others do the same.
You point out a detail that incontrovertibly supports your faith, causing a listener's mind to whirl.
Search areas in half the time
You can apply the same techniques you use to reverse engineer objects to disable dangerous traps and break apart locks.
You know exactly how to make a memorable entrance.
You can lie about having taken an action so convincingly that you acquire all the tangible benefits of having successfully completed it.
Take precautions against special senses
Use New Leadership and other activities more efficiently
You have an occult connection to the world that helps you blend in with the cacophony of life around you.
Mass and muscle are meaningless when you propel yourself through the air; only grace and balance matter.
Every Firebrand can recognize the skill of others, but you've turned it into an art you can wield in combat.
Craft items more efficiently
With patience and time, you can make bird calls, leave game trails, and ultimately influence the behavior of a certain type of animals in the region to favor and even aid you in the days to come.
Stand up for free without triggering reactions
Teaching is a difficult art form, but you've gotten a pretty good handle on it.
Craft items using monster parts
You've attuned your natural aura to that of plant life, coaxing it to grow faster than normal.
Your study of another allows you to mirror their movements subtly, even in the heat of combat.
Your past has left you numb to death's call.
Kassi Aziril taught you her techniques that originated the modern use of Battle Medicine.
You attend all the fashionable society parties, no matter how exclusive they might be.
Use Survival to Subsist on different planes
You're practiced at creating forgeries that establish your outlaw credentials or augment your legal authority.
Procure consumable items with Prescient Planner
You've mastered attaching clockwork propellers to your daily quick-deploy snares that use gears.
You can push your vehicle's performance beyond the limits envisioned by its makers.
Cost of living expenses are reduced
You can shift between your identities with ease.
Climb swiftly
Identify spells as a free action
You have learned to setup simple crafting jobs with ease.
Swim quickly
Pick a Lock with 1 action
You take only 1 minute to Affix a Talisman.
All communication is filled with slight tells and signals.
You call upon your deity to grant you their protective blessing
You have the knowledge needed to understand ancient texts and cultural artifacts.
Make Requests of others with lesser consequences
Magic items you create bear a stamp specific to your handiwork.
You don't believe in any mental twaddle, and you're certainly not afraid of it.
Evade attempts to uncover your true nature
You've learned the ancient tongue spoken by the creatures of the far north.
Your disparate identities allow you to defeat magic that detects lies.
You have refined your palate and have a discerning sense of taste that can detect abnormalities in the flavor and texture of food and beverages.
Move your full Speed while you Sneak
You learn Hwan temperature classifications for the elements—wood and water are cold elements, while fire, earth, and metal are hot elements.
Cause foes you Demoralize to flee

column1: That was a Close One, Huh?
column2: You laugh innocently about the inexplicable luck of your last shot hitting its mark or how close the attack that just missed you came to taking your head off, causing your foes to second guess whether it's a good idea to oppose you in battle.
You reach for an opponent's item as you move past a foe.
Channeling the energy of the Crimson Oath into your voice, you pronounce a threat in a tone so icy it freezes the blood.
Jump off walls
Experience and training have taught you that water has just enough surface tension for a master sprinter to traverse the surface.
Your readings on rituals make you a skilled participant.
You use your performance to supplement an ally’s spellcasting, providing magical energy for their spell in their stead.
You strike cleanly with wide, sweeping attacks to inflict maximum damage
When the curse within you spills out, you can lay curses on others and claim them for yourself with ease.
You've learned to harness the supernatural curse that animates you, imbuing your most powerful attacks with a terrible curse.
You sense if a creature you have slain in the last year has been restored to life
A small amount of poisontaken at nonlethal doses, can help the body build up resistance against a more deadly dosage.
With your strong will and even stronger body, you shrug off an otherwise devastating blow.
Through your conviction, you have glimpsed the deeper secrets of your deity's domain.
Your prayers have unlocked deeper secrets of your deity’s domain.
You dig deeper into the magical tools found in wizard schools and divine domains.
You gain access to the advanced teachings of your arcane institution, learning a powerful new school spell.
Sometimes, you need to adapt your alchemical mixtures to new situations.
You emerge from hiding and deliver a blow that can knock an enemy sprawling to the ground.
You transform into your animal.
You deepen the connection into your animal instincts.
Your music, speech, or other performance inspires your allies to dive into battle.
Your thorough studies allow you to cast more arcane spells each day.
You are more than just skillful; your drive to find the secrets of the past manifests as a strange kind of luck.
You slow down, focus, and take a careful shot.
You’ve learned how best to move in heavy armor.
You rebuff puny attacks with your armor, knocking back your foe.
You can move freely through terrain you're attuned to.
You excel at watching your allies’ backs and helping them watch yours.
You've unlocked the first secrets of beast guns, granting you the power of their synergistic magic.
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.
You've learned to modify your innovation in order to enhance its capabilities beyond what an ordinary piece of equipment can accomplish.
When you cast _sigil_, you can modify the spell to allow you to determine the target's location.
You learn to take advantage of every shot, flying across the battlefield with the help of your weapon's recoil.
Your blow inflicts profuse bleeding.
When you focus your magic on an ally, you can remove harmful conditions.
Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents.
Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more spells of your bloodline’s tradition each day.
Your magical blood makes you more resistant to magic.
By efficiently and carefully manipulating the arcane energies unleashed by your bonded item, you can conserve just enough power to cast another spell, though this second spell is slightly weaker.
You sway with the motions of your spells that animate the dead, channeling your power to sustain two at the same time.
Augmenting your eidolon extends to creatures you summon.
With a wresting of will, you siphon off a creature's mental energy to replenish your own.
Your confidence borders on self-delusion, but it keeps you going against overwhelming odds.
You can use a powerful breath weapon, much like the dragon you emulate.
You carefully align your weapon with the edge of your blade, splitting the projectile in two as you fire to attack two different targets.
You carefully take aim to avoid your foe’s concealment and cover.
Your composition takes the form of a call-and-response chant that lets your allies continue the effect without you.
You build a powerful magical connection with a chosen gun or crossbow, gaining the ability to conjure it directly to your hand from any distant location.
Massive waves spiral around you, with you as the eye of the hurricane.
You can cast a 3rd-level _summon animal_ as an innate spell, but only to summon a black bear.

When you successfully Play to the Crowd, add the following to the list of benefits you can choose from:
  • A creature you can see within 30 feet becomes frightened 2.
Your occult connection to the world helps you deal with being frightened or stupefied.
The eye rebels, the mind recoils—no matter how much those who can see you try to explain what's there, their friends' gazes just skitter over you, like a bird afraid to land.
When you resist a spell, you capture some of its magic for your own use.
When your swarm is sharing your space and Strides, you can choose to have your swarm carry you with it.
The dart fired by your ostilli can ricochet to strike another creature.
Your foe can hardly predict and counter your moves if you yourself have no idea what will happen.
The secrets of time peel back, revealing deeper truths.
You learn a mystical stance that transforms your qi into sticky smoke that shrouds your limbs.
You can clue in all your allies at once.
A floating metal ball forms in a space within 30 feet, flashing with electricity.
Your eidolon constricts the creature, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to your eidolon's level plus its Strength modifier, with a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC.
You maximize the effectiveness of your explosives by controlling every possible parameter of the blast meticulously.
You become more dangerous when surrounded by enemies.
You gather the energy of your maelstrom and fling its unleashed power into the enemy's curse, attempting to neutralize it.
Your enchantments and illusions are so dominant that you can use them to counteract similar magic cast by others.
Your overwhelming vitality sets undead alight.
Odd interactions in your bloodline provide you with unexpected effects.
Even if you don’t speak a creature’s language, you can rely on inflection, root words, and body language to infer rudimentary meaning.
Attuned to all arrangements of qi, you gain lifesense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.
After your attack, you grab a bit of blood, cut hair, or other piece of the creature's body.
Whorls of wind surround your lower body, forming a cyclone that lifts you into the air.

When you Unleash your Psyche, all your rage and pain—the portion of your psyche dedicated to cruel retribution—come along with it.

 The force of your dark persona's negativity batters constantly against all creatures in a 30-foot emanation when you Unleash your Psyche and for as long as your Psyche is Unleashed.
You aim for your prey’s weak spots, making your shot more challenging but dealing more damage if you hit.
You gain access to the butterfly sword's critical specialization effect.
The dart fired by your ostilli is more dangerous.
You reveal a glimpse of the impossible conflicts between the divine anathema behind your curse, forcing you to reckon with another's conflicts as well.
With some streamlining to your process and a deeper collection of  <%CONSUMABLES%19%> talisman <%END> materials, you make a greater number of talismans every day.
By scrutinizing a foe, you learn how to better avoid its attacks.
Imitating animal threat displays, you make yourself appear larger and more imposing.
You try to jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects.
You attack with enough force to knock the weapon out of your foe's hands.
You use your foes’ openings to expose even greater weaknesses.
You toss one weapon into the air as a distraction as you throw another.
Your Pathfinder training allows you to quickly size up numerous threats.
As your understanding increases, your god grants you more divine spells each day.
Although you aren't a proper champion of your faith, your deity still recognizes your efforts and provides you with a small divine ability to help others.
You learn dream-related magic to aid your studies.
A haze of pollen floats around you.
You push the enemy back and attempt to intercede between the foe and your ally.
You split your attacks.
If your next action is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots, you gain a benefit.
You elegantly counterattack against your flailing enemy.
With assistance from your spotter, you aim for an especially accurate attack.
Beyond relying on your own senses, you keep an ear open for nearby creatures for help in exploring your surroundings.
Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills.
The natural world can be scary to those not used to it—and you make it scarier still.
The tracks you leave behind are strange, somehow disconcerting and unnerving—they might travel backward, or through places no one would think to pass through.
You can perform particularly extensive rituals  in less time.
As you continue to collect talismanic esoterica, you improve your ability to create temporary talismans.
Though you've dedicated yourself to one element, you learn to mix that element with another.
You are able to escape inquisitions involving divine magic, allowing you to blend in well in Mzali but also to avoid unwanted attention in other oppressive theocracies.
With elemental forces, you make your emblazoned symbols more potent.
With a single whisper carried on the wind, you enchant your ammunition to make a foe more vulnerable to your attacks.
Your eidolon has stronger resistance.
Your psychopomp's continued service in Pharasma's name brings it favor from the goddess.
Gritting your teeth through the pain, you position yourself to counterattack.
Your magic explodes.
Most of the changes from the demon within you have harmed you so far, but you've found a way to expel some of the corruption within you to poison others.

You can use your magic to transform into a small creature of a type that commonly serves as a spellcaster's familiar, potentially allowing you to safely scout for your party while retaining a degree of spellcasting ability.
Your familiar’s magical presence can serve as an aspect of a ritual.
Unfurling your wings in a quick snap, you send feathers scattering in all directions.
You fluidly move between stances in the process of dodging.
Your attack can ground an airborne foe.
You can heal your wounds while reshaping your flesh.
You’ve mastered the shape of dinosaurs.
You have learned some of the tricks the fey use to bend primal magic toward illusions and trickery.
You connect with the fey trickster within yourself to create whimsical illusory duplicates that distract your foes.
Ignoring your pain, you sear your attacker with a wave of flame.
You love to kick your enemies when they're down, and you look fabulous when you do.
Your shield flares with holy light as you block the attack, searing the undead with the power of your faith.
You can use Flashy Dodge before attempting a Reflex save, in addition to its original trigger.
When you hit with both attacks with Double Slice, you flense the target, making it bleed and creating a weak spot.
You request that nearby plants share their vitality with you to replenish your body and magic.
Even in the face of failure you press the attack, determined to succeed.
You feel confident that you can explain your scrolls so well that even your allies can use them.
The world conspires to keep you forgotten and unnoticed— memories cloud, ink stains out your name in ledgers, and portraits of you crack and warp over your face.
You have trained your mind and body to tolerate polymorph magic for longer periods of time, so long as you prepare for the change appropriately.
Your flesh is resistent to physical damage.
Your anthems grow louder and more potent, bolstered by your muse’s power.
You toss your friends around the battlefield.
Your attunement to arcane cold enhances the depths of your growing power.
You bully foes across the battlefield.
When you prepare a staff, you can hold it up to a weapon to merge the two items.
More future memories of time magic percolate back to the present, teaching you spells you've yet to learn.
You can guide your crop to move without notice.
The Gray Gardeners are known for having nerves of steel and an unbreakable resolve.
You can suppress your tether to the ground, overcoming your resistance to fly free.
When you use a full-power Megaton Strike, you can knock your foe back.
You can mix a blend of crushed flowers and alchemical salt into an alchemical elixir with the healing trait or alchemical food.
You've learned to recognize the telltale writings and other signs that indicate the presence of magical traps.
You control your spirit energy when you attack, using it to reinforce yourself or to thrust past your enemy’s physical defenses.
Your familiar alters the material of a spell into that of a precious metal.
You are a xun for the Golden League, aiding the organization.
Your flesh has been specially treated with the same arcane and alchemical processes used to toughen the skin of flesh golems.
You can summon the full magic of Bhopan's grand dance.
Your bragging is particularly effective.
The extent of your corruption devastates your foes' minds and reflexes.
Your faith enhances your ability to remove conditions.
Shield in hand, you offer your ally its full protection you do yourself.
Your time spent tracking your target allows you to quickly identify its weaknesses and relay them to your allies.
You know how to deliver focused, powerful blows that bypass your enemies’ resistances.
You call upon deep reserves of toughness and mental fortitude to power through an otherwise debilitating effect.
You magically divert some of the harm from an incoming attack away from yourself, forcing your undead companion to take it in your stead.
Your innovation is augmented with plates shaped to resemble the gaping maws of guardian lions, which you can energize to expel a stream of sonic energy reminiscent of a lion’s powerful roar.
Your spirit guide discorporates to surround you in an invisible protective shroud.
You slow your foes with a well-aimed attack.
You have an intuitive ability to sense hazards.
Your devotion to your mount manifests as a surge of vital energy.
You can infuse your enchantments and illusions with more power.
Ranik Helt knows a special technique to hide his spells as part of a performance, and you've learned this technique.
Using a carefully aimed shot, you make a creature “dance.”
Your eidolon grows substantially.
All twilight speakers are trained to resist the alluring customs of younger peoples, but you have made it your mandate to keep the Ilverani way unchanged.
You refuse to let foes past your guard.
Fog condenses in a chaotic, swirling pattern, thick enough that it seems to push back against you.
From armor plating and flexible components, to reinforced materials and backup redundant functionality, you have built safeguards to protect your vehicle from the rigors of combat.
When you use Command Undead on a mindless undead, if the undead succeeds at its save but doesn't critically succeed, it becomes your minion for 1 round.
The power of your elemental blast improves.
Choose physical invigoration or mental invigoration, and add the listed conditions to those you can choose for an invigorating elixir.
You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects.
You've learned to repair your equipment even in challenging circumstances, making use of what you have available.
You can apply critical specialization effects to improvised weapons you wield.
By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true.
Your mature animal companions continue to grow and develop.
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.
Thanks to your continual tinkering, your construct companion has advanced to an astounding new stage of engineering, enhancing all its attributes.
Your familiar is imbued with even more magic than other familiars.
Under your care and training, your megafauna companion has realized its innate potential.
Under your care and training, your mount has realized its innate potential.
You imbue the necrotized flesh of your reanimated construct companion with strange chemicals and fine-tune the clockwork within, enhancing all its capabilities.
You've spent countless hours learning to recognize and predict a creature's innate magical abilities.
When you roll a success to Command an Animal, you get a critical success.
During your daily preparations, you can review stratagems for the day’s adventures with up to five allies.
You trust your instincts and your sense of smell, using all your senses to pinpoint your opponent's location.
You attempt to snag the foe before they run away.
You charge into battle with shield-splintering fury.
You can invoke the Crimson Oath to unleash blasts of ruby energy from your weapon.
Even the heaviest armors serve only to enhance your unbridled fury.
You enter the stance of impenetrable iron, refusing to yield to any blow.
You relax your posture and loosen your joints, allowing yourself to move with incredible fluidity.
This multi-sequence rocket blasts confetti at a series of altitudes.
Your encounter with one of the rare forces of nature known as kaiju has imbued you with knowledge of a martial art that allows you to emulate a fraction of their power.
As a candle can light another, you awaken the latent potential to channel fire in other creatures.
You knock the enemy's blow aside and twist, unbalancing your foe.
You aim to turn knowledge into power against your foes.
When you Recall Knowledge, you gain additional information or context.
Your academic knowledge about a creature allows you to subtly alter your magic to defeat them.
When you cast _mage hand_, you can modify it to steal an object from the target.
You're quick enough to line up a shot even while diving to the ground.
You've learned more than the use of hand crossbows from drow lore.
You can wrap your lash around a tree branch or railing, then pull yourself where you need to go.
Strike your foe and make them unbalanced
Your familiar learns to empower spells with an electrical discharge.
When you cast _fireball_, you can modify its effects to set creatures in its area aflame.
You gain access to the lion scythe's and sun sling's critical specialization effects.
There are generally few things as ill-advised as being shot out of a cannon or launched by a trebuchet, but people use the tactic every so often in a desperate situation.
Nothing can stop you as long as you have an audience cheering you on.
During your daily preparations, you can gain the assistance of an allied prepared spellcaster to prepare one spell for the day.
Make an unexpected ranged attack with a Juggled item.
You see what others don’t, and you’ve developed magical tricks to find hidden truth.
You know that fate sometimes conspires to keep dangerous knowledge or items from the eyes of those most able to understand them.
You imbue your ammunition with raw and potent magic, transforming it to suit your needs in any situation.
You've learned a few tricks to ensure you find every last magic item and interesting magical effect during your missions.
Your eidolon gains more magic.
Increase your proficiency rank in one of Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion from expert to master and in another from trained to expert.
You announce your name to your enemies, bringing your constellation to bear in a blinding display.
You quickly snatch up whatever is nearby and then attack with it as an improvised weapon.
You open your mind to further weapon customization.
You've modified your innovation using clever workarounds, so you can include another initial modification without compromising its structure.
You gain the _mantis form_ focus spell
You can take on any number of mundane guises.
You go to extreme lengths to support your allies, even when it means bringing harm to yourself.
You harness the magical energy flowing through your eyeless mask to effortlessly protect you from visual effects.
Your thoughts sting back when a lesser mind tries to invade your own.
Your rapidly metabolize the elemental particles in your opponent's spell to gain a boost of energy.
Your rapidly metabolize the elemental particles in your opponent's spell to gain a boost of energy.
You have learned to stretch your mind's influence further, releasing projectiles with a swing of your mind weapon.
Your eidolon can shrink even further.
The stars warn you of danger in the nick of time.
You leverage your knowledge of martial arts to mix different maneuvers together into a single flowing combination.
Your shots become nimble and deadly.
You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed when you’re not wearing armor.
Your vision pierces through non-magical fog, mist, rain, and snow.
Your familiar's supernatural spirit has outgrown its corporeal body.
Basic mutagens that affect your physical form can bring out the beast within you, turn you nigh invincible, or make your body more elastic.
Increase the spell slots you gain from oracle archetype feats
Regular exposure to necromantic effects left you better able to defend against them.
Reduce the power that necromantic effects hold over you.
You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger.

You can connect with oozes (and other amorphous aberrations, at the GM's discretion) on a rudimentary level.
When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction.
You use an opening to capture your prey.

Even when your limbs are severed, they remain a part of you.
You quickly fling some of your powered-up mechanisms to an ally, sharing your benefits with them briefly.
You and your companion move to take down a common enemy.
You've sworn a pact with devils, granting you success in life in exchange for your soul in the afterlife.
Your enzymes can paralyze your foes rather than merely making it harder for them to heal their wounds.
You can cast more spells each day.
You have uncanny insight into the way ghosts and haunts manifest, manipulate the mind, and rejuvenate.

You gain resistance equal to half your level to all damage from effects with the appropriate trait for your School of Perfection: fire for Unblinking Flame, water for Unbreaking Waves, air for Unfolding Wind, and earth for Untwisting Iron.
You have expanded your supply of near-infinite items.
You can cast _creation_ as an innate spell at will, choosing whether it is arcane or primal each time.
You know how to clear a line of fire for your allies.
You spend a lot of time focusing on your physical fitness.
You target your opponent's clothing, equipment, or loose flesh with a series of piercing projectiles to pin them to the ground or a nearby surface.
Unsuspecting targets are especially vulnerable to your poisons.
The skies are your rightful place, and you will not suffer another to occupy them.
With punishing blows, you force your opponent into position.
You learn how to create a luminous reservoir of positive energy that you can use to punish undead who dare attack you.
Your snares are particularly dif cult for enemies to avoid.
You can better Aid your crop.
You have learned to mimic the power that lies between magic and material.
You somehow manage to have just the thing for the situation.
You provide preventative remedies and care to help your patient fight off future maladies.
Increase the spell slots you gain from druid archetype feats by 1 for each spell rank other than your two highest druid spell slots.
You pluck missiles from the air and hurl them back at their source.
You place your body between your friends and your enemies, protecting your allies against oncoming attacks.
Many physical poses can fortify one’s health, but some poses need more than one body to accomplish.
Some rebel Firebrand cells make a practice of publicly declaring the main target of a given operation.
You turn an element into its purest form.
As you spin and glide your fans alongside your allies, you kick up a mild wind that gently carries you all forward.
You're always ready to get the jump on your target.
You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought.
You know that situations can change rapidly and might leave you needing to change equipment in the middle of combat.
You raise a druidic monument, such as a standing stone or warding tree, from the ground, creating a powerful primal ward that blocks other types of magic.
You spend 10 minutes and open yourself to the divine mysteries of the world, peering into the most sinister portents of the future.
You have a knack for drawing the right card, be it from a harrow deck, in a game of cards, or even when drawing from a _Deck of Many Things_.
You quickly assess the threat so you can relay the information to your team.
You're able to scavenge the cogwheels from your daily quick-deploy snares that use gears.
You bellow a ferocious call to arms, inspiring yourself to lash out at a foe.
You keep hold of your weapons even when knocked out.
You give a target a stern glower to remind them that it is you, and no one else, they should truly fear.
Your spell reaches into the mind of a creature and removes you from it.
Through the haze of battle, you quickly recover your raging vigor.
Even your fears serve as fuel for your fighting spirit.
You can remove conditions with divine grace.
You twist your hand in front of the blow, ensuring the enemy's attack shatters the required _holy water_ or bomb.
You exhale tendrils formed from flakes of rusted metal.
You dive into the fray before rewinding yourself to safety.
You adopt a stance to rebound your thrown weapons toward you.
After the triggering attack is done, Step.
Heroes learn from their previous failures, often succeeding on the third attempt.
You can temporarily replicate the effects of a property rune for your weapon or unarmed attacks.
You charge, throwing your body at your foe in a vicious tackle.
Every dwarf knows that the rock they walk upon can be either a best friend or a treacherous path.
With divine awareness, you twist your body to lessen the impact of an attack.
You've girded your soul against outside interference.
You touch a weapon and bring it into concordance with your deity.
Blood-drinking vines grow from the ground in a 15-foot burst within 120 feet.
You fight fiercely to protect your crop.
When you cast _fireball_, you can modify its area to be two non-overlapping 10-foot bursts.
You evade an incoming attack by twisting your enemy’s tactics in your favor.
Scholarly debates have taught you to think on your feet.
Your continued service grants you another boon.
You protect those near to you with a flash of steel and a stroke of good luck.
You sense chaos as an unsettling feeling of nervous energy.
You sense evil as a queasy or foreboding feeling.
The presence of goodness sickens you with its saccharine self-righteousness.
You attach a piece of your shadow to a spell to cloud the senses and cause mischief.
You dedicate yourself to the shadows.
You may be slower than you were in life, but your pace is unfaltering.
You stoke an ally's fury.
You thrust your hand or weapon into the ground and release a pulse that creates a sheltering nexus of energy for you and your allies.
You swing your weapon at your foe, rebuffing them back.
As is the tradition with many Firebrands, you call your shot and look to impress with an extra bit of panache or a greater stunt.
Your saliva causes severe nausea and mild fever in the living, weakening them so that you can more easily finish them off.
You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue.
During daily preparations, you can indulge in your associated sin.
When you cast _vampiric touch_, you can modify its standard effects as follows: Instead of gaining the temporary Hit Points yourself, you can grant the temporary Hit Points to an ally within 30 feet.
Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master and in another of your skills from trained to expert.
Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master and in another of your skills from trained to expert.
You can activate the magic of a scroll with a cursory read as you draw it from your belt.
You Leap toward an opponent.
You carry scraps of materials dangerous to undead and can apply them to your weapon.
Your tongue darts out in search of refreshment.
Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren’t off-guard.
You load an extra dose of powder into your shot, causing it to belch a cloud of smoke.
When you cast _fireball_, you can modify the spell to leave behind a brief cloud of smoke in its area.
Pathfinders are trained to help each other be safe and successful, and you know how to jolt your allies back to their senses.
Wings free you from the shackles of the ground below.
Blinding flames explode in a swirling sphere! The detonation fills a 20-foot burst within 60 feet of you.
You call to the wilds with the voice of a songbird, thereby summoning a cloud of its kin.
Your muse has opened your senses to the world beyond.
You attack in an arc and enact your spell against everyone you hit.
You touch a willing creature, causing its skin to harden and form spiky protrusions.
Your familiar can subsume its body to become pure spirit.
You purify a spirit by coaxing it to release its anguish in a final cathartic howl.
Like nefarious sportlebores, a species of insect that plague adventurers by hiding in their rations as counterfeit food, your swarm can crawl down throats.
You slice or smash your opponent with the melee portion of your weapon before pulling the trigger at point-blank range.
When necessary to avoid a magical compulsion or curse, you can be as stubborn as your megafauna companion.
You've honed one spell as your favored combat technique, and you've practiced it enough that you no longer need to prepare it to cast it.
You've modified your dynamo with Stasian coils, allowing you to make a powerful attack that crackles with electricity.
You have an eye for fashion and know how to sell attitude and confidence with your walk.
Your body and equipment appear to be made of stone as you hold perfectly still.
When you cast _vampiric touch_, you can modify it to remove your enfeebled or clumsy condition.
You can mix in a sticky additive to an alchemical bomb to make its contents adhere and continue to deal damage.
Your familiar can shed its material form, becoming a mass of animated magic.
You become surrounded by a swirling storm of rain, sand, snow, or clouds, whichever of those suits your bound terrain.
Dark thunderclouds swirl in a miniature storm, crisscrossed with lightning bolts; a tremendous thunderclap fills the air.
You squeeze the breath out of your foe.
You attempt a dizzying blow.
Your iron grip saps your opponent’s strength.
You draw a concealed weapon, attack with it, and then hide it away again in one smooth motion.
You make an impressive leap and swing while you soar.
You call alternate versions of yourself, either from a different timeline or perhaps yourself from a different point in your current timeline, to aid you in combat.
With the merest thought, you realign your mental defenses to your duel's circumstances.
When an ally you can see falls in battle, your surge of righteous indignation allows you to draw upon untapped reserves of divine power.
You focus the power of your spell to overcome enemies' resistances.
You’ve learned that it pays for a Pathfinder to be able to cast spells without being noticed.
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against unnatural weather events or environmental hazards occurring in blighted or otherwise unnaturally marred regions.
You've learned how to use even your reflection to your advantage.
You move with a swashbuckler’s speed and grace.
The earth parts before you, letting you swim through it.
When you wriggle free from an enemy’s grasp, you take something of theirs with you.
Your hair attacks gain the reach trait and you can deliver hexes through it.
You Stride.
Enemies who attempt to stab you in the back will be unhappy to find your lashing tail on guard.
You extend your arms like gnarled branches to interfere with your foes' movements.
You rake into your opponent with two claws, cutting into their muscle and depriving them of needed strength.
You are able to adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain.
Your flesh tears and warps as you transform.
You know how to make a larger creature hurt when it falls to the ground.
You can detect the flickers of mental activity let off by all thinking creatures.
You thrash your foe around.
With a resounding cry, you rally your ally to take the offensive.
When you observe an ally try and fail to execute a strategic maneuver against your enemies, you coordinate with your other allies to finish the job.
You gain the _transcribe moment_ focus spell.
You deftly dive through a gap left by a foe to deliver an advantageous blow.
Your fans, one raised up alongside your head and the other alongside your hip, become a blur as you twirl across the battlefield.
They thought you had used up all your devices, but they thought wrong! You have a few more gadgets up your sleeve than others expect.
While no one, not even you, might appear to understand why, you demonstrate a greater ability to hit your targets regardless of the obstacles in your way.
You have witnessed hundreds of fighting styles and quickly adapt to defend against complicated maneuvers.
You're relentless and nigh unkillable, shrugging off blows that should destroy you, though they might make your body start to fall apart.
You can understand the true meaning of texts quickly, and even when you get lost or hit a dead end, you aren’t discouraged from making further attempts to get to the bottom of things.
You have mastered a magical technique for moving through dangerous woodlands unseen.
Your faith and hope can’t be shaken, and you won’t flee when lives are at stake.
You know the precise limits of your armor, and trust it to save you from harm.
You and your spotter take advantage of each other's attacks to momentarily hide and throw your foes off-balance against your follow-up attack.
You aim for your victim's prominent arteries.
You are one of the raiders eagerly planning to launch an assault by sea on the Whispering Tyrant's Isle of Terror.
Your ego swells, granting you a temporary reprieve from your pain.
The raw energy of the Void saps the essence of the living.
While in your trance, you can blur the line between dreams and reality for others.
You frighten  a foe into moving where you want them, traditionally demanding they walk the plank.
You defy gravity, traversing vertical planes as easily as the ground.
You point out vulnerabilities present in your hunted prey, granting the benefits listed in Hunt Prey and your hunter’s edge to an ally until the end of their next turn.

The entity inhabiting your body is an aberrant being with unfathomable motivations, and when you hold a foe close, tendrils and tentacles unfurl from your body to crush your foe and pollute it with alien wrongness.
When in the throes of your curse, your steps take on a supernatural buoyancy.
You are adept at using the unusual resonance of your _wayfinder_ to aid in any deceptions you might employ.

Rather than conjuring creatures from elsewhere in the world or the planes, you can temporarily pull a much different version of yourself from an alternate timeline—for instance, instead of summoning a generic or random troll with summon giant, you summon a troll version of yourself from a timeline where you're a troll.
Your spell leaves a lingering connection between you and a creature—one through which you can nudge the creature's mind this way or that.
You carefully consider your case and narrow down some of the details.
You learn a stance that lets you attack from a distance.
You bid the winds to aid you, carrying you through the air and allowing you passage through the strongest headwinds.
You spread your wings wide, pushing foes away from you.

You concentrate on your mental state, tapping into that raw emotional energy.

You can connect with cave worms (and other worm-related creatures, at the GM's discretion) on a rudimentary level.
You can sniff out fellow werecreatures and master impersonators alike.
You bless yourself on the move.

The magic in your blood is unpredictable.
Casting your memory back deep into the past, you take the form of an ancestral guardian.

The connection between you and primal magic deepens.
You have developed magical techniques to aid you with stalking your prey.

You can tap into the heavenly magic that is your birthright.

You wield primal magic.
