You tap into a bottomless hunger for carnage.
You emulate your vampiric parent's techniques for drawing blood from a victim.
Using a mixture of dinosaur bones and the bones of your ancestors to focus your magic, you animate lizards and dinosaurs to carry messages or serve as mounts.
You can remove your ribs to use them as arrows or bolts.
You smell of honey and savory things.
When you're in difficult terrain from an environmental feature, you can Take Cover, even if the feature wouldn't ordinarily be large enough for you to Take Cover.
Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes studying your surroundings in search of omens related to a particular course of action to cast _augury_ as an innate divine spell.
You ignore concealment from clouds, dust, fog, mist, smoke, and similarly loose matter.
The wild wonder of Elysium harmonizes within you, and in dire straits, you can share its benefits with your allies.
The life-giving energy that flows in your blood revitalizes you.
You can snare the attentions of onlookers with your unique appearance.
You've adopted the calming presence of catrinas, the festive dead..
You've learned a few magical techniques for getting yourself both into and out of trouble unnoticed.

You hang onto a foe to harry them into submission.

You consume the magic of an incoming spell or effect to protect your allies, though you might give yourself indigestion.
You have developed a soul-deep bond with your comrades and maintain an even greater degree of cooperation with them.
The coral colony that you've tended has merged with your kidneys to add an additional layer of filtration.
Your core allows you to draw more power from it.
When you use Crystalline Dust, you can spend one additional action to disperse the motes as a 10-foot-radius cloud centered on you instead of as haze; the activity gains the concentrate trait.
Whether you are climbing a ship’s rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can’t.
The magic of Abaddon runs through your blood, and you can wield that power.
Tales tell of the Tiger stalking the Mousedeer for days, hidden and instilling dread upon its prey.
You dart under the legs of your enemies in combat.

You can hang by your tail from any suitable anchor point, such as a tree branch, balcony, or rocky outcropping (subject to the GM's discretion), typically while climbing.
Your life has been spent challenging death itself, and proximity to that implacable foe only makes your heart beat harder.
Your body tenses up when surrounded, putting you on edge just enough to anticipate an attack.
You know how to destroy objects with a well-placed explosion.
You can channel the power of the Abyss through your heritage, producing terrible tangible effects.
Drawing on the infernal power of your sinister forbears, you mislead your foes with magical deception.
You are an endless well of knowledge and can remember several vital pieces of information at once.
The venom injected by your fangs disorients your foes.
Accepting your inner darkness means that no outer darkness can obscure your sight.

You’ve studied your extraplanar heritage with the intent of better defending yourself, whether against creatures aligned with or opposed to your extraplanar lineage, and you’ve found that your techniques are equally powerful against celestials, fiends, and other divine entities.
With effort, you can call forth magical wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your extraplanar forebear, whether they be elegantly feathered wings or ominous bat wings.
The magic of djinn runs through your blood.
Your hold has a unique draconic connection.
The blood of the Dragon Kings runs strong in your veins.
You touch an adjacent creature and attempt to draw out its excess emotion.

Your connection to earth and stone allows you to feel the slightest displacement that disturbs them, down to the shift of a pebble.
You pause a moment to attune your senses to the stone around you.
Your limbs and even your torso can collapse in on themselves, allowing you to fit through tight spaces as though you were a Small creature.
The magic of your efreeti ancestors flows through you.
You move in a graceful dance, and even your steps are broad.
When your allies call for swift reinforcements or lightning raids, you're ready to answer.
As an emissary, you have assisted land-bound creatures in journeying underwater to visit your settlements.
You've lived a thousand lives and done a hundred-thousand things.
Energy runs through your blood more powerfully.
You spit venom onto a weapon you're holding or a weapon held by a willing creature within 30 feet; you can also use this ability to envenom your nagaji fangs unarmed attack.
You can elude supernatural disaster.
Your inborn arcane power grows.
You've continued to refine the knowledge and skills you've gained through your life.
Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects.
You have trained with your animal companion to become a terrifying juggernaut on the battlefield.
With heavy wing beats, you whip up a furious gust and direct it at your opponents.
The fey influence on your form and features grows even more powerful and notable.
You can use faerie magic to hide yourself and expose hidden foes.

Fiends unfortunate enough to be trampled beneath your feet or rent within your grasp are swiftly granulated into bone kindling and blood powder, and the pain of your strikes prevents them from action.
You possess fiendish magic.
You can strain to call forth bat-like or otherwise fiendish wings from your back, similar in appearance to those of your fiendish ancestors.
You challenge a single ally to a physical competition.
Over time your fey magic has grown stronger.
You let out an ear-piercing screech.
Certain magics in the world flow easily through your sap.
Vitality and elemental wood flows out from your body and into the earth, infusing it with a stream of new life.
Passing unseen within society is second nature to you now.
You’ve trained in battle formations for a plethora of situations.
Thanks to rigorous breathing exercises and a diet similar to that of your lineage, your magical breath is more powerful.
Your mind is unusually resilient and resistant to influence.
You have grown more comfortable with your penchant for supernatural disappearance.
You intone vows to shoulder others’ pains; in response, your torso sprouts an additional pair of arms to help you bear those burdens.
When you critically hit with a foxfire Strike, the target takes an additional 1d4 persistent damage of the same type as the foxfire.
You always have time for a joke or prank.
You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.
You can scoop up your friends with your horns to hurl them across the battlefield.
Your flight is unbound, as natural as it was before you were awakened.
You gain the effects of Juvenile Flight at all times, rather than just once per day for 10 minutes.
You are descended from the wondrous garudas, and their keen senses manifest in your magical prowess.
You are descended from the einherji, the worthy warriors of chaos.
You can summon a mass of magic energy in your hand that, naturally, you use to smack those who offend you.
Driven by the momentum of your thundering steps and powerful mass, your horns can pierce your foes.
One of your nodes has adapted into a new magic-emitting organ.
You carry the bones of your ancestors with you, and you can ask them for counsel.
You can assume your oni form more easily, and with greater benefits.
The spirits of vegetation send you on your way, letting you move in a burst of speed.
Nodules, hooks, or claws on your limbs allow you to cling to surfaces with ease.
Your upbringing emphasized teamwork, and helping your allies comes naturally to you.
Your mind, like a dark naga's, foils attempts to read your thoughts.
Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly.
There’s no journey too far or burden too heavy when you have friends at your side or hope within your heart.
Your shadow can contain objects.
In the past, you would have been a proud initiate of the Saoc Brethren.
When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering.
Your skill with herbs has improved.
You have begun the final steps to reaching your full potential.
The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits.
You grind or gnaw a particularly wicked edge onto your claws.
You invoke mantras of tellurian rebirth.
You’ll eat anything and anyone.
You can widen your field of vision, allowing you to affect more creatures with your Hypnotic Lure.
Your special connection to death and rebirth allows you to sense when it’s your time to enter the Great Beyond, and now isn’t the time.
Some land dwellers say that merfolk are bad luck.
You have increased skill with improvised weapons.
A stroke of brilliance gives you a major advantage with a skill despite your inexperience.
Your body is capable of recycling its own air.
Your body can internally synthesize oxygen for limited periods of time.
You summon an aura of shimmering heat, flurrying snow, crashing waves, or swirling wind and lightning.
You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions.
You can cast _dispel magic_ and _reaper's lantern_ once per day each as 2nd-level divine innate spells.
You can use magic to show others desert hospitality.
The magic of jann runs through your blood.
You can wield the arcane magic of a kizidhar
Your ancestors’ defiance of magic and your people’s strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you.
The small spirits known as kodama pride themselves in taking care of trees and other vegetation, and they’ll happily come to your aid as well.
Your tail's chaotic and independent nature causes it to perform mischief even when you don't intend it, and it can somehow steal things it shouldn't be able to handle.
Your sinister giggle is a sound of warning and threat.
The vanaras of old were tricksters able to step across wide rivers or slip into impossibly small spaces.
You've focused on enhancing yourself and have received an improvement to one of your existing abilities.
You phase through a space that a living creature occupies in a flash, spontaneously appearing on the opposite side of it in a vibrant display of colorful light.
Your journey to enlightenment has made your blood possess nigh-immortal properties, allowing you to heal others.
You've battled the fiendish power within your nature and come out on top; whatever you decide to do with your life, for good or evil, will be your choice and your choice alone.
Not everyone is reincarnated, and you feel a strong connection with the spiritual echoes of those who didn't receive the same opportunity as you.

When you use Cat's Luck to reroll, any creatures you choose within 10 feet who also just failed against the same effect (such as a single spell) can also reroll their saving throws and use the better result.
You have a keepsake that grants you luck.
Putting on a new face offers a great way to get a fresh perspective on life.
You can use Shifting Faces three times per day instead of once per day.
You channel the magic of marids.
Your mask has grown into a manifestation of your pain, which you can release.
Your years of training in a previous life didn’t go to waste with your death, and you can call upon this training when you most need it.
You're an extraordinary teacher, capable of inspiring your students to amazing feats of athletics and ingenuity.
Geniekin can't grant magical wishes, but some echo of power lingers within you.
Your origin in the space behind mirrors enables you to use a mirror as a hideaway, like the spell _meld into stone_.
You upgrade the vishkanyan venom you can apply with Envenom to moderate vishkanyan venom.
Your moist skin is especially resistant to damage from temperature-altering effects.
You have either trained a giant moray eel since its hatching or have tamed one in the wild.
Much like morrignas, you feel an affinity for spiders.
You have the protective instinct your own mother lacks and will gladly suffer in another's place.
Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most.
You instinctively create magical boats that keep your feet dry (mostly).
You’ve learned to split your focus between multiple classes with ease.
Your connection with elemental iron grants you a natural field of weak magnetic attraction.
You can tap into the magic that runs through your blood.
You leave little sign when attempting to remain unseen.
You can induce wound repair by circulating magic throughout your body.
Your study of occult practices has shown you how to best defend against them.
Nanites augment your attacks.
The arcane magic you possess grows in power and complexity.
As long as you are Small, you can end your movement in the same square as a Small ally.
You have mastered how to hunt with your pack.
Your dedication to the ideals of art and beauty allows your head gem to access the power of the waning moon.
You issue a cloud of your fragrance like a full-body sneeze—but one that might save your life as the powerful perfume makes your attackers' eyes sting and water.
The shimmering embers of the righteous peris crackle at your fingertips.
Your pheromones now linger on creatures.
You steep yourself in superstition and practice ancient orc mental exercises for shrugging off the effects of magic.
An easy way to trick others is to throw your voice into a nearby forest or thicket to make strange noises.
Your quills can dig particularly deep into the flesh of your opponents.
One of your parents has a human life span and another an elven life span, with your own somewhere between.
You're now able to connect with the spirits present in the greenery of the natural world.
You give a throaty growl to attempt to Demoralize a creature you just found.
Your body anticipates the blow.
With a shout of triumph, you grant inspiration to an ally fight on.
You've deeply studied the secrets of your blood and can force reality to act against its own wishes.
You use your command over your form to repair lifethreatening wounds.
Your connection to the Boneyard empowers you to bring death to all forms of life and unlife, exploiting their weaknesses.
You can launch a mass of quills at opponents.
Even when faced with deadly danger, you fight with the rapturous laughter of Ragdya in your heart and can play impossible tricks.
Throughout the day, your body produces powerful projectiles within your chassis.
You remember the secrets of your rakshasa forebears and know how to apply those memories to get results.
You and your family know well the ravages of rakshasa predations, and you know how to best defend yourself against their growing corruption in the world.
Some feel trapped by their choices and have a tough time reinventing themselves.
You can transform into an innocuous-looking rat.
You're incredibly skilled in iruxi astrology, and you can gain useful (if cryptic) hints from the stars' alignment.
You tie yourself to the Material Plane by implanting a piece of your consciousness into a weapon, piece of armor, or other item that's precious to you.
You trigger your body's repair programming, causing your body's nanites to heal your wounds.
You draw life from the water around you.
You have mastered the technique of arcing a projectile so that it returns to your hand after being thrown, though this requires a moment to precisely calculate the trajectory and possible ricochets.
You quickly use your momentum to topple and spring off of foes.
Even when tired, you refuse to give up, pushing yourself to extreme feats of endurance.
Drag a grabbed creature into nearby water
Webbing sprouts on your legs and tail as you shift to a more aquatic form.
Your time spent among the Rivethun has heightened your awareness of animate spirits around you, giving you the ability to sense them briefly.
Ancestral spirits have begun to bond themselves to you, granting you powers characteristic of a rokoa.
When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.
As you fall to the ground, you transform into a white bottle, gourd, or sake jar, then roll away before anyone can pick you up.
The spirit within your pusaka resonates with other magical items in your possession.
At your request, the nature spirits of the air and wind spin themselves into an iridescent sash loosely draped around your shoulders that buoys you through the sky.
Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood.
Your construction integrates ropes, hooks, or other tools to help you move across steep surfaces.
The innate magic in your blood turns your signature crimson tresses into more than just a stylish coiffure.
You make a weapon unbearable to hold.
You coax nearby shadows into the shape of a simple weapon or a simple tool or item, using a tiny piece of your shadow to make it solid; in doing so, you lose 1 Hit Point.
You’ve established a stronger connection with your past selves and can play out the memories of your lifetimes in an instant, helping you draw on knowledge that lives deep within your mind.
You can tell when something's off.
You have an even stranger knack for knowing what other people are thinking.
Your people's ancient and storied rivalry with garudas led you to develop special techniques against flying foes.
You undulate your body in a series of sinuous serpentine motions as you swim, drastically improving the speed at which you move through the water.
You draw on your connection with the Shadow Plane to see through all but the deepest darkness.
As your ally moves past you, you match your movements to their rhythm, following them across the battlefield.
The magic of shaitans runs through your blood.
Using old magic, you slip off your tail like an item of clothing and walk on two feet, resembling a humanoid ancestry, usually human but possibly elf, half-elf, or something stranger.
Your ancestors hailed from the flying cities of the Shory, and a few simple tricks have come down through the ages to you.
You Step, then Hide or Sneak.
Your progenitors suffered greatly at the hands of a curse, a fate you willingly take upon yourself rather than let fall upon others.
You can beguile and bewitch with your song.
Your body becomes resistant, your hardened bones deflecting weapons and other forms of damage.
You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies.
Your shadow magic bleeds into the space around you.
You have some feature that allows you to quickly evade effects that restrain you.
You're used to fighting and hiding in a haze of smoke and flame.
Your snares are so befuddling that your victims rarely notice you slipping out of sight.
You have a fly Speed of 20 feet at all times.
Years toiling in soil have made you an expert digger.
If you rest outdoors for 10 minutes during the day, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level.
The warmth and light of the sun gives you life.
You bestow some of your own life energies to mend damage.
As a Speaker, you've forged a deep bond with powerful spirits who you can urge to rise up to defend you and your people.
You possess the head gem of a deceased ancestor or loved one, which has begun to resonate with your own.
You unleash a cloud of pollen or similar spores.
You are adept at working with your allies to surround an enemy.
Your intractable nature can help you shrug off even the most grievous injuries.
Calling upon your knowledge of stonework and inherent magic, you momentarily make a section of stone insubstantial, allowing you to pass through.
You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone.
Your eight legs serve you well when climbing walls and webs alike.
Your swim Speed increases to match your land Speed.
You're brave and stubborn and refuse to back down or bow to the wishes of another.
You achieve a breakthrough in your exploration of magic.
You expertly combine the motions of attacking and coating your weapon with venom.
You weep, and your tears become gleaming pearls as they fall to the ground, so beautiful others can't help but grab at them.
A thin shell of telekinetic energy pushes from your skin, widening your enemy's grasp enough for you to slip free.
Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain are off-guard to you.
Your Elemental Assault cycles through all four elements.
When your seedpods strike a felling blow, they burst into viciously thorny vines.
Your tongue can momentarily latch on as readily as your hands.
You're capable of growing as tall as a pine tree for a short time.
You've unleashed even more of your mind's limitless potential.
You've spent much of your life among the treetops and have become an expert at quickly and safely climbing them.
Your wings have grown more powerful, capable of keeping you aloft longer.
Your ability to imitate your progenitor is so strong, you can even convince yourself.
You gain the Prescient Consumable and Prescient Planner feats, except that you always withdraw the objects from your cheek pouches.
You resist death’s clutches with supernatural vigor, daring death to claim you while promising that any such attempt will surely fail.
You won't allow others to restrain you.
As you enter your yaoguai form, you draw upon your internal magic to assume an even greater form.
When you cast _humanoid form_ or _illusory disguise_ to alter your appearance, the spell's duration is 2 hours.
You know there's so much more to sensation than whips and chains—but whips and chains also have their place.
You move and attack with a swiftness that most can't follow.
Your tattoos are a work of eldritch genius, a masterpiece of art, magic, and skin.
Your connection to the First World has grown, and its vital energy flows into you rapidly.
You can perform the Scout exploration activity at the same time as the Avoid Notice exploration activity.
You glide through the water with graceful ease.
Water cradles your every step, allowing you to walk on its surface.
Through the careful cultivation of highly sensitive hairs, you've developed the ability to sense creatures without seeing them.
You make capering motions and silly sounds to captivate onlookers.
You weave your illusions with greater ability, allowing you to play tricks and slip through the night.
Your fan can stir up even more powerful winds.
You have a pair of draconic wings strong enough to batter your foes away and shove them away.
With a sharp flap of your wings, you stay light on your feet as you move.
Intense use and exercise have made your winglets more powerful.
You can strain to call forth feathered or cloudy wings from your back.
The primal magic in your soul offers the patient earth’s timeless counsel.
Through your spiritual power, you impede starvation and restore pantries.
You fought hundreds of foes in your various past lives.
You have replaced one of your forearms with one made of clay and infused with cursed arcane magic.
Choose a second kinetic element to add to the one you already have.
You make an even-larger batch of alchemical items each morning.
Heaving both yourself and your opponent into the air, you bring them crashing to the ground.
Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare.
The magic of your ancestry and bloodline are one and the same.
All your Strikes against a creature you have Marked for Death have the death trait, causing the mark to be instantly killed when reduced to 0 Hit Points.
By putting composition to paper, you can create a source of stirring words or song that others can read and understand.
You learn the secrets of armor runes by viewing them through gems and can alter them at your discretion.
You've slept many nights in your armor and gotten used to it.
You can cover for a secondary caster's error.
You can feel vibrations through the ground.
You control the size of your kinetic aura.
When submerged in water or another liquid, you form small fin-like arms along your body, granting you far greater maneuverability while swimming.
You can transform into a bat.
You have a magical affinity for bears and can speak to them through sounds and body language.
You've incorporated beast tech from Arcadia into your dynamo, adding in components from various terrifying creatures to enhance your prosthesis's capabilities.
You can communicate telepathically with your animal companions within 100 feet.
You are skilled at hiding from your foes and targets among the common populace.
You learn how to apply your extensive knowledge of certain creatures using the lore you know.
Now's your chance! You're a Firebrand, and the world must know it.
You ignite a pinch of black powder in a foe's face.
The bonds of the heart are stronger than any steel, more powerful than any magic.
Stride twice, making Strikes against up to four different creatures within reach at any point during your movement.
You reach ahead and make use of time that's yet to be.
You spin your buckler defensively toward every attack.
You've learned to reload your simple firearms with uncanny grace, the ammunition simply falling into place as though part of a well-practiced kata.
Your eidolon can burrow through loose dirt.
You call forth a ghostly manifestation of the worm spirit.
You target a specific area of your foe's anatomy to debilitating effect.
You alter your appearance to blend in to the wilderness.
Your Cascade Bearer training allows you to broaden the horizons of your halcyon spells further than most Magaambyans, weaving in spiritual magic.
Magical energy spills out to extend beyond the creature you struck.
The force of your deity’s castigation strengthens your body so you can strike down the enemy and its allies.
You've studied the many ways that ancient architects and spellcasters protected their possessions, such as by implementing deadly traps and curses, and learned some magic to counteract them.
Even when you don’t hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow.
The elemental matter in your blast keeps reconstituting itself to travel onward, no matter how many bodies it collides with.
You've learned to channel your curse through weapons you wield instead of solely through your flesh.
You practiced fan dance as a member of a large group, coordinating your moves together to create living art and heightening your sense of spatial awareness.
Your growing link to cloud dragons has granted you the ability to walk on clouds.
You slightly dislocate your joints to lash out with devious intent and the power to envenom your foe.
You open yourself to attacks so you can respond in turn.
You use your occult connection to your allies to take on the fear and confusion they feel.
You command the attention of all around you with style, ensuring their gaze falls only upon you until the end of your next turn.
Stories are an experience meant to be shared as a group.
You infuse a spell with the power of your faith, consecrating it.
You defy Tar-Baphon with every undead you destroy, using your victory to rally your allies.
You understand the need for law enforcement doctrine to adapt to the ever-changing innovations in technology and arcana.
With a mighty shout, you can stir an ally to attack.
You can dash your foe to the ground with a single blow.
You can knock aside ranged attacks.
You make quick use of an opening from your daring stunts.
When you use Shield Block, you can create a flash of brilliant, multicolored light in a 15-foot cone.
You perform a bewildering show of prowess, such as by whirling and flashing a weapon, that unnerves foes.
Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot.
You're always ready to take a quick shot to deflect a weapon or distract a foe enough to render them off target.
If your skill check to challenge a foe is a success, the target of your challenge takes a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls (or –2 if you critically succeed) until the end of your next turn.
Keep opponents from flanking when you Feint them.
To keep the peace, you disrupt those who seek to break it.
When you compound panache with even more derring-do, it somehow tends to work out.
You can protect yourself more effectively, at the expense of your shield.
Nothing can keep you from your enemy.
You take advantage of teleportation to better hide your position.
You transform into a primal reflection of your animal shape.
After your initial attack redirects your foe’s defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp.
The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you’re prepared to foil enemies’ actions.
Your body falls unconscious and your spirit projects out of it.
Your enemies think they can concentrate on something else while you're nearby? Oh, you'll give them a distraction, all right!
You’re practiced in using your fans to spin with dizzying speed.
For each temporary oil or potion you brew during your daily preparations, you brew two copies of it.
You draw out the bestial magic energy within your bonded beast gun to fortify yourself, purge ongoing harm, and bolster your life force with a sheath of swirling life essence.
You pull strength from the surrounding terrain.
You Stride into a willing ally's space, at which point both of your appearances shift into a shared third appearance, usually one that looks like a mix of the two of you.
You attack as you weave your way around the battlefield.
Using your free hand as pivot and balance, you both attack and defend with your weapon.
You know there are places in the world that are just wrong— places where the birds don't sing and where you always feel like you're being watched.
Pathfinders are often asked to study the intricacies of ancient history under less than ideal conditions, and you've trained your brain to make the most of your limited time.
You know how to apply debilitations that are particularly troublesome for spellcasters.
You integrate your talent for magic into your use of reloading weapons.
You electrify your armor to punish foes who dare to attack you.
You understand the fundamental elements of nature such that you can imbue them into your body and manifest as a living embodiment of those elements.
You open your kinetic gate, but rather than activating your kinetic aura, you instead become overwhelmed with transformative elemental energy.
Your mercy grants clarity to those around you just when they need it most.
You use Emerald Bough techniques to create a small extradimensional space called a hideaway that lasts as long as you are conscious.
Even when bloodshed is inevitable, you would rather see your foes surrender.
Your heart soars, increasing your power for a moment.
You can tell when diplomacy has failed and a meeting is close to unraveling or falling to blows.
Your conviction redirects the undead’s attack through your armor and then harmlessly away.
You fuse two spells together, combining their energy types.
Some of your wrappings come loose to ensnare a creature you recently damaged.
You can transform your inner power into a type of energy to empower your ki abilities.
You intentionally set off the trap, but you take special precautions to protect yourself and your allies from the trap’s effects.
Your prayers encompass your companions, granting you the ability to share Pharasma's blessings.
You can throw bombs at just the right trajectory to create especially large and powerful explosions.
You learn more powerful spells to enchant and deceive.
Your studies of the stars have taught you about the mysteries of the cosmos.
You partially fade from reality.
Like the fastest of predatory birds, you soar toward your prey at great speeds.
Fear makes your foes weak and more vulnerable to your attacks.
You learn the fortifying brew ritual, but you instead prepare dishes for a lavish meal that have the same effect as the drinks from the normal version of the ritual.
You spring on an unsuspecting opponent, tearing at them with your teeth.
Sinking your claws in, you propel yourself at shocking speed.
You hurl foes away with a shake of your head.
You've taught your companions to charge directly at an enemy.
Your tongue has mutated into a lashing weapon reminiscent of Kabriri's bone-laden flail.
You make a fearsome show of your authority.
You throw a weapon to distract your opponent as you close the gap to begin your assault.
You’re trained in snapping and fluttering your fans to draw the eyes of observers around you.
Experience or focused study have granted you mastery of a number of topics.
You rush forward.
During your daily preparations, you can magically fuse your arcane bonded weapon and a magical staff together into one item, with the staff making up the haft of the weapon.
By rooting yourself in place, you are able to focus your body's natural healing to work faster.
You can channel your mask’s power to pierce through lies and see the truth in any situation.

Your armor has a retractable spike-covered shell reminiscent of Hwanggot’s heavily armored geobukseon, or “turtle ships.” The shell unfolds across your body, giving you a +4 circumstance bonus to AC and resistance 2 to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of your next turn.
Deviating from the orthodox path, you tread an inauspicious descent littered with flowers of death; this heretical choice will, in time, earn you the enmity and fear of more traditional cultivators.
You can create bigger snares for quick deployment, making it more likely for a creature to walk into your snares.
In pleasing the cravings of a mighty dragon, they have deigned to impart some of their magical essence into your body.
Even if vitrumancy is a mystery to you, your blood and flesh know the secrets of the art of arcane glass.
You have developed a capacity to store more flesh within your gaunt body to leave yourself satiated longer.
Flames and explosions sear the air in a riot of color and devastation that rivals that wrought by even the wildest goblin party.
Your ability to sense undead has improved.
Your fury carries your weapon through multiple foes.
Your power undergoes yet another awakening.
You uncover the greater secrets of your bloodline.
Your undead secrets grow stronger still.
You have learned enhanced techniques and alchemical secrets that allow you to expand the range of effects you can impose with your bombs.
You've continued to expand your compendium of tools to compile knowledge.
You broaden the scope of your magical understanding, allowing you to find the right path, detect hidden objects, and conceal those objects from unscrupulous rivals.
You gain more powerful spell runes.
Your experience fighting against and alongside fey creatures is nearly unrivaled.
You enhance your spell with elemental wood, causing your magic to expand and grow beyond its original limitations.
Your knowledge of halcyon magic increases.
You fortify your skin with minerals drawn from earth and stone.
Your attack prevents a foe from pursuing your allies.
You can take advantage of shapechanging magic to close wounds and patch injuries.
You don't just tinker with your own innovation, you fiddle with your allies' weapons as well (for their benefit, of course).
The restorative power of your healing invigorates the recipient.
You know how to turn any weapon into a bone-crushing implement of skeletal destruction.
You raise your arms to the sky and pray fervently, surrounding yourself in a beacon of holy light.
The Salt Breakers learned to use whatever they could during the Vidric Revolution, and they quickly mastered the art of making a rope into a useful tool in combat.
You erect an imaginary barrier others believe to be real.
Learning from nature's predators has taught you how to keep your prey close.

Somehow your stray bullet causes an unintended reaction that creates a problem for your enemy: perhaps a ricochet knocks your foe's weapon away or they stumble over stray debris in an attempt to dodge your bullets.
You bring discipline to your mind and magic, ensuring that you don't under-perform.
Under your care, your mount has realized its innate potential.
You slam into the ground, shattering it around you.
Undead creatures find it all but impossible to resist your commands.
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.
A knight is nothing without their armor, and you know how to keep yours ready.
You know your spell will be needed not now but in a few moments, so you cast your magic into the future.
Your spirit guide exhales its sweet-smelling breath on you, granting you the strength to push through your pain.
After your attempt to influence someone goes poorly, you add another bit of information or ask a pointed question, possibly salvaging your previous attempt.
The weight of your swing drives your enemy back.
You focus your strength into a blow powerful enough to push an enemy away from you.
Your knowledge of abstruse topics is unparalleled.
Use your shield to protect your allies.
You move forward, creating an opening for others to follow.
You rail against the sin of sloth, turning a foe’s laziness against it.
You compel a creature to act toward its own ends rather than consider others.
Aha! You lock on to your enemy's weak point to assist your construct companion in destroying it.
Your spell unwinds the structure of your staff to make it exceptionally long, or even separate it into shards held together by magical power.
When an obstacle bars your path, you pull a trick from your sleeve to overcome it.
Your patron grants you even greater secrets.
You've become comfortable in using weapons that you might not have picked up before training with the Swords.
You have a nearly encyclopedic knowledge of all creatures of the world.
You've mastered the art of deceiving others about your area of study.
Scaring off multiple people at once is your specialty.
You mix a special additive into your elixir that calms the drinker’s body and mind.
Your eidolon rends its foes.
A trail of energy flows from your target back to you.
You strategically craft your debilitations to lessen or negate an enemy’s tactical advantages.
Thanks to the incredible connection you have forged with your armor, you can use it to shrug off an extensive array of dangers.
You reflect the spell back against its caster.
The Mockingbird is a master at running into foes and coming away with their weapons.
You gain the Flurry of Blows action.
You’re cunning enough to find an opening in an opponent’s attack.
You learn the ode to ouroboros composition spell (page 371), which enables you to temporarily spare your allies from death.
You're constantly studying small aspects of everyone's movements, even if you don't have a stratagem in place ahead of time.
You trample foes as you charge past.
With a complex gesture, you call upon the primal power of your spell to overcome enemies’ resistances.
Filtering your form through the substance of an object, you can pass through walls, doors, and more.
You slowly move across the battlefield with dangerous grace.
Your mastery of primal magic has given you access to the greatest secrets of warden magic.
You blast a bullet through one foe and into another.
You shoot clear through an intervening creature to hit your prey.

You gain an appropriate ki spell for your School of Perfection: _unblinking flame aura_ for Unblinking Flame, _unbreaking wave vapor_ for Unbreaking Waves, _unfolding wind buffet_ for Unfolding Wind, or _untwisting iron roots_ for Untwisting Iron.
Either by witnessing or surviving the petrifying stare of a medusa or similar creature, you have learned to petrify those you lock eyes with.
You're possessed with an incredibly vivacious spark that separates you not only from ordinary gun users and gunslingers, but even from other phenoms.
You can take the shape of a plant creature.
By concentrating your poisons’ toxic components, you make them harder for victims to resist.
After extensive practice with the Swords, you're comfortable enough with your shield to move at a normal pace with it raised.
You've mastered the reloading techniques and methods usually practiced by only the most dedicated firearm professionals.
You mix flecks of precious materials you've gathered on your journeys into your custom bullets to bring out those properties in your temporary ammunition.
You attack with great precision.
Your flexibility with stances lets you sacrifice their benefits to better protect yourself.
Your companion can let out a howl laced with your primal magic.
Your verdant weapon can cut through the resistances of magical creatures.
By expelling flames from your feet or levitating through electrical repulsion, you propel yourself through the air.
The power of your bond can protect you and your eidolon from harm.
For you, fighting is as much about style as skill.
Your eidolon has an attack that pushes away enemies.
You’ve replaced your heart with one made of animated quicksilver and living adamantine.
If your next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
Your blessed armament radiates power, further enhancing your chosen weapon.
You surround yourself in a mantle of Rain-Scribe magic and Stride twice; difficult terrain does not reduce your Speed, even if the difficult terrain has been manipulated by magic.
You tap into an arcane trick to recover your ability to meld spells and attacks.
You're so charming and distracting that when pressed, you can cast a simple enchantment in time to foil an attacker.
You hurl your melee weapon at an opponent, then fire a bullet into the weapon's hilt, making it deal additional damage and bounce back to your grasp.
You recover the energy of a recently disrupted spell, allowing you to cast it again as long as you do so immediately before the energy dissipates.
You flap your wings to blow arrows off course.
Seeing your ally's attack about to go astray, you fire your weapon to right its course.
You can riposte almost without a thought.
The first time each round that you Cycle Elemental Stance, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level that last until the start of your next turn.
Striking out against your enemies draws praise and protection from your deity.
You are familiar with the fittings and cogwheels of your snares and can repurpose parts from prepared quick-deploy snares to assemble a new creation on the fly.
Your healing energies create an aura of protection that defends your allies against more than just blades and arrows.
You strike your enemy in the head with such force that its ears ring.
Your spell disorients your targets with a metallic clangor.
In your hands, any vehicle is a weapon.
You enhance your spell with elemental earth, causing chunks of stone to litter the ground.
You enhance your spell with elemental earth, causing chunks of stone to litter the ground.
Your flesh takes on the hardness of stone.
You roll a handful of bones to learn (or perhaps influence) the future course of events.
Ropes are your tool of choice, and you deploy them in versatile ways.
Your skin develops a malleable, rubbery quality.
You focus your mind on thoughtforms of fundamental magical forces, shaping them into a property rune that you mentally etch onto your mind weapon.
Your companion weaves in and out of combat, swiftly attacking before getting to a better position.
Make a check to reduce a critical hit against you to a normal hit.
Seeing an enemy's attack, you quickly consult multiple scraps of lore in your mind, synthesizing them into the perfect plan.
You leap from the shadows to strike at your foes.
During your daily preparations, you can create two temporary scrolls containing arcane spells from your spellbook.
Your familiar coils around you, protecting you with its magical resistance.
You gain the ability to fuse and play with shadows by using focus spells specific to shadowdancers.
Your own shadow speaks to you, providing knowledge of spells and a reservoir of magical power.
You gain the sneak attack class feature, except you deal 1d6 precision damage regardless of your level.

column1: Shall Not Falter, Shall Not Rout
column2: You gain the _shall not falter, shall not rout_ focus spell.

You select an object from your esoterica that has great personal value to you, such as a locket or treasured ring, and you grant it to an ally, establishing a personal link that allows your ally to affect an enemy as if they were you.
You can project your premonitions of danger to your allies.

You can grant the benefit from Dualistic Synergy to an ally within 30 feet instead of yourself, either allowing that ally to Recall Knowledge, granting that ally temporary Hit Points, or both, depending on the spell’s tradition.
The improvised weapon shatters, destroying it completely but dealing an additional 3d6 piercing damage to the creature you hit with the Improvised Pummel.
Residual energy from your domain spells bolsters your defenses.
When you shield your ally against an attack, you call upon your power to protect your ally further.
You and your animal companion fight in tandem, distracting your foes and keeping them off balance.
Your innate connection to magic lets you cast more spells with greater freedom.
The magic flowing through your signifer’s mask allows you to see in the dark, and the mask dampens the distraction caused by sudden flashes of bright light.
A quick strike to the face or mouth silences your opponent.
You quickly hide your weapon to make it difficult to pin the attack on you.
Like how a constrictor wraps itself around its next meal, your companion tightens its teeth around its constrained prey to squeeze the life out of it.

Experiences with necromantic energy have left a permanent mark on you, casting you in a deathlike pallor, chilling your body temperature to be ice-cold, turning your very blood black, and giving you the power to rip out an enemy's life force.
You use your physical discipline to channel your magic.
Your very presence strikes fear into the undead.
You pinch crucial points of your target's nervous system, impeding its ability to function.
You spin your lash out for your ally to grab on to, giving them a boost to their movement.
It’s almost impossible to spot you.
You can mix ingredients with a powerful sour smell into an alchemical bomb to make its explosion an overpowering stench.
You gain the  <%SPELLS%2052%%> _spectral advance_ devotion spell

Your ostilli has grown strong enough to completely consume a spell cast at you, granting you the Devour Ambient Magic action.

 **Devour Ambient Magic** <actions string="Reaction" /> (concentrate) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** A creature Casts a Spell with you as the only target; **Effect** Your ostilli radiates cyan light as its tentacle-like filters attempt to consume the magical effect.
You can create a number of powerful shielding runes that bolster your defenses against damaging spells by absorbing the worst of the energy to keep you safe.
You squeeze your opponent in a vicious bear hug, putting intense pressure on their nerves, joints, or other pain points.
When you use Spiritual Strike, hit targets become flat-footed until the end of your current turn.
Your ostilli can launch a multitude of darts at once over a short distance.
You use the power of your leg lashing out to spring off your foe and leap toward another, your talon descending in a crescent.
You’ve learned how to analyze and fake your responses to the most common magic used against spies.
You've trained your megafauna companion to stagger its enemies, impeding their ability to fight back.
Your banner makes it harder for your foes to push your allies around and encourages your allies to protect the innocent.
The stars reveal and punish your enemies.
You can take away the air that keeps a flying foe aloft.
You reach into another creature's timeline and attempt to alter their flow of time.
Your stonestrike attacks deal 1d6 additional damage against constructs, creatures with the earth trait, and earthen objects, such as a stone door.
The common folk heed your demands, and though your true foes rarely bend to your commands, when they do the hesitation can cost them the battle.
Your excellent display of fighting prowess leaves your opponent stumbling back.
When you cast _wall of fire_, you can modify it to create a 10-foot-radius hemisphere of fire.
Sometimes something intrudes upon your case unexpectedly, such as an ambush sent to bring your investigation to a close.
You pull magic into your weapon, using its substance to transform the magic into restorative energy.
You can redirect ammunition back at the creature that fired it with sweeping gusts of wind.
Your companion swings its tail powerfully.
You attempt to deftly swap places with an adjacent enemy to avoid the attack.
You learn the symphony of the unfettered heart composition spell (page 371), which enables you to protect an ally against incapacitating conditions.
You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes.
You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings.
Your skilled teamwork with your spotter enables you both to assist one another when you falter, using either other's failures as opportunities to strike.
Your vicious strike pulls your foe closer, giving you the opportunity to grab them.
Your attack harms and hinders your foe.
You cause minor tremors that topple your enemies.
You transform unrealized spell energy into a protective shield.
During your daily preparations, you can create a batch of two temporary oils or potions using a formula you know.
You crumble to pieces, becoming composed of the very terrain to which you're bound, with the effects of the _gaseous form_ spell, or you reconstitute into your normal form.
You unleash a terrifying howl.
Magical equipment and gear are the tools of your trade, and you know you need as many as possible to help you against the supernatural.
You beseech warrior spirits to come forth and aid you.
At this stage of cultivation, your body is as much spirit as flesh.
Spells you cast can transform briefly into vital essence, traveling harmlessly through living and undead creatures between you and your target, blocked only by solid objects.
Your lightning splits the air, generating a booming shock wave.
You can quickly Aid your crop.
Increase your Speed and that of your crop.
You take advantage of the opening created by your ally to tip your foe off their feet.
When you cast _black tentacles_, you can modify it to trip the targets.
Calling upon forbidden practices, you release the curse from within yourself, allowing it free rein to destroy everything around you.
In moments of viciousness, your curse can partially infect your prey.
You Stride up to double your speed and can move through the spaces of creatures at least one size smaller, trampling each creature whose space you enter.
You urge your mount to charge into the fray, trampling all enemies who stand in your path.
You charge your weapon with spiritual energy and intercept the attack.
You switch places with your eidolon.
Your lips murmur as you portend a great disaster, one you hope you survive.
You shoot not at your foe but at an object nearby.
You use a burst of stamina to perform a breathtaking feat of Acrobatics as you speed through a foe's space, leaving your foe lying flat on their back.
You gain a burrow speed of 10 feet.
You turn into vapor, gaining the effects of _gaseous form_.
A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon.
You fire at an enemy while targeting a part of its anatomy that will disrupt its balance.
As you make an attack augmented by your esoterica, you also press your implement against the creature, applying its weakness as your implement's energies sear the creature's flesh.
Your ability to narrowly evade danger defies all logic.
You and your megafauna companion are bound together; as long as you live, it's much harder for your companion to die.
You gain the deny advantage class feature.
With a quick use of brute force, you remove an obstacle and take a calculated shot as part of the same motion.
With a mighty blow from atop your companion, you attempt to knock an opponent off their mount.
Honed through 10,000 battles, your sword’s mere light can shatter ambitions and break armies.
You can mix a wondrous yet volatile liquid into an alchemical consumable if it has an initial effect that uses dice.
You can translate the emotion and power of a composition to other mediums.
You tell a story spontaneously from nearly forgotten facts, delving into your memory and entertaining your audience in the process.
Your swarm is dense, blotting out vision.
Your Arcane Cascade sends threads to the four directions, creating a web of strings dyed by your skill and your enemies’ blood.
The debilitations you dish out seriously impair your foes.
Your companion sinks its claws and rips.
You can train your allies to Raise a Shield on your order
You carefully ward your spell by drawing from a mantle of magical energy you prepared to protect your casting, increasing your chance of retaining the spell.
You can guide your allies to move quietly through the wilderness.
Water is the source of life, and you draw upon this primordial force to heal your allies' wounds.
You learn how to alter the magic of weapon runes by using a crystal as a focusing component.
Your eidolon knocks enemies down.
You use your staff as a defensive implement as well as an offensive one.
Through a variety of perceptive techniques, careful routines, and upgrades to your enhanced visual gear, you have become able to observe and maintain your overwatch at a much greater distance.
Once you have penetrated a foe’s defenses, you can home in on the same spot to exploit your opponent’s wound and deal some serious damage.
You gather the wind beneath you, allowing you to soar as you jump.
Any journey consists of more than simply reaching your destination.
Your eyes are accustomed to the harsh glare of the sun on snow and ice.
You can keep watch over multiple charges.
You gain the wronged monk's wrath ki spell.
You have a reputation in towns and villages you've visited, and residents are always willing to open their doors to you.
Exposure of the well of Axuma has given you some arcane magic.
Your vigor makes it easier for others to heal you.
You know how to get the most effort out of your allies on the road.

When you scout, you are particularly alert for danger, granting your allies precious moments to prepare to fight.
Your reputation as a Firebrand precedes you, and you need only make a simple gesture or give a look of recognition to amaze those around you.
Choose an additional shadowdancer focus spell you haven't already selected from Shadow Magic.

You have unlocked deeper secrets to uncovering and hoarding lore.

You strike with one swift movement, trying to instantly slay your mark.

You quickly call in a primal projection of a non-active companion to provide the companion’s support benefit.
You've trained your winged companions to gather air in their wings, whipping up a concentrated gust of wind at opponents, potentially staggering them.
You call upon divine power and make a weapon or unarmed Strike against a foe you have witnessed harming an ally or innocent.
You call upon the power of law and make a weapon or unarmed Strike against a foe you have witnessed breaking or disrespecting the law or otherwise acting disorderly.

You call upon divine power and make a weapon or unarmed Strike against the enemy who triggered your champion's reaction.
You exude peace and protection, lessening a harmful condition as it falls upon an ally.

You wield blood magic masterfully.
By listening to the beating of your heart, your focus recovers faster.
Your attacks slice arteries and veins.
You aren't satisfied with keeping to just one kind of boost from your constant tinkering, so you've learned to modulate between several possibilities at once.
Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe’s defenses.

You can dodge away from damaging effects.

Your weapon contains a detonation chamber that launches fireworks, sparklers, and black powder pellets that sizzle, twist, and scatter on the ground in a cacophonous manner liable to annoy the entire Celestial Court.
Your ostilli takes control of your nervous system and kicks your cellular functions into overdrive when you're about to die.

You fire your gun once, creating a devastating and unpredictable chain of events; perhaps your bullet strikes exactly the right spot on a water tower, causing it to flood and incite a stampede of horses which knock over a lantern that sets a city on fire.
You can suffer so that others might live.
Your magic is drawn to your persistent creations.
Somehow you always escape the reaper by a hair's breadth.
When you cast _fireball_, you can modify it to create a cloud of smoking smoke.
Animals can be musical partners as much as the subjects or audience.
You fluidly shift between your two stances.
You creatively apply your prepared spells to Counterspell a much wider variety of your opponents’ magic.
You bind your spirit to a coffin filled with soil of your homeland, making it a place of recovery.
You detonate the required bombs in order to bring a wall down on a creature.
By narrowing your sense of the future, you can improve that of your allies.
Choose one spell with a sustained duration that one of your allies has in effect.
Gorging on flesh after your stomach is full fortifies you, making you hardy enough to withstand more punishment.
You imagine how you'll weave magic and combat into future battles, improving your focus.
You are too brilliant to be caught off guard, and you always have just the right gadget for the situation.
You heroically dash into the fray, inspiring your allies to follow.

You rhyme with your ally’s incantations or echo their movements, linking your magic to empower their spell in one of two ways.

Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks.
You can counteract a magical effect that impedes movement.

Springing away from one foe, you Strike at another.
You relax your eyes, taking in the presence of hidden things, granting you the ability to locate invisible creatures.

You change your form as a means of evading a potentially fatal blow.

You draw in the moisture from nearby creatures, draining them dry to heal your wounds.
You call out a desperate wish to the stars to save a friend.

Your devotion is strong enough to increase your focus to incredible heights.

Rumors suggest this technique was pioneered by knights who undertook missions for Clarethe Iomedar at the half-moon, but many Crimson Reclaimers have since mastered it.
You perform complex manipulations to make the energy from your spells so powerful that your enemies remain vulnerable to it afterward.

You are, by nature, a thing of gloomy woods and barren wilds, and when you choose show yourself, a bit of this gloom clings to you, obscuring your form with strange distortions or mist.

Your mount becomes a grotesque creature of foreboding when you ride it.
Once you’ve had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought.

It might have been a medusa, dracolisk, or even a fossil golem; regardless of the source, you were the target of some petrifying effect, and an element of that stony gaze has remained with you, both protecting and slowly consuming you.
You can prepare incredible numbers of snares each day out of simple ingredients.
By transforming as you move, you attack from odd angles.

You command the room, firing a gun into the air and ordering everyone to surrender and put their hands in the air.
Grabbing a sleeve, swiping with your weapon, or creating another obstruction, you reflexively foil an enemy’s response.

You hiss a spiteful curse.

Whenever an enemy starts its turn adjacent to you, it must attempt a Will saving throw against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is highest.

You can call forth nearby nature spirits to augment your body.

You physically help an ally remain standing and encourage them to push through their pain against dire odds.

You give a daring yowl, calling your companion back from the brink of unconsciousness.
You excel at going unnoticed, especially among a crowd.
Your celestial powers allow you to remove lesser afflictions with ease.
Your connection to good arms all your attacks against forces of evil.
You can alter your exoskeleton's size.
This life still holds much for you, and you aren’t ready to fall back into the River of Souls just yet.
You secrete a cloak of concentrated poison that harms any who dare attack you.

You move your shadow as a master puppeteer, allowing it to dance around your enemies and serve you in combat.
Through your incredible dance skill, you can embody the character of the Jester, able to take control of the shadows of other players on stage (much to your amusement).
Whether through painstaking exposure, devoted prayer, or simple luck, you've found a greater affinity for life through the sun's light.
Subterranean life taught you to swim through the ground like water.

Your hybrid shape is a hulking beast.
Your frigid gaze can turn a foe's blood to ice.

Your fey heritage has altered your mindset to more resemble the uncanny perspective of the fey.
You can cut through illusions with such precision that all those around you find their senses sharpened as well.
You never fail to strike down the ever-expanding reaches of chaos.
You've empowered your core to support a larger body, granting you size and additional reach.
With a combination of your poison glands and herbal concoctions, you can consistently deliver venomous attacks when you hit an enemy's weak points.
You have lived longer than most realize, and due to your many lifetimes of practice you remember almost everything from your previous incarnations now.
You have continued training in volatile weapons and gained a deeper understanding.
Since ancient times, the mightiest orc beast tamers would draw out the true fighting spirit of their companion beasts by feeding the creatures a draft incorporating the orc’s own blood.
The waters around you permit you passage, a privilege you can share with a willing ally.
While you are more susceptible to cold iron than most of the Wingless, you also have an incredible resilience and a deeper connection to the healing energies of the First World.
Your festering connection to the forces of evil infuses your weapons with debilitating malevolence, tearing down creatures of good with every attack.
Many fiends—rakshasa rajas and demonic succubi most famously—can take on the forms of others.
Your peri lineage has opened your mind to fire's raw, purging essence.
Dokkaebi were among the first goblins to pioneer gazing through flames, spectral or physical, to cast their senses far and wide.
You call on a guardian of the wild to burst forth from the land to aid you.
You can transform into a harmless bat.
You can assemble a formation even with members of ancestries that lack the hobgoblins’ military discipline, and you can extend these benefits to your hobgoblin allies.
You're so adept at burrowing through the earth that you don't even need tools; in fact, you just might be trusted to lead the latest generation dig.

Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency in falchions, ranseurs, scimitars, tridents, and all geniekin weapons in which you are trained.
Vitality floods your trammeled soul, offering you rejuvenation, if not quite rest.
It's as if you've been training for a thousand years.
You can share your power with others, but they can't escape the werecreature's curse as easily as you can.
You unlock a new level of fey power and can manipulate the perceptions of others using a font of First World magic.
Through your heritage, you can replicate a hag’s magic.
You caw ominously, cursing the creature with misfortune.
Your frog-like agility awakens as soon as you do.
You batter your foes with a torrent of water siphoned from your surroundings.
Your time in the River of Souls has given you deep insight into the machinations of those who refuse to move on.
You brandish the precious object you're holding menacingly, at once mocking it and threatening its safety.

You shift the underlying fabric of reality to impose a baseline of order.
You can speak to inanimate objects, finding a magical spark within them similar to the one that animated you.
You gain resistance 10 from Elemental Bulwark instead of 5.

Given time to collect yourself after a near-death scrape, you can rebuild your ferocity and withstand additional finishing blows.

You push yourself, unleashing a burst of sudden speed.

The magic within you manifests as a natural reaction to threats.

You channel the might and mass of a kaiju.

Your connection to nature—and trees, in particular—has become so strong that you can summon the plants you befriended in the forests of your youth.

Your tails show your magical mastery.

The impulse to survive and continue fighting resonates deep within you.

You achieved fluency in different languages with each reincarnation.
Many flowers are beautiful to look upon but deadly to touch—and you're one of them.
You move reflexively toward the source of magic you most consumed as a larva.

Your ability to heal others is miraculous enough to bring people back from near-death.
Your tail can bedevil your foes.
You condense the moisture in the air, solidifying it so it can hold your weight.

Your magical skill rivals that of accomplished naga spellcasters.

You've learned to harness your connection to the earth to travel through it.

he experience of coming back after death has granted you a strong sense of resolve.

Using the momentum of your prior attack, you lash out with both your weapons in a sudden frenzy.
You attack with both your weapons in a furious barrage.
You pool the power of shadow within your eyes, gaining the ability to gather darkness into a turbulent orb of crushing emptiness within your line of sight.
You put your connection to the material world farther behind you.
You've built triple redundancies into your innovation and added all sorts of buffers to protect it from the harm of your unstable experiments.
When struck by an enemy, you respond in turn.
You have turned into a plant version of yourself, gaining the plant trait and losing traits inappropriate for your new form (typically humanoid).
You instill magical vigor in your allies when you inspire them to attack.
You fall through your own kinetic gate, leaving behind an effigy of flame and reappearing majestically near another fire.
You convey your prey’s location to your allies with a series of careful words or gestures.
You enter a mindful stance that creates a deep connection between you and your monk weapons, allowing you to manipulate them with your qi, even at a distance.
You fire your gun while throwing off a target's balance with your melee weapon.
You lash out in a blur of motion, attacking all nearby adversaries.
You build air pressure with repeated motions, before releasing an enormous crescent of rushing wind strikes.
You enhance your spell with elemental air, using the wind to find your target and carry your magic around cover.
You enhance your spell with elemental air, using the wind to find your target and carry your magic around cover.
Whether in the heart of a volcanic passageway or the glacial tundras of the Crown of the World, the only temperature you ever personally experience is an oddly comfortable chill.
You slam the ground and unleash a fearsome roar, sending broken shards of earth flying in all directions.
You take on the form of a purple worm or transform into a humanoid-worm hybrid, retaining your own head but with a worm's body, transforming into a Huge battle form.
Your aura protects against destructive energies and dragons’ breath.
Jump impossible distances
Ignore most requirements for crafting items
Find guidance in the writings of your faith
Quickly Decipher Writing using Society
You know the wilderness so well that you can help your party travel through it with ease.
Create pidgin languages to communicate with anyone
Remove disease, blinded, deafened, doomed, or drained
Quickly parley with foes
Gain renown for your Performance
Gain renown for your Lore
Hide and Sneak without cover or being concealed
Survive extreme conditions
Your craftsmanship at decorating flesh is unparalleled.
Steal what would normally be impossible to steal
You convince a creature that you played a minor but recurring role in its life.
Scare a target so much, they might die
Use Arcana for checks for all magical traditions
You imbue your unarmed strikes with one of the strongest metals.
Your mind can hold onto more complicated patterns than ever before.
Guided by your ongoing care, your steed has developed incredible intelligence and skill.
You attack all nearby adversaries.
Your deceptions confound even the most powerful magic that could spy on you.
Your constant efforts to augment and perfect your _soul cage_ have bolstered its efficiency.
You become a hybrid of your ancestry and a saumen kar.

You have uncovered occult mysteries that allow you to unleash the devastating hunger of Kabriri upon your foes with a single exhalation, releasing a massive cloud of flesh-eating gas that glows with a sickly green light.
Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces.
You can find a loophole in a mental effect to temporarily overcome it.
You smack the foe you're thrashing into someone else.
You use the unstable energy of your curse to manipulate the most basic of divine magic.
Your power has unbound you from the earth below.
You create a direct magical connection with your beast gun, allowing you to guide the beast gun's next shot by taking control of the projectile directly.
Informing your ally of an opening created by your shot, you coordinate to set them up to hit the target at the same time.
You use your performance to orchestrate an onslaught against your enemies.
You follow up your enemy's fall, driving you both to the earth in a meteoric descent.
You can cast ethereal jaunt as an occult innate spell once per day.
Your graceful attacks are especially powerful.
You've mastered a defensive technique unique to the ancient dragons of Bloodsalt: beating your wings to create a billowing cloud of mist.
Your blood boils when you take a beating, and you throw caution to the wind to finish the fight.
When you find a glaring weakness, you can set your allies up to annihilate your foe.
You unleash your breath weapon without spending focus.
Your sneak attack slices through the threads binding magic to a target.
The spell you deliver tries to force out magic affecting your enemy.
You have broadened your understanding of the divine and can tap into the wonders of a different mystery.
You stare into your target's eyes and enthrall them, shattering their free will.

You transform into a ferocious Large dragon, gaining the effects of 6th-rank _dragon form_ except that you use your own AC and attack modifier, you apply your extra damage from Rage, and the Dragon Breath action uses your class DC.
You can maintain a spell with hardly a thought.
You can charge yourself with lighting, gain resistance to electricity or shocking an attacker.
You have battled against foes whose bodies naturally regenerate, and while yours doesn't do so all the time, it can happen in a pinch.
You exude an aura of resolve.
Your life has made you a nexus for your deity’s vile power.
Your deeds have brought your deity’s grace to you for all of eternity.
Your body readily accepts and retains minor changes.
Your eidolon has enhanced senses.
You can mix a refractile substance into an alchemical bomb to foil resistances.
You're especially talented at striking your enemies in their most vulnerable areas.
Your claws and jaws are brutally powerful and efficient, even by ursine standards.
You take advantage of your foe's openings with uncanny odds.
There are some fates worse than death–and you worked to save a fey from one such fate.
You take a moment to center yourself, then unleash a powerful blow that sends your target tumbling away.
You're so focused on your allies that you can help them to recenter when something would take them out of the fight.
You're a nigh-unstoppable killing machine, with only silver able to quell your rampage.
When you draw upon your spells’ synergy, you create a physical manifestation of their magical resonance and invoke it to harm a foe.
Your enemy's blow fuels your rage and provokes your immediate retaliation.
You have combined two stances into a single stance all your own.
Your well-placed blows can fell mighty giants.
With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion’s stinger.
Even a single missile can throw off your enemy’s balance, and more powerful attacks leave it flustered for longer.
Your bloodline's deep connection to mental essence greatly enhances your spell repertoire.
You can't be impeded by environmental effects that rely on cold or its byproducts.
Vital power surges through you like a font of energy.
No one can react faster than you can pull your trigger.
You can fill an area with devastating briars.
Your glowing and majestic kinetic aura marks you as a true child of the elements.
It seems impossible, but you've analyzed every angle and are able to just keep pulling out exactly the item you need, even in far-flung locations.
By weakening your relation to the ground and strengthening your relation to the sky, you've learned to soar through the air, your implement carrying you as surely as any broomstick or pestle.
Your shield can help save nearby allies.
At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte.
You can concentrate an immense amount of magic to create a piece of ammunition that phases through everything but your target.
With a single fluid gesture, you catch a projectile out of the air, load it in your weapon, and shoot it back at the attacker.
Your blessed armament thirsts for the blood of your foes.
Divine energy fills your weapon.
Need to balance on a razor's edge, force open an iron door, or persuade a dragon to negotiate? Never fear! No matter the situation, you always have just the thing.
You can have up to two animal companions active at once.
Your knowledge of monsters is so incredible that it reveals glaring flaws in your prey.
You master the most powerful spells that enchant and deceive.
You move fluidly between stances, using your mastery of combat to always adopt the best tactics.
You have achieved near-total mastery of your qi.
What you don't know about artillery isn't worth knowing and your mastery allows you to perform an impossible number of actions as part of a siege weapon's crew.
You unlock the most powerful secrets hidden in the stars above.
When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your magic to disrupt it.
You dart around the battlefield, casting spells while you carefully make melee attacks with your weapon.
You can transform into a powerful magical creature.
You lock yourself in a stable position so you can fire swiftly and accurately.
Your punches have incredible force and control.
Make a ranged attack with a Juggled item against a vulnerable creature.
You throw your weight into a powerful attack that leaves you vulnerable.
Your projectiles are unhindered by flesh and bone.
You use clever tactics to mislead your foes as you sneak away.
Your experience has made you better with a wide variety of weapons.
Your innovation sets foes on fire, covers them in acid, leaves barbed thorns behind, or otherwise deals persistent damage to your foes that sticks around long after you deliver your boosted attack.
You've trained your physical form to remain stable.
You and your familiar learn the secrets of elemental fire, allowing you to merge together to become a legendary creature—a phoenix.
Your spellcasting is rife with strange lights, mild fumes, and other captivating effects that befuddle your foes.
You react to harm by flowing into an elemental stance with new advantages.
All things eventually end, a truth that you can put into practice by accelerating your passage through time to shake off harmful effects.
If your next action is to cast a spell that would grant your terrain attunement bonus, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (to a minimum of 1 action).
The energy from your smite persists for a moment, allowing you to pass it to a new target.
You spend 1 minute surveying a small location (such as a single room) to get an impression of events that occurred there in the last day.
If your next action is to use your divine font to cast a 3-action heal or harm spell, you can harness the residual energy to counterbalance opposing forces.
When you enter your Arcane Cascade, you disperse the magical reinforcement to nearby allies.
You bring your performance to a sudden, dramatic finish, drowning out other sounds.
You can cause a creature you bring back from the brink of death to thrive and continue healing.
You resuscitate the dead.
Your swagger instills confidence in you and your allies.
You have an eye for angles and can find shots that others believe are impossible.
Your spells become a radiant display of light and color.
Many traditions hold the number seven as significant.
You apply a frayed thread, a pinch of fulu ash, or a similar undone charm to your weapon, and swing to break a spell.
You've learned to create a shared dreamscape to communicate with others.
Your forceful blows shatter objects with ease.
The force of your considered blow shatters objects and defenses alike.
You protect an ally with both your shield and your body.
You draw upon the reservoir of your patron’s magic that resides within your familiar.
You instill great swiftness into your allies.
You can now achieve such flight speeds that your passage splits the very air.
Your animal companion continues to grow in power and ability, and it is now cunning enough to become specialized.
Inspired by the degenerate demiliches your kind sometimes devolves into, you've embedded a gem into your brow, fusing it to your necrotic flesh.
You’ve learned to alter choices you make when casting spells on yourself.
When you use Legendary Thief to steal the impossible, you can steal a prepared spell or spontaneous spell from a foe.
Emulating the great defenders throughout dwarven history, you close your mind to the sensation of pain, becoming as resolute as stone itself.
You lash out with your clawed limbs like a beast that has fallen upon its first meal in days, then back off to see your handiwork.
Your continued study of occult magic has increased your magical capacity, allowing you to cast spells even when it seems impossible.
Your sudden appearance leaves your foe unable to respond.
Attempt an Acrobatics check against the foe’s Reflex DC.
Your magic saturates your surroundings with hateful psychic energy.
You capture transformative fragments of magic and slam them into the ground, creating a shock wave that alters your surroundings.
Tian Xia’s shining cities belie its empires’ long shadow of death, darkened by thousands of years of suffering and injustice.
Your cultivation bearing glorious fruit, you behold Heaven’s will.
