While you might be small enough to grab normally, you can change that at a moment's notice.
You can redirect a spell's power through you to deliver it within striking distance.
Your eidolon Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of creatures at least one size smaller, Trampling each creature whose space it enters.
You’re always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you.
You can prepare a seemingly impossible number of snares in advance, and you’re ready to spring them on unsuspecting foes.
Combining necromancy with the mysterious temporal powers of clockwork, you wind a creature backward from the moment of its death.
The winds are eager to keep you aloft.
You symbiotically combine your form with that of the entity within you, taking a powerful hybrid form to temporarily boost your abilities in combat while maintaining control.
A flighty breeze follows you wherever you go, granting a dramatic flair to everything you do.
When your Psyche is Unleashed, each burst of magic you cast also folds space around you, and you travel through one of those folds.
To protect the knowledge within your mind from intrusion or erasure, you ward yourself against a mental attack.
Your mastery of magic and weapons like the crossbow allow you to wield both with equal ease.
You wave your banner, inspiring allies to throw off the shackles of fear.
After you've grasped a creature with your lash, you swing them around like a whirling hammer, smashing them into all nearby enemies.
Through repeated exposure, you've trained to resist the damage wrought by undead.

column1: You Failed to Account for… This!
column2: When your foes try to attack you, you always seem to have some outlandish invention you can pull out at the last second to protect you from whatever attack they throw at you.
Once per year, when you die, you turn into an immaterial ball of light.
You have full control over your shape and can transform into your inherent animal.
You move like an animal.
You blend your instinct and intellect to move so fast you seem to be a blur.
You have reconfigured the magical resonance of your core to attune to the planar energies of Axis.
Azaersi has granted you limited access to the Stone Roads, attuning you to the tiniest sliver of the _Onyx Key_.
The sight of you charging forward into battle emboldens your allies to follow.
Not even space itself is a match for the unleashed power of your mind.
You tap into the grandeur of your warren's benefactor.
You explode in flame.
You scatter your body and transform into a whirling storm of bones for up to 1 minute or until you spend a single action to return to your normal shape.
Before your soul returned to the Material Plane, you interacted with a host of other souls on their way to the Boneyard.
You have a powerful connection to the Boneyard and its courts, granting you the ability to travel to and from the Boneyard.
Your roar shakes the earth and splits the heavens.
You give a shrill whistle and point, and a massive swarm of rats pours forth from the surrounding terrain to fill a 30-foot burst within 120 feet.
The energy that flows in your blood can save a life in the direst of times.
You can call forth a holy word from the celestial realms to punish your foes.
Your connection to the sun has become an unbreakable bond.
You tap into the Godmind's collective cognitive well, rapidly parsing near-infinite variables to read your surroundings.
A burst of light from your horn cleanses your allies of ailments and sends your foes reeling.
You call upon Mother Earth and Father Moon to fill you with light.
Your coral symbiotes have grown into your bloodstream and are now curled around your heart.
Your body transforms into a powerful magical cannon.
Filled with rancor and hate, you rend the minds of those who displease you.
With discipline born from a lifetime in darkness, you convince the shadow of an enemy to fight by your side.
You can call forth a holy or unholy word from the realms beyond to punish your foes.
For a short time, you fully manifest the expectations of the god destroyer within you.
Sailors know that the sight of an angry merfolk might well mean that they never see the shore again.
Stride up to your Speed.
Your wings are now a permanent part of your body.
Your wings are now a permanent part of your body.
Your wings are now a permanent part of your body.
You're one of Hei Feng's chosen people and have the authority of the Celestial Court on your side.
A fearsome illusion covers you, evoking the terror of the most dangerous animals.
You become a powerful fey creature, gaining strengths tied to the First World but also some of the weakness against which all fey must contend.
You can call forth a blasphemous word from the fiendish realms to punish your foes.
You embrace your monstrous blood and make it your own, screaming out to the heavens and hells alike in rage, pain, and defiance.

column1: First to Strike, First to Fall
column2: Whenever you successfully Strike a creature that has not acted in the first round of combat, that creature is off-guard until the end of your next turn.
You can call upon the vital essence of your spirit to restore life to your allies and call forth vines to ensnare and bludgeon your foes.
You intone a prayer to the dwarven deities Torag or Angradd, willing a higher power to guide your aim in the heat of battle.
You channel the blessings of Nalinivati to transform into a manifestation of her will.
You can briefly transform into a paragon of your draconic ancestry.
Using your ancestors' bones, you manifest their spirits around you in a fossilized form.
You constantly remember details about the world.
You can project a spiritual form to possess another.
You were once born from the energies of the land and nature, and by their power, you can return to life again.
You have such a strong connection to the natural world that you can inspire it to attack at those who threaten you.
You take on the imposing form of a large, winged spirit.
You've greatly improved your abilities and your core can support further augmentations.
You upgrade the vishkanyan venom you can apply with Envenom to greater vishkanyan venom.
You call upon the familial bonds you share with your allies and other ratfolk to become an overwhelming force in battle.
The blood of heroes courses through your veins, and you inspire your allies to dig deep and find a new level of resolve.
The connection between you and the First World resonates within your body stronger than it does for most gnomes, allowing you to cross the threshold between the Universe and the First World.
Choose either _lightning bolt_ or _gust of wind_.
Once per day, you can cast _impaling spike_ as a 7th-rank innate occult spell, except the spike is made of bone instead of cold iron.
Your soul has accumulated countless particles of quintessence over myriad deaths and rebirths.
Calling on your connection to minotaurs of myth, you shunt an enemy into a complex maze full of puzzles of your own devising.
Your eyes glow a deep red and your body courses with adrenaline as you obtain a fraction of the power of the kishin oni.
You call forth the sleeping krakens of the deep to crush your enemies.
While walking down the road on a moonlit night, one might be puzzled to find a shop or hill that wasn’t there before.
Your laugher echoes in the minds of your enemies.
Your yaoguai form has reached its pinnacle, allowing you to assume (or perhaps, return to) the form of a monster of legend.
Your draconic breath destroys the surrounding environment and leaves your enemies in pain.
Your people used powerful magic to travel between distant worlds in the distant past, and the remnants of that magic make such transportation easier for you.
You're among the most powerful of Speakers and can adopt the form of the spirits you entreat with.
You fortify your natural resistances with elemental metal, covering your skin with thick metal.
You call on the spirit of the dragon that devoured the moon to temporarily swallow a celestial body and blind onlookers with its visage.
Like the moray eels athamaru communities raise and train, you know how to quickly strike from hiding.
Your affinity for negative energy spills outward and grants you a refilling well of necromantic essence.
Your body processes magic so effectively that you can induce true regeneration, replacing limbs and restoring organs.
You've mastered your defensive pheromones and have nearly complete control over them.
You have a connection to olethroses, the enigmatic psychopomps who successfully swayed the yamaraj to permit the creation of the first duskwalkers.
Your hat embodies the illusory grandeur of a master dokkaebi.
You tear the veil between the Material Plane and its shadow.
You can cause your scales to glow with scintillating, many-hued colors, protecting you from energy while dazzling foes.
Your inherent glory radiates into the world with all the divine power of the celestial planes for 1 minute.
You call out to your allies and push them to give their all in combat.
You lash out viciously even as you fend off death.

Once per day, when you Change Shape into a fox, you can instead gain the effects of both the canine form of 5th-level _animal form_ and 7th-level _fiery body_ for 1 minute or until you shift back, whichever comes first.
Despite a lifetime filled with questionable decisions, you've managed to survive, as though you have uncanny luck that lets you avoid the consequences of your own actions.

You create a copy of a foe by calling them forth from a nearby reflection, clonally growing them in an instant from one of your hairs or otherwise creating them in a way that matches your own nature as a reflection.
Your command over your vital essence allows you or an ally to recover from grievous wounds.
Many people report seeing a bright light before their death.
Your wings are now a permanent part of your physiology.
You survive danger with surprising regularity.
You've learned how to sew even the most terrible tears and wounds together.
Once per month, when you die, you can instead choose to fade away.
You go into hibernation for twenty-four hours and perform a ritual dedicated to your ancestors, undergoing a one-time metamorphosis.
You aren’t sure if you’ll be reincarnated again, so you might as well take this foe with you.
As you whisper to your pusaka, it attempts to cut away an enemy’s shadow, leaving them in an eternal sleep.
You slip from your adversaries' notice and appear to be somewhere else.
Your construction has flaps of cloth or wicker that can keep you aloft.
The greatest centaurs need not wait until their stories are over to touch the stars in the sky.
No distance can stop tanuki from making their way to a good party.
You can transform your body into a pure primal manifestation of earth, an elemental.
Earthen barriers no longer impede your progress.
The strength of stone overcomes you so strongly that it replaces your stout body.
You can transform into an elemental.
The elemental power in your blood is a raging storm.
You meditate for 24 hours in a one-time ceremony within a forest or cave; after your seclusion, your frame and limbs swell with warlike might to enact your vows.
You call forth the blood of your foes to grant you vigor.
When your character would die, you can attempt a DC 17 flat check.
Death is as natural as breathing to you, and you can move past it as easily as the other troubles in your life.
Since your soul has experienced not only death but also rebirth, you can shift your physical body into the Ethereal Plane for brief intervals.
Mortal worries are such simple matters to you that you leave them behind almost as quickly as you experience them.
You conjure the force of the tides to gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC until the end of your next turn.
You know how to leverage your size and momentum when using your horns attack, and can use your movement speed to overrun your foes.
As the earth drinks the light of sun and moon, so does your steady vow imbibe superlunary forces, ready to be unleashed with a moment’s mantra.
You can transform yourself or the bodies of others to express your displeasure.
When you focus your eyes carefully, your gaze can pierce through all obfuscations, even magical ones.
Your senses are so sharp they pierce through all illusions.
Your connection to both life and undeath lets you twist the healing power of magic items to suit your own needs and aims.
Your jumping prowess is unmatched.
You can cast _volcanic eruption_ as a 7th-level primal innate spell once per day.
You can uplift all around you with your pranks, causing you and your allies to receive divine guidance in all your movements to effortlessly avoid environmental hindrances.
Within all surkis is the capacity to be whatever they need to be, and you can tap into that capacity even now.
The venom you produce is exceptionally potent and difficult to overcome.
With a sweep of your hand, vines and roots burst from the ground along the edge of your space between you and the attacker, creating a natural lattice of wood that grants standard cover.
You have been granted a sliver of the power of the yamaraj, the magistrates of the dead who agreed to allow duskwalkers to exist at all.
Using your occult connections and incredible powers of persuasion, you convince yourself that the triggering damage is a figment of your imagination.
Flames scouring at your body, venom coursing through your veins—you refuse to believe they exist, and nothing can affect you if you don't believe in it.
White-hot fire consumes everything in a cataclysmic sphere of death.
You conjure metal elemental mounts made of interlocking metal pieces.
You infuse your entire being into a single shot, merging your body into the blast and enabling you to travel the same path as your bolt or bullet.
Your mind and body can, for a short time and with great peril, surpass the final limits of your curse.
Your critical hits are particularly devastating.
You gain _summon animal_, heightened to 9th level, as an innate primal spell that you can cast once per day, but can only summon a purple worm.
You take on a celestial countenance, appearing like a type of celestial who serves your deity.
Your injury poisons can spray onto creatures.
You've achieved perfect magical and physical balance, allowing magic to flow into and through you more easily.
As your overwhelming psyche fells a creature, you use its flickering consciousness to detonate psychic energy from the creature's head.
You become one with a devastating thunderstorm from the Plane of Air, placing a crown of lightning upon your brow.
Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual.
You've glimpsed the furthest recesses of your mind.
You release a volley of projectiles from your weapon, or power it to fly in every direction across the battlefield and Strike multiple creatures.
Your body hardens as you combine your attacks, making your finishing blows more damaging.
Your courageous anthem lets loose a discordant shriek that imbues your allies’ attacks with powerful sonic reverberations.
You can pour divine power into an item, letting the wearer exceed their limits.
The power of your mystery surges through you like a font of divine energy, even when your own magic dwindles.
When you pull forth vitality or void energy, you also create a smaller pocket of that energy.
You time the components of your spell with exacting precision, setting up a resonance that duplicates the spell's effects.
Your powerful attack causes damage that reverberates through your opponent’s body, shaking muscle from bone.
Focusing the powers of your ki to augment your blows, you stretch and lengthen your body in ways that defy logic.
You take on an elemental countenance, appearing like a type of elemental of your element.
You transmute your body into an ethereal form.
Your construct unleashes a broad swath of devastation by separating its limbs, deploying hidden armaments, or using a similar technique to wreak havoc.
The world is a stage upon which you are always playing.
You draw no distinction between the sleeping and waking worlds.
You modify an arrow or bolt to bring death to your target in a single potent hit.
Your features reshape into those of a type of fiend who serves your deity; for example, as a demon you might have putrid scales, twisted horns, and red eyes.
You jam a triple charge of black powder into your weapon to unleash a devastating but risky and inaccurate attack.
You cycle through the elements in a devastating combination attack.
You're surrounded by a palpable sense of menace and power that's terrifying to behold.
You've completed the third and final step in your assimilation of scroll esoterica, granting you daily scrolls of incredible power.
You have unlocked a qi technique achievable only by those who attain complete mastery of both their body and their spirit.
Your bloodline is extraordinarily complex.
Your command over halcyon magic is nearly unmatched.
You've worked to sharpen your companions' instincts to supernatural levels.
The landscape fills with monumental filaments of metal.
The fires of creation become yours to control.
You find tiny imperfections and somehow fit yourself through them, possibly moving directly through the wall or floor.
You can use Prescient Planner even if you have already used it after purchasing goods, and you can Interact to draw the item as a single action instead of a 2-action activity.
Your implement supercharges your weapon to shoot an impossible volley or carve through your foes.
You forgo precision to attack at an impossible speed.
Your esoteric formulas are so unusual that they allow you to dabble in magic from diverse traditions that other bards don’t understand.
You fire a volley at all foes in an area.
Your mastery of alchemical secrets enables you to replicate effects most believe can be achieved only via magic.
You easily banish creatures with your weapon.
You always seem to bounce back from the worst.
An illusion of a limitless expanse with an impossibly blue sky makes all within feel the sensation of falling...
You can prepare a spell slot that exists in your mind as many different possibilities at once.
You have an exceptional link to your third implement.
Your deity punishes creatures that harm you.
You can invoke nature’s fury upon your foes.
You have mastered a potent technique for using your ki to reinforce your physical form and propel yourself through the air.
You spend 1 minute briefing up to four allies about one of your open investigations.
You stab your foe in a vital organ, possibly killing them outright.
Your bond replenishes your focus.
If your illusions or enchantments fail to ensnare the minds of others, you can cast them again.
Your eidolon gains a bevy of lower-level spells.
You’ve learned to leverage every possible edge.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You've learned the final truth of beast guns, making you a master in the magic they grant you.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master bounded spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
Your scroll collection is incredible, brimming with eldritch power, and you can prepare far more of them than an ordinary scroll trickster.
You have unlocked the deeper magic of your _gelid shard_, gaining access to new levels of spells.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting archetype benefits.
You gain the master bounded spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
Your animal companion shares your incredible hunting skills, allowing it to take down your shared prey with ease.
When you clear your mind, your focus comes flowing back in a powerful rush.
The power of the bear within you can expand your physical presence even further.
You've practiced and increased your draconic might, allowing you to take your draconic form more often.
Your dragon wings are now a permanent part of your body, giving you a fly Speed equal to your Speed.
Your alchemical mastery can resuscitate the recently slain.
With superior engineering and magical application, you have freed your signature vehicle from the bonds of gravity, allowing it to soar through the sky like a dragon.
Your deity empowers you to perform minor miracles, allowing you to readily adapt to the fluctuating needs of your duties.
Your armor innovation activates various devices you prepared ahead of time, and you use one of them to reduce the damage you would take by 15.
When you and animals sing together, your words ring even brighter and bolder, cutting through disruptions.
Your parries and finishers allow you to riposte with the slightest provocation.
Your patron partially manifests itself through your familiar to claim a foe’s power for its own.
You burn out all your rage to ensure that your attack lands and your mind remains free.
You have perfected the formulas for bombs that impede your enemies.
Thanks to magic and muscle memory, you can stay in your alternate shapes indefinitely.

You gain an appropriate ki spell for your School of Perfection: _unblinking flame ignition_ for Unblinking Flame, _unbreaking wave containment_ for Unbreaking Waves, _unfolding wind crash_ for Unfolding Wind, or _untwisting iron pillar_ for Untwisting Iron.
After watching the motions of combat with incredible intensity and precision, you fire at your prey at the perfect moment to deliver maximum pain.
Your attacks with your preferred weapons deal especially devastating wounds.
You’ve learned to exploit your enemies’ openings.
You surround yourself with a thick field of protective primal energy.
You center yourself with the universe and draw upon its vast power.
The sky's the limit, as long as you've got enough black powder.
Rock overflows from within you to consume your form before cracking open to reveal your body transformed into living stone.
Your healing energies linger after you cast, providing continual benefits.
You’ve discovered how to reuse some of your spell slots over and over.

When you absorb a spell using the Absorb Spell reaction, you utilize secret, techniques that allow you to retain the power and knowledge necessary to cast the spell repeatedly—potentially for a greater period of time.
Booming, crashing walls of water, enough to fill a harbor, smash out ahead of you, overwhelming all in their path.
Terrifying trees attack your enemies.
The wounds you inflict are grievous.

When you Counterspell a spell with a school matching your specialization, if you critically succeed at your counteract check, or if you succeed while using a spell of a higher level than the spell you countered, you can redirect the spell you countered.
When your target proves resilient to your magical deceptions, you can try them again on someone else.
You blend in to your surroundings so well that others have trouble telling you apart from the terrain.
The shadows protect you better than any armor can, and they give you power to plunge others into darkness.
You can project your premonitions of clarity to your allies.
Your expertise enables you to knock away spells.
You've built clockwork wings or jets into your dynamo, allowing you to use your prosthesis to fly.
Your animal companion gains a specialization.
You siphon some of the power from an offensive hex you cast to direct it at a second target as well.
You fully protect your allies from the worst blows.
The transgressions of your enemies fuel you to retaliate with divine speed.
You flow like water, avoiding all restraints.
You can erect a magical cowl that terrorizes your enemies.
A massive sphere of rock explodes, unleashing a cataclysm of falling debris and deadly shrapnel.
You invest in two futures, then choose the one to make a reality.
You string three arrows to your bow and fire them all at once.
Whether from jury-rigged magic items, deduction from the study of magical interactions, or other means, you have a contingency in your back pocket for desperate situations.
You transmogrify your eidolon each day.
The seasons shift rapidly.
Your mercy transcends the bounds of life and death.
Your senses are finely tuned to the slightest variations in the air, so much that you can place your shot exactly where you intend to aim it from any range possible with your weapon.
The moon has always been connected to the tides, and now you can grasp that connection.
You can channel the entire realm of possibilities of your spellbook into an attack.
You make a vicious attack that maims your enemy.
You whirl a foe to smash into all nearby creatures before throwing them far away.
Your perceptive abilities and ability to process sensory information are so far beyond the pale that you notice minute discrepancies in all sorts of illusions and physical transformations.
You refine the precision of your unbelievable storm of blows.
If you die while under the effect of at least one elixir, the alchemical compounds in your bloodstream bring you back to life at the start of your next turn.

column1: All the Time in the World
column2: Your firsthand experience of the subjective nature of time and space has given you new observational insights.
You have embraced brute destructive power.
Gain the _apex companion_ focus spell.
You have mastered the greatest secrets of arcane magic.
Add the following property runes to the list you can choose for your blessed armament: animated, _greater fearsome_, _grievous_, _keen_, and _greater vitalizing_.
Your bomb incorporates an explosive spark of wonder that leaves witnesses dumbfounded.
Overwhelm evil creatures with your aura.
Your extensive service affords you certain divine privileges.
In moments of danger, you can call upon your god’s form in an instant.
The erratic teleportation magic you experienced in the Kortos Mounts has taught you a few tricks.
You shed some of your material form, becoming a being of pure thought.
Your inborn magical nature lets you redirect ambient energies to fuel your spells.
Swap out spells from your repertoire more easily.
You permanently mutate to become more like the creatures of your bloodline.
You command the ultimate powers of your bloodline and tradition.
With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required.
Your steed gains incredible celestial powers granted by your deity.
You can drive your allies into a frenzy, granting them incredible benefits.
Your research has paid off, culminating in the legendary philosopher's stone.
You Stride up to your Speed and your ki enshrouds your limbs in a terrifying stormy energy.
Your mask carries the legacy of Verdant Spider, the Speaker of Needs, allowing you to deceive and outwit your foes.
You either performed in or stood witness to the dance used to invoke the Celestial Dragon and can harness a sliver of their power.
You have honed your body to attack with lethal focus.
Your hair constantly wriggles and writhes.
You can manipulate the same energies that the _aeon orbs_ use to sustain life.
Prepare more alchemical items from your infused reagents.
Your mask grants you the abilities of Whistling Kite, the Vigilant Seer, who emancipated thousands.
Emblazon more equipment at the same time.
As an ultimate foe of evil and protector of the innocent, your very presence is a ward against evil.
Just as the Vale of Aroden retains light and life despite inhospitable surroundings, you can sustain yourself regardless of your environment.
Your debilitations last for 1 minute.
You move as fast and freely as the wind.
Your link with your eidolon is so intense that you continuously reinforce its abilities.
You have learned that distance can foil enemies better than any armor.
You are so suspicious of everyone you meet that you keep mental notes on how to defeat them all—even your own allies.
When you perform sleight of hand, you fold space so that objects really do disappear.
Your songs overwhelm the target with unbearable emotion, potentially striking them dead on the spot.
Your steed ally manifests a suite of powerful and sinister gifts granted to it by your deity.
You become so entwined with your innovations that you can use them without a second thought.
You have mastered an ultimate grappling technique capable of breaking even the mightiest of foes.
Strike harder and heal more rapidly.
Your mask is infused with restorative magic associated with Ibex, the Flourishing Field, so it constantly repairs itself.
You remember the revelry of the Night Parade and call them to your aid in a riotous display.
Witnessing the might of a kaiju up close awoke a new ferocity within you.
You embody the link to your patron so completely that you can cast your hexes in rapid succession.
When you slip out of sight, you disappear.
You have entwined yourself with the natural world, and its full power flows through you.
You are as much a creature of cold as whatever ancestry you were born to.
Your strikes flow endlessly.
Your body thrums with the primal vitality of the greatest of the ursine beasts.
You flow from technique to technique, renewing yourself as you embrace each style you have mastered.
You can create endless shorter-lived snares, protecting your lair or using them against foes.
Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming.
You execute a maneuver that defies possibility.
At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain an extra reaction
You fundamentally understand everything to the point where your research can't possibly be wrong.
No one can match the pace at which elements flow from you.
You and your mount move like one being, effortlessly reading each other’s signals and synchronizing even in the thick of battle.
You focus on your hunted prey, perceiving angles, air resistance, and every variable that would affect your ranged attack.
Your ability to summon extends past your other spellcasting.
You can draw magic from the ley lines of the world.
Qi flows freely from within you.
You are a conduit for truly deific power.
You can add a highly explosive additive to an alchemical bomb to turn it into a mega bomb.
By adopting resonant reflections, you have learned to copy the abilities of other creatures as well.
Your mind's limits are only what you imagine them to be.
The power of your mystery enables you access to myriad magic.
You can realign your kinetic gate with a thought.
Your mystery grants you access to deep reserves of truly miraculous divine power.
The pack is strongest when it acts as one, and like a group of hungry wolves, you work together to bring down a single target.
You find opportunities to perform stylish feats in the moments between others' heartbeats and eye blinks.
The truest depths of your divine mystery are fathomless and contradictory, granting you changing powers that even you can barely begin to fathom.
You have mastered the greatest secrets of your patron’s magic and learned a fundamental truth about your patron, even if their identity still remains a mystery.
You develop another incredible creation.
You have enhanced the formulas for your mutagens, aligning them perfectly to your physiology.
You prepare to fire with an instinctive speed and muscle memory that go beyond your conscious thoughts.
You learn the _pied piping_ composition spell, which enables you to control the actions of weak-minded individuals.
You have learned to saturate an area with poison.
Your mask carries the protective instincts of White Bull, the Horn Forger, and no one will hurt your allies while you have anything to say about it.
You stomp the ground with such force that it creates a minor earthquake, with the effects of the _earthquake_ spell.
You reactively switch with your decoy to foil your foe.
You have learned to manipulate reflections of magic, similar to the resonant reflections.
You attempt to counteract the triggering spell using powerful magical techniques observed in the Kortos Mounts.
The more obstacles between you and your target, the deadlier your shots become, as you ricochet off multiple surfaces to hit them.
You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action.
In a burst of flame, you return to health like a phoenix rising from the ashes.
You are a great warrior that can stand strong against the fiercest opponents to your cause.
You've realized a way to manipulate the effects of your oracular curse.
You destroy the space between you and your targets, allowing you to strike with your melee weapons at great range.
Your shield is a vessel of divine protection.
Your mask holds the legacy of Black Heron, the Wings of Knowledge, who united the aeromancers of the Shory Empire.
Your ability to react to unexpected circumstances is preternaturally sharp.
Gain the _song of the fallen_ focus spell.
You can merge spells, producing multiple effects with a single casting.
You have mastered a handful of spells to such a degree that you can cast them even if you haven’t prepared them in advance.
Deep understanding of divine revelations into the nature of vital essence allows you to freely manipulate the energy of life and death.
Your mastery of magic ensures that you can alter your spells just as easily as you can cast them normally.
Like Azure Leopard, the Patient Warden, your mask makes you most at home in the night and teaches you how to use the darkness to hunt.
Being in the presence of the _aeon orbs_ as they deteriorated has taught you how to siphon energy, and you do so with the required magic item.
Your mask remembers the stories of Shifting Frog, Storyteller of the Past and Future.
Increase your visual acuity.
You've made it almost effortless to combine spells and attacks.
The movement of you and your allies is swift and decisive as the judgment of your deity.
You have learned how to weave countless performances together into a solo symphony with multitudinous effects.
You combine your synergy and spells into a fantastic web of magic, allowing you to cast two spells at once.
You have learned how to invest magic more deeply by witnessing Aroden's works.
You've reached the apex of the Crimson Oath's power.
Your mask grants you the toughness of Elephant, the Conjured Chronicle.
You borrow a bit of time from the future to act now.
Your mask hosts the legacy of Golden Snake, the Tireless Guide, allowing you to guide others with ease.

column1: To the Ends of the Earth
column2: Your ability to track your prey has surpassed explanation, allowing you to trace your prey’s movements and predict its location with ease.
You've learned how to maximize the defensive abilities of your tower shield.
You can divide your attention three ways when hunting.
You transcend the limitations of form.
You can transform to match your eidolon.
You've segmented your psyche so it can operate in tandem.
You prepare a variety of incredible gizmos on each of your allies, linking them together through careful modification to enable you to power them up all at once.
You've nurtured your bonds with your comrades, allowing you to share the benefits of your esoterica.
Your experience keeps you on your toes, helping you adopt complex strategies on the fly and face the most dangerous challenges.
You can flexibly cast all of your spells, granting a dizzying array of possible options.
You are so skilled at navigating the wild, your movement is completely unaffected by terrain.
You can move your demesne here and there, bringing it wherever your journey takes you.
The laws of magic can limit your mind only if you think you need them, and you've grown past the need for such limits.
You have become a brutal, unstoppable force of nature, able to shrug off mortal wounds with ease.
The life-giving properties of the _aeon orbs_ flourish within you.
Your mask grants the extraordinary magical senses of Carmine Jaws, the Hyena who Looks Between.
You have learned to attack meridians and pressure points.
You move so quickly that you create a short-lived afterimage, looks exactly like you, in front of you or behind you.
Like a kaiju, you leave a trail of destruction in your wake.
Your skill with weapons bends the laws of reality, allowing you to continuously attack with speed that would normally require magical assistance.
You combine the might of a multitarget spell with a whirling flurry of attacks.
You have learned Artokus Kirran's most hidden secrets, granting you the ability to create alchemy infused with the power of wishes.
Your home is an animated structure that obeys your commands.
The thaumaturge's path culminates with the working of wonders.
Though creating demiplanes usually requires lengthy rituals, you know how to establish minor planar effects.

The ravenous maggots inside you become capable of exploding forth from your attacks into the wounds of an opponent, whispering telepathic words of destruction that invoke horrific flashbacks of Kabriri's transformation from elf to ghoul or psychic images of hundreds of maggots bursting from the victim's flesh all at once.
You built your reanimated construct companion of modular components from various corpses.
You cough up a cloud of gray soil.
Magically estimate the number of nearby objects.
You focus deeply on the link between you and your eidolon and boost the power of your eidolon's attacks.
Magnify your voice to be heard at a distance.
You evoke buzzing and crawling insects to climb onto a foe's body and bite.
Fling a glob of acid that splashes a small area.
Freezing sleet and heavy snowfall collect on the target's feet and legs, dealing 1d4 cold damage and other effects depending on its Reflex save.
You inspire yourself and your allies with words or tunes of encouragement.
Cloud a creature's mind and possibly stun it.
Take an incredibly deep breath.
Sense whether magic is nearby.
Sense whether metal is nearby.
Your patron deigns to whisper a few secrets.
You create a magical lens that distorts space as best suits you.
Throw divine energy that deals spirit damage.
Dry out an object and collect the water.
React to eat flame then belch the smoke out.
Zap one or two creatures with lightning.
Use a countering element to protect against a spell.
Your patron's resentment manifests in a baleful, envious gaze.
Create a simple auditory or visual illusion.
You place a psychic lock in a foe's mind that prevents it from a specific action.
Protect an ally against one specific enemy.
Your _gelid shard_ drinks down nearby heat in a futile attempt to sate itself and achieve a level of frigid cold unheard of on the Material Plane.
Damage a creature with bitter cold.
Damage and push adjacent creatures with air.
Protect yourself with a glass shield.
You glimpse a loose scale, a seam in a foe's armor, or a similar weakness, aiding your allies in landing a precise hit.
Morph your limb into a claw and attack with it.
Divine guidance improves one roll.
A powerful hymn harms and deafens.
Transform mud into a healing plaster to treat wounds without healer's tools.
Burn a creature up close or at range.
Kindle all light sources around you.
You create a simple weapon of force.
Encourage yourself and an ally to improve one roll apiece.
You pull a large handful of guts from your midsection.
You speak the true name of a creature to more surely affect it with your magic.
Share thoughts and experiences with allies.
Learn true north and the direction to another location.
Make an object glow.
Slash and shock a creature with an electrified filament.
Speak a message to a distant creature, who can reply.
The target feels the brush of feathers against its skin and hears screeches in its ears, warning it to keep away from a creature you designate.
You're surrounded by orchestral music that shifts and changes to match your behavior.
Turn a piece of metal into needles and shoot them at a foe.
The barest spin of your patron's spool is enough to alter fate.
You offer to broker a pact of peace.
Fire a spike of magic that can pass through shields and cover
Perform a minor magical trick.
Shield your eidolon or minion from harm.
Exhale toxins to poison a foe.
Detect if an object is magical.
Pick up societal cues.
You focus deeply on the link between you and your eidolon and reinforce your eidolon's defenses.
Learn about an area using root systems.
Splash a creature to invigorate it and wash away acid and fire.
Evoke rocks to bludgeon and create difficult terrain.
With a cruel laugh and a flash of your canines, you make a target understand that death is coming to claim it and that its demise will serve to strengthen another.
A shield of magical force blocks attacks and spells.
Your patron blankets the target's eyes in darkness.
Leave a magical mark.
Make weapons silver and impede a devil's teleportation.
Cut creatures with ripples of air.
You bolster your allies' physical strength with a hearty exhortation.
Using a sliver of Baba Yaga's power, you briefly bring an object to life.
Batter creatures with a water blast.
Stabilize a dying creature.
A long tentacle like that belonging to an octopus, anemone, or man-of-war, dripping with briny water, appears from a glowing blue portal to wrap around the target’s face, blocking its vision.
Your patron fills a creature with fervor, empowering their blows.
Call an instrument that only you can play.
Reinforce a creature’s stance or grip with roots.
Make a domesticated animal friendlier to you.
Conjure a vine to entangle a creature.
Move an object with a floating hand.
Fling an object at a creature.
Your mind creates a violent axis of motion in a nearby space.
The same abilities that let you raise or lower thermal energy also let you keep it at a safe medium.
Drop a tree on someone.
Know perfectly what time it is
You batter a creature's internal organs, leaving no external signs of the immense pain you delivered.
Send a sentence through stone.
Your performance makes allies feel they can succeed at anything.
Damage and weaken the undead with vital energy.
Damage and weaken the living with void energy.
Contract space to cover more ground when you move
Ignore misfortune once.
Your patron's majesty—or their displeasure—comes in a growl from your throat, making other creatures reluctant to harm you.
Your song moves allies to protect themselves more effectively.
Your music sets a fast pace.
You fling a mass of furious thoughts into the air, where they expand into numerous blades or other shapes that rain down.
Enemies within the area are frightened 1.
You stockpile thermal energy in a magical wheel-like construct that lets you burn opponents with cold or freeze their bodies with heat.
You get a vision of the creature when it was alive, and its last 10 minutes of travel.
Your body becomes insubstantial as you partially phase out.
You quickly view your surroundings from a variety of angles, your senses constructing an overall mental picture.
You telepathically assail the minds of your foes.
You maintain a brisk performance that keeps allies on the move.
You set up a transparent, rippling screen of telekinetic energy that seizes small, fast-moving projectiles.
Nothing is so contagious as a thought.
You telekinetically animate a weapon that's unattended or on your person.
You see just a split second into the future and glean how an enemy will move, making it easier for your allies to strike it mid-action.
You weave light into a cube of vivid and fantastic patterns.
You mime an invisible 10-foot-by-10-foot wall adjacent to you and within your reach.
Energy attempts to balance out, but with your magic, you can shunt all the energy in one area to another.
You race from point to point, tearing open a tunnel in space.
You perform rapidly, speeding up your ally.
You make subtle changes to yourself to adapt to the situation.
The blessings of your god make your feet faster and your movements more fluid.
The memories of long-dead spellcasters grant you their knowledge, making your spells more formidable.
You touch a creature and force them to see and feel the ancestors surrounding you.
You gain an angelic halo with an aura that increases allies' healing from the _heal_ spell.
You create a brief vision of immense wealth filling the spell's area.
All wood, dead or alive, is your armory.
You conjure a swirling wind of ashes that blows through the area.
Your body fills with physical power and skill.
You tilt the scales of luck slightly to protect a creature from disaster.
Your patron's aegis descends to shield a target from harm.
You probe the target's mind to glean knowledge.
With a quick burst of laughter, you prolong a magical effect you created.
You cry out a call to arms, inspiring your allies to enter the fray.
You fire a javelin of electricity that leaves a charged field around its target.
You push at the target's mind to deflect their ire.
You infuse your target with attraction, causing it to act friendlier toward you.
You've learned to read the future in the patterns of flames and smoke.
You drape the target in a mantle of swirling shadows that make it harder to see.
Vines twine into a wicker horn in your hands, and out spills a single fruit, nut, or similar small bit of produce.
Your performance protects you and your allies.
A deluge of paint or colorful illusions descend on the area, reflecting your personal creative specialty.
You tear open the ground then slam it shut.
Your voice booms, smashing what's in front of you.
You raise your religious symbol and create a blinding flash of light.
Seeing another pass from this world invigorates you.
You fill the target’s mind with terrifying images to disrupt their combat focus.
You transpose the moment that the target would be injured to later in its timestream.
You issue a diabolic edict, demanding the target perform a particular task and offering rewards for its fulfillment.
You magnify the darkness from the triggering effect, causing the ambient light level to flicker briefly so you can slip from sight.
You tumble through space, making a short dimensional hop to better position yourself for an attack.
You conjure a colorful, fast-moving shape, such as a small bird or other animal that draws your target’s eye.
Your deity sends wracking plagues.
You glimpse into the target’s future.
You shape energy into one incorporeal tiny dragon that flits around you.
Vicious claws grow from your fingers.
With a ripple of earth, you raise small barriers from the ground.
Walking over to an item to pick it up is so much effort.
Your touch disrupts the connection between body and soul, possibly forcing the soul out of the body altogether.
Your patron uses its superior command of the elements, empowering them to undermine your foe.
With a flick of your wrist, you fling a chunk of your elemental matter at your foe.
You inject a sliver of the void into your mind, momentarily remaking it into a bleak and empty place.
You flood your eidolon with power, creating a temporary evolution in your eidolon's capabilities.
You focus on the intricacies of the magic binding you to your eidolon to extend the duration of your _boost eidolon_ or _reinforce eidolon_ spell.
While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, your appearance becomes bland and nondescript.
You sprinkle magical dust in the spell's area, making those within easier to trick.
A blazing band of fire arcs through the air, lighting your opponent and the ground they stand upon on fire.
Vicious dragon claws appear and slash at two nearby foes.
You fire an arrow-shaped bolt of force, one of the most common and reliable forms of battle magic.
You briefly turn your attack into pure force to bypass your opponent's defenses.
As you call a creature to your side, your magic transforms its body, heightening its ferocity and fortifying its resilience.
You recall memories of hedonistic rites to send yourself into an infectious frenzy, dancing and howling wildly to encourage your companions to join in.
With a flourish, you fulfill a creature's wish for protection, bending reality to keep them from harm.
A slavering maw opens beneath a target and tries to take a bite out of them.
You build up gravitational force and funnel it into your blows, leading to more powerful attacks with blade and bow alike.
You guide the target in examining their innermost feelings, their behaviors, and the motivations behind their actions, granting them clarity and insight.
One small space becomes inhospitable to undead as you fill it with life-infused benevolent magic.
You take advantage of one of the most fundamental lessons of magic to levitate and propel your weapon.
You heal an animal's wounds, restoring 1d8 Hit Points to the target.
You heal your animal companion's wounds.
Your words bless a creature with an enhanced connection to vital energy.
You stoke the target's ambition beyond reason, until it believes no one is capable of helping it, or that others aren't to be trusted.
Qi-formed threads unravel from your fabric on conjured needles as your attack makes contact with an enemy and wraps it in place like an insect in its cocoon.
You evoke a magical stone and throw it, with divine guide to your aim.
Your glorious singing mends wounds and provides a temporary respite from harm.
You sharpen a creature’s senses, though more distant objects become hazy, indistinct, or muted to it.
You strengthen the target's ambition, increase its resentment of its allies, and make its allegiances more susceptible to change.
You surround yourself with a combustible aura.
You focus your qi into devastating magical attacks.
You draw forth a hag's innate jealousy to deny a target its greatest attribute.
Your nose becomes more sensitive to the scents of the wild, the better for you to track your quarry.
You let out your negative emotions in a guttural wail that shakes your enemies’ hearts.
Your hands become infused with powerful vitality, capable of healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch.
Life force from your patron floods into the target, ensuring they can continue doing your patron's will for just a little longer.
You forge a connection of life energy between you and your target, distributing harm between both of you.
With a wave of the hand, you cause the targets to see the world around them as if a gauzy film had been lifted away to expose the truth that lies below their perceived reality.
You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits.
You call upon your muse's deep mysteries, granting the target a greater ability to think and recall information.
Your animal companion grows a thicker hide, matted fur, or a harder shell, granting it a +1 status bonus to AC.
A creature becomes a divine receptacle for pure magical energy.
You shine a ray of moonlight.
A long, jagged needle jabs into the target foe's psyche whenever it tries to attack a creature your patron holds in special regard.
You grant an ally a token of favor.
A magical indicator assures a creature that you’ve upheld your end of a bargain.
By touching an object, you draw forth the experience of those who created and used it.
Huge amounts of food and drink fill the target.
Dry winds dehydrate a creature.
At your unspoken plea, your patron temporarily assumes control over your familiar.
You meditate upon perfection to remove all distractions from your mind.
Your patron momentarily recalls your familiar to the ether, shifting it from its solid, physical form into a ghostly version of itself.
You temporarily improve the target’s physique.
The target gains a +2 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +3 bonus if the target has master or better proficiency in the skill.
You expand a ring of glyphs that shields your allies.
You protect your ally by suffering in their stead.
Giving the air a push, you buffet the target with a powerful gust of wind; it must attempt a Fortitude save.
Accelerated by your qi, you move with such speed you become a blur.

You attempt to learn more about the target's fate in the short term, usually within the next day for most prosaic creatures, or the next hour or less for someone likely to have multiple rapid experiences, such as someone actively adventuring.
You strike mention of a specific name from one or more documents.
You create a gout of flame that both heals and burns.
You create a wave of water that you ride, banking around obstacles and surfing to higher ground.
You inflict pain upon the target and revel in their anguish.
Speaking a short prayer as you gather your thoughts, you're blessed to find yourself pointed in the right direction.
Your magic throws the creature's biology into disarray, inducing nausea, fever, and other unpleasant conditions.
You manifest a supernatural funerary mask, granting you a +1 status bonus to Will saving throws against emotion effects for 1 minute.
With a pinch, the metal of a weapon twists, adding numerous jagged blades along its surface.
You shoulder some of your ally’s pain.
As you attack a foe, warding magic transforms your momentum into action and lifts your shield.
You Raise your Shield, causing ephemeral spirit shields to float within your champion's aura.
You let loose a projectile that flies true and leaves the blazing trail of a meteor behind it.
You soar and leave the world’s squabbles behind before your violent intentions ground you once more.
You spit toxic goo that coats your target’s face and eyes, dealing 2d6 poison damage.
You may not have placed your snare in the right place, but you can magically move it there.
You attempt to calm the target by uttering soothing words in a calm and even tone.
You siphon off a portion of the target's soul to bolster your own vitality.
You spin your staff with a twirling flourish, attacking two foes and transforming the momentum into magical energy to charge for your next Spellstrike.
The deceiving creature's tongue splits like a serpent's tongue.
You fling a spray of tiny shooting stars, dealing 2d4 fire damage.
You bond yourself to a cherished friend, vowing to share their fate for good or for ill.
With a twist of a finger, you send a creature careening on a haphazard trajectory.
You swiftly move from a dangerous spot and veil yourself.
You extend your senses through a multitude of crawling and flying creatures.
With soothing words, you lull the target into an enchanting dream.
You surround a foe in a swirling storm of violent winds, roiling clouds, and crackling lightning.
Your touch calls forth a churning mass of icy water that clings to your target, dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage and 1d4 cold damage.
You share some of your own temporal distortions with a foe, altering their mind and body unpredictably as they're thrown backward or forward in time.
Your arms turn into long, pliable tentacles, increasing your reach when you're delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes with your arms (such as fist and claw Strikes) to 10 feet.
You swing your massive weapon, creating a wave of sonic vibrations that topples creatures.
You call forth a tremendous wave to move the target either in a body of water or on the ground.
Your imperious touch erodes the target's willpower, making it easier to control.
You infuse the target with void energy, healing undead or damaging a living creature.
You attack the target's life force with undeath, dealing 1d6 void damage.
You instill within a creature the touch of the grave.
You loosen the link between yourself and your eidolon, allowing it to travel farther from you for a short period of time.
Divine grace ensure that nothing can keep you prisoner or hold you back.
You unleash a small blast of potential that destroys one of a creature's possible futures, leaving them reeling.
You reach within for a different part of yourself, and you set it free, transforming your body into another form.
You transform just a part of your body.
A powerful blast of wind erupts from the ground, launching the target into the air and sending it crashing back down.
You surround yourself in confidence.
Your patron draws the target into a drowsy state, causing daydreams and sluggishness.
Your body sprouts brambly thorns that thrive on life magic.
Your true might comes from your bonds with your allies, and you glory in their achievements.
You fill the creature's mind with a terrifying vision.
You create illusory hazards that cover all surfaces in the area.
Holding your weapon aloft, you fill it with divine energy.
The serenity of violence fills your mind, giving you a heightened sense of knowing exactly where your weapons need to be.
You suppress sound in an area, preventing anyone from giving away valuable secrets.
A thin layer of ash and flame covers the ground in the area.
You fling a hollow icicle filled with winter’s wrath.
Your touch rots organic material and decays objects.
You speak a statement that you believe to be true and that is free of any attempt to deceive through twisting words, omission, and so on.
You call a tiny star to orbit a creature in a sparkling halo before shooting up into the heavens, where it marks the creature’s rough location.
Without fully transforming your body, you gain one animalistic feature, which you select from the list below each time you Cast the Spell.
The target grows a prehensile tail, or gains prehensile qualities in their existing tail, to help them climb with ease.
Your animal companion grows much larger, towering over its foes in battle.
You heal yourself in one of the following ways, chosen by you when you cast the spell.
You have a preternatural ability to remember details about your foes.
You use your knowledge of nature to pass the target off as a common animal of the same size, representing a species chosen when the spell is cast.
Unleash a blast of ruby light, striking all before you.
You make a quick gesture, tracing the link between yourself and your eidolon and drawing on your connection to slowly strengthen your shared life force.
Shed light, granting a bonus to Perception.
You scatter twinkling sparks from your sentinel weapon, replenishing your allies’ fighting spirit and driving out evil.
Gain the speed and senses of your totem animal.
transform into your totem animal.
Reroll a missed unarmed strike.
You brandish your sentinel weapon, summoning the image of your constellation above your head.
You call forth a magical mist that envelops a creature.
You bring out the spirit of another animal that lives within your companion.
Launch a bolt of divine sunfire.
You focus your gaze on a creature and gain a flash of divine insight into its nature.
You utter phrases in an unknown tongue, assaulting the minds of those nearby.
You sift through the multiverse's divine knowledge, seeking out tidbits related to a particular subject.
Your ancestor protects you against those who would bend your will.
Wings of pure light spread out from your back, granting you a fly Speed equal to your Speed.
You ossify your physical form, mimicking the durability of bone.
You're difficult to deter in battle.
You enter a trance that allows you to see through the senses of the target companion.
You channel the allure of your nymph bloodline into a terribly beautiful glance.
Predators are drawn to the scent of blood, and blood can disperse shockingly far in the water.
You quickly adjust your Arcane Cascade to offer magical protection.
You ignite a creature in lasting flames.
Your patron drapes a cloak of illusion about you, making you appear as another creature of the same body shape with roughly similar height and weight as yourself.
With a surge of healing energy, you push back against an affliction threatening the target and grant a small amount of healing.
You spew energy from your mouth, dealing 5d6 damage with a basic Reflex save.
You close your hand and pull life energy from another creature into yourself.
Your eidolon releases a powerful energy attack.
You create an electric latch rune hazard on the target, creating a special crystalline lock on the object.
You call upon your element to propel you, improving your Speed depending on your element.
Devil horns grow from your skull, and your skin takes on features of the devil responsible for your diabolic bloodline.
You can look at currents in the air and water and see tracks that you can follow just as you would on land.
You call upon the arcane energy coursing through your blood to extend the magic it grants.
You call upon your blood’s knowledge of the ancients to extend your magic.
You enter a magical trance that allows you to perceive through the senses of the target creature.
You become invisible and ignore natural difficult terrain (such as underbrush).
You surround your target with wondrous illusions of their greatest desires, which distract them from reality.
You briefly transform your features into the horrific visage of a hag, striking fear into your enemies.
A cloud of magical ashes descends upon creatures in the area.
You shroud your form and features in an impenetrable mask of shadow.
You call upon the frigid depths of outer space to bring a terrible chill to your enemy.
You draw a card from the harrow, either one from a deck you have in hand or magically produce one as part of the spell.
Ki flows through everything. Strike at just the right place with dire consequences
Your litany rails against the sin of wrath, punishing the target for attacking good creatures.
Your patron warps the target's shadow into a deadly form, such as strangling hands, a dangerous weapon, harrying runes, or the like.
You infect your target with fungal spores to hasten the cycle of decay.
Your patron's breath becomes a blizzard of obscuring, scouring ice that follows your target.
You rapidly draw the air from your surroundings, hoarding it for yourself.
You raise a pair of towering waves and slam them into each other, crushing creatures caught between them.
You unleash your qi as a powerful blast that deals 2d6 force damage.
You cause plants in the area to entangle your foes, with the effects of _entangling flora_.
You're unable to leave any debts unpaid.
Like migratory birds, you know everyone flies farther together.
The world seems to shrink before your footfalls.
You encircle yourself in an aura of protective flames.
You draw an occluding veil of spirits around yourself, blocking yourself especially well from undead eyes.
You steal a creature's shadow, leaving it weakened and vulnerable.
You conjure a jagged lance of stone and then launch it at a foe.
You attempt to seize control of the target undead.
The target weapon becomes wreathed in a glowing flame.
Ground in the area turns swampy and fetid.
You appear larger and stronger to nearby creatures, appearing to possess threatening features like antlers, claws, or poison to their senses.
You create a powerful blast of air and a loud peal of thunder, dealing 2d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6 sonic damage.
You manipulate time around your ally, pushing them forward a few moments in time.
Suppress illusions on your target.
Unleash a blast of water to push back foes.
Run across the wind.
Gain temporary hit points.
Your skin becomes painted with vivid stripes or bright aposematic swirls, warning other creatures of its toxic qualities.
#VALUE!
You mark the holy symbol of Achaekek in a visible location on the target’s body.
You shift yourself to adapt to the mystical wavelengths of the energy damage, protecting yourself from further harm.
You transform the target into a form that more closes matches your creative vision.
Lines of burning starlight form a constellation around you.
When lightning is turned at you, you store the charge safely within yourself, unleashing it when the time is right.
You become intensely entrancing, and creatures are distracted by you as long as they remain within the area.
You adopt the stance of clinging shadows.
With the threat of more pain, you compel a creature you've recently harmed.
When you use your magic to support your allies, shared strength bolsters you all.
Your competitiveness drives you to prove yourself against the opposition.
You show the target the spiraling web of actions and consequences that is their life and the changes wrought by these decisions upon themselves and those around them.
You infuse a creature's vision with darkness.
You reveal a glimpse of the impossible conflicts between the divine anathema behind your curse, forcing you to reckon with another's conflicts as well.
You make the target overconfident, leading it to ascribe failure to external factors.
Swirling sands of divine devastation surround you, weakening the defenses of all they touch.
You supercool the nearby air, forming a cloud of dancing ice crystals in an emanation around you.
You teleport a short distance.
After taking the triggering damage, you transform into air.
Striking at thin air, you create hairline cracks in an unoccupied adjacent space that lead somewhere outside reality.
You call forth a torrential downpour, which extinguishes non-magical flames.
You emit an aura of terror.
You create a vivid, illusory daydream drawn from the images of the target's dreams.
You call forth a swirling storm of dust.
As you challenge an enemy, you take some of its attention away from your allies.
You force the Material and Ethereal Planes to partially overlap, creating a zone that causes incorporeal and spiritual entities to take on many of the aspects of corporeal creatures.
Your spellcasting surrounds you in a storm of elemental energy.
Your own might mingles with divine power to protect you from harm.
You're used to mitigating the damage done by bombs, siege engines, and magical artillery.
You create illusory hazards, such as spinning blades or a puddle of acid.
A massive deluge of life energy causes the undead to fall apart.
You view death not as an ending but a beginning, and you delight in dancing on its edge.
A sickly yellow light fills the area as entropic forces prevent healing.
You transform into a Tiny animal that commonly serves as a spellcaster's familiar.

You open your mouth wide and inhale sharply; you draw in the bravery, self-confidence, and hope to which the frightened target clings and then strip away the target's false assumption that these fragile emotions can save them from the oblivion of terror.
You swiftly deflect incoming flames.
A divine beacon radiates serenity, soothing nearby allies.
You call upon your muse to greatly increase the benefits you provide with your courageous anthem, rallying anthem, or song of strength composition.
You multiply the disease within a creature, drawing it into an infectious mist outside their body where it can spread to other creatures.
Glowing letters assemble in the air, providing a transcription of the target’s speech in all languages you speak.
Divine insight lets you see things as they are, unveiled by attempts to magically cloak the truth.
You twist the paths of the target, ensuring that each one leads to you.

You gather the embers of another caster's spell, using your understanding of unified magic to pick apart their formulas and incantations well enough to imitate the spell yourself, if only for a short time.
You become invisible, with the same restrictions as the 2nd-rank _invisibility_ spell.
You summon a tangible manifestation of loneliness to cloak the target from view as surely as if it were wreathed in darkness.
You quickly remind yourself of useful information.
You use some of the spell’s magic to heal yourself.
You shake the earth, toppling nearby creatures.
Reroll the saving throw and use the better result.
You embed a seed of void energy in an undead creature, restoring its unnatural vigor over time.
You become a mantis.
The next damaging or healing spell the target casts before the start of your next turn deals damage or restores Hit Points as if the spell were heightened 1 rank higher than its actual rank.
A palm-sized raw fruit or vegetable of your choice appears in your open hand.
You call upon the authority of cosmic forces of order, overwhelming creatures with remorse and agony for acting outside of their station and purpose.
Sadness flows out of you into nearby creatures, blotting out any other thoughts they had.
You trace several possible routes, quickly resetting the timeline until you find the safest one.
Your body's perfection keeps you just a little bit healthier than most.
Your deity blesses base metals to transform them into precious materials.
A protective aura emanates out from you, safeguarding you and your allies.
You tap into the zeitgeist of any settlements in range.
Drawing on the purifying powers of water, you call forth a veil of fine water droplets suffused with holy energy.
You snatch creatures from the jaws of death, restoring them without the strain of a typical close call.
You call upon the lost and forgotten, assailing your foes’ minds with the memories of those who died with a grievance toward them.
You call forth a repelling field.
You vengefully reflect your pain upon your tormentor.
You channel the might of dragons into your voice, letting out a roar that engenders respect in dragonkind but that instills fear in most other creatures.
You inscribe an invisible eye-shaped rune in the air, creating a sensor as _clairvoyance_.
Your unarmed attacks or weapon gain the benefits of a weapon rune you choose when you cast this spell.
You ensure a secret remains safe from prying spies.
You mock the target for all its failings, twisting its selfconfidence into doubt.
Merging minds with the target, you swap distressing visions.
You change your body to better suit the moment.
You wrap yourself in a crimson cloak that renders you invisible.
Your voice calls a storm of songbirds that whirl around you and peck at your enemies.
Shades and spirits howl and whirl around you in a display that strikes fear into the hearts of all who witness it.
The flow of time congeals around an object or creature, holding it in place.
Powerful winds carry you through the air, giving you a fly Speed equal to your Speed.
You discorporate into a swarm of Tiny creatures.
When someone has overindulged, you can hasten them past the worst of their affliction or intensify their misery.
You twist the forces of fate to make a moment dire or uneventful, with no in-between.
You suppress your choice of one of the following conditions that's affecting the target: clumsy, encumbered, enfeebled, or fatigued.
When you touch the target, a symbol of the moon appears on its forehead, glowing with soft moonlight.
You instantly create a small, permanent scroll that contains a magically precise written description of your current surroundings in every direction.
You add power to your muscles, allowing you to swim or climb walls with ease.
You rarely settle for being in just one place.
You put up a united defense.
Drawing life force into yourself, you become a beacon of vitality.
You cloud the target's mind with vivid, dreamlike imagery, so they have difficulty distinguishing real threats from imagined ones.
You understand that holding a secret is in itself a kind of power.
You take on the stance of the flowing winds, sending out waves of energy at a distance.
You call forth numerous breezes in which you weave gossip, whispering subtly into the ears of those around.

Wood shapes itself according to your will readily, making staircases appear as you climb up the side of a tree, automatically weaving vines into ladders, or lowering branches to lift you up to the top.
You utter a liberating word of power that frees a creature.
You're a devotee of knowledge with an unmatched command of the language used to spread that knowledge, and you can reshape the written word into a form more understandable to your audience.
You stoke the righteous anger within yourself and an ally.
You undermine the target spell, making it easier to defend against.
A blazing symbol appears on the target, cursing it to face divine justice.
You evoke the energy of a part of the Outer Rifts.
You wrap the target in purifying flames.
Your shadow wriggles before spreading out from you, forming a gateway of clinging, consuming shadow through which the horrors of another plane can barely be seen.
Your patron wraps a hand around your target's heart.
You dance, Striding up to half your Speed.
Leathery wings sprout from your back, giving you a fly Speed of 60 feet or your Speed, whichever is faster.
You gather elemental energy and blast your foes in one of the various listed shapes of your choosing, dealing 8d6 damage.
You bind a part of your essence to your surroundings, creating a warded area that grants you power within it, but drains you outside of it.
You call upon fey glamours to cloak an area or the targets in illusion.
Ice and bone-deep cold assail the target, freezing it from the inside out.
Plants in the area grow rapidly, taking on carnivorous characteristics as they seek to consume prey.
Hundreds of skeletal arms erupt from the ground in the area, clawing at creatures within and attempting to hold them in place.
You call forth a plume of hellfire that erupts from below
Your target glows with a magical aura visible only to you and those who follow your lead.
Your litany rails against the sin of sloth, interfering with the target’s ability to react.
You give a speech that fills your target with a drive to improve themself to the exclusion of assisting others.
Your ode staves off death.
You accuse the target of breaking its word to you and invoke the wrath of your patron to claim what's due, demanding the target pay you in currency, fulfill an order, or stand down.
You can deceive creatures by changing their perception of their allies’ behavior.
Imitating raptorial creatures, you attack with such speed it drives a sonic shockwave.
Your patron weaves the threads of time around the target, giving them some of the benefits of a day's passage.
You continually glimpse into the target's future and nudge fate to guide them toward the best possible outcome.
You instantly transport yourself from one shadow to another.

column1: Shall Not Falter, Shall Not Rout
column2: Calling out the fifth line of the Crimson Oath, you seal your most grievous injuries with a stroke of your blade.
You stay the hand of fate for one not yet destined to die, sacrificing some of your own vitality to heal them.
Taking on a spiritual form, you flash across the battlefield to engage an enemy.
You create one or more glowing protective runes that revolve around you.
You deny a flying creature the support of the air.
Your symphony lifts listeners from their worldly concerns.
You mystically transpose your current location with another.
You focus your sight inside and call on your inner fire to grant you warmth, steady your vision, and soothe your body.
You're concealed against the triggering attack and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against it.
You surround your unarmed attacks with the speed and force of air.
You manipulate the earth beneath your feet to throw your enemies off balance, leaving chunks of rock and rubble behind.
You transform your flesh and organs into a bizarre amalgam of glistening skin, rough scales, tufts of hair, and tumorous protuberances.
You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed.
You focus your magic upon an enemy, wishing for their defenses to fail and turning their strengths into weaknesses.
You unleash your ki as a powerful storm of force and lightning.
You manipulate the target's emotions, potentially allowing you to control it for a brief instant.
You take the form of your ancestral spirits, becoming invisible and quasi-corporeal.
You take the form of a cloud of minuscule ash particles.
You form a link with an ally, allowing you to take harm in their stead.
You attempt to wrest control of a target undead or force it to recognize you as its master.
You utter a powerful secret at odds with the fundamental nature of the target creatures.
You call upon an endless barrage of flames, a series of explosions bursting around you like miniature suns.
When you Cast the Spell, you plunge the required weapon into the ground, where it crackles with crimson lightning.
You gain the ability to perform a specialized combat technique from the vast wealth of martial knowledge your mystery provides.
You transcend your physical form, becoming a beacon of healing energy.
You cast a creature's mind back through time, forcing them to take other paths and make other choices, experiencing countless alternate lives in an instant.
You summon a bridge of radiant, shimmering moonlight.
You enhance a summoned creature with the power of the elements.
Time seems to slow for you, allowing you to strike your opponents mid-move.
You create a shadowy illusion of a creature or a stationary object, but the illusion can exist only in an area of dim light or darkness.
You reanimate the corpse of a fallen creature as an undead minion under your control.
The air speaks to you.
Your body becomes fluid.
Shadows pour forth from your eyes, creating a field of darkness that prevents light from emanating within the area.
You call upon your magic to speed up your attacks.
Your litany calls into question the morals your foe claims to hold dear.
Your litany denounces an evildoer, rendering it susceptible to the powers of good.
Grasping darkness surges from you, dealing 14d4 void damage.
You draw upon your muse to soothe your allies.
You emblazon the target with a fiery sigil that projects your sight and your flame onto them, allowing you and your allies to track their movements and making it easier to hit them.
You create a protective circle around yourself that repels your foes.
You blitz forward so quickly that you soar through the air, and nothing can react to you.
Your unarmed attacks are treated as cold iron and silver, they gain the earth trait, and they gain a +1 status bonus to damage rolls per damage die.
The ground within the area transforms into a mass of dangerous briars that assault and impede your foes.
You make an attack filled with a medusa's petrifying power.
Make a melee unarmed Strike.
You empty your body of substance, becoming one with nothingness.
Drawing from deep wells of spiritual power, you take on a special qi form.
The sky above you darkens in a matter of moments, swirling with ominous clouds punctuated by flashes of lighting.
You feel the most alive when pushed into a corner, as the insights and vision granted by the flame stoke into overdrive.
You wrap enemies in four strands of water.
You jump up to 120 feet in any direction and then deal 18d6 bludgeoning damage to creatures within a 20-foot emanation after you land, with a basic Reflex save.
You call upon the earth and your ki to shield you from your enemies.
Transform your animal companion into an apex form.
You perform music so perfect that the target may die of joy or sorrow.
You shout in defiance and are filled with a burst of healing.
Your performance enraptures listeners, compelling them to follow you.
Rouse the dead or smite the undead.
You create a shell of acid around yourself that immediately bursts outward.
A ray of energy bludgeons your target into submission without causing lasting harm.
You send the target’s mind and body into overdrive, forcing it to become restless and hyperactive.
React to create air for a creature to breathe.
A blast of wind wildly pushes everything nearby.
Be alerted if a creature enters a warded area.
Summon animals to briefly attack adjacent foes.
Command a rope to move and tie as you wish.
Target can carry more.
You grant the target brief foresight.
You evoke a mass of water into the air around your outstretched fist.
Weaken enemies' attacks in an aura around you.
